title: Andaman Emerald Holidays
review_text: we are visit at Jolly buoy Island , Really best Beach at Andaman .coral is amazing, red coral , colorful fish , enjoy aslo snorkling . we are visit through Andaman Emerald Holidays at Andaman Local Expert agent . really good agency at Andaman . recomanded my family and office friends

title: According to the staff, it is home to the second best coral in south asia
review_text:
Only 60 people are allowed to enter this island in a day. Due to prevent more damage, when the Jolly Buoy is accessible, Red Skin remains closed and vice versa. One needs to rely on travel agents or taxi driver to get the entry permit. It was for Rs. 850 pp, I had to pay Rs. 1100/- per person. The drive from portblair is hardly 40min and once you reach the island, you will find that the free glass bottom ride is nothing but a bait to squeeze more money. The free ride is over in 10 min and they won't show you much. Shell out more to see more! The boat which took us to Jolly buoy had middlemen who were forcing us to pay more for spending more time and seeing varied underwater life. The slabs were Rs. 300, Rs. 600 and Rs. 1000 not to mention higher rates for individual boat rides. The higher the amount, the more time you get to spend in a glass bottom boat and the more you get to see. So for a group of 7, excluding the car ride, we spent almost 16k for the entry permit, boat tickets and glass bottom ride. I was a little disappointed as I was expecting much due to the statement by the staff "it is home to the second best coral in South Asia". Most of the corals were damaged and we could see... I was a little disappointed as I was expecting much due to the statement by the staff "it is home to the second best coral in South Asia". Most of the corals were damaged and we could see some here and there. Different shapes and colours and a variety of fishes among others. More

title: The Most Beautiful Island in India
review_text:
If you are going to Andaman, then you must visit this beautiful island called Jolly Buoy. 
World's 2nd best corals after Australia are found here. This beach will surprise you with it's crystal clear water and natural beauty. However, this island is closed for 6 months so that the corals grow. So plan your visit during November - March.

title: Must see place in Andaman
review_text:
If you visit Andaman, you should definitely plan to visit this place. You need to get permit and buy tickets the previous day itself. You should plan well ahead if you plan to visit this place. You can see beautiful corals, star fishes, sea anemones etc in this place. The jetty's start at 7 in the morning. You have to pack breakfast and come to this place. You cannot carry plastic bottles or plastic covers to this place. So plan and pack the food accordingly. 
There was one auto driver who helped us a lot in booking the tickets, his name is Gopal and his number is 9531918600/9933202151. He arranged for taxis to reach this place and also bought tickets. Any one planning to visit Andaman, can contact him. He will provide end to end travel plan and also help in booking government ferry tickets and sight seeing. He made our Andaman trip memorable. More

title: Cleanest beach
review_text: White sandy beach with clear blue water. A must place to visit in andamans. The beach nice for swimming.

title: Must must must visit
review_text:
During our last day on visit to andaman islands, we had an option to visit either bartang, or jolly buoy islands. We opted for Jolly buoy island and bartang travel was too tiring. However, what was to come was a real surprise. 

Jolly Buoy island is one of the 15 preserved islands in andaman. One can visit the island after obtaining necessary permit a day before the travel. Only very limited number of tourists can visit the island daily. One has to first visit wandoor jetty which is an hour drive from port blair. From jetty, one has to take a shared boat which takes more than an hour to reach Jolly Buoy island. 

This is a very small and beautiful island with clearly the best coral formation and cleanest water in andaman. The only activity available here is glass boat ride. However, it is way better to a glass bottom boat in havelock or Neil island. The coral formation and natural beauty is much much better than any other island. One can easily site star fishes, corals of different types, turtles and oysters. 

If you have a spare day in port blair, there is no other match to Jolly Buoy island. Must visit. More

title: Hidden gem
review_text:
Jolly buoy Island is a must visit place to explore the untouched marine creatures fishes and live coral reefs. 
Our auto rickshaw driver cum guide Sadai Gopal cell no. 9933202151 an honest and trustworthy person took care of everything right from getting the permit to taking us to Wandoor beach to board the jetty for Jolly bouy. Glass bottom boat ride of 1 hour per person 1K rupees is absolutely amazing. Not to be missed under any circumstances.

title: Mesmerizing Island
review_text: The excellent and cleanest beach one can visit is the Jolly Beach. Everyone visiting Andaman should include the place in its itinerary. The water there is clear like glass.

title: EXPERIENCE CORAL LIFE THRU' GLASS BOTTOM RIDE
review_text: Prior permission/Permit is needed from Tourist Office located near Air India Office in Port Blair to go to this Island. Boat Tickets also can be had from here. One has to travel to Wandoor Ferry to catch the boat to go to Jolly Buoy/Red Island. Since water is crystal clear and shallow children can go for swimming without any risk. Under water corals/fishes can be viewed thru' Glass Bottom Boat ride by paying extra. Not much crowded due to Permit and restrictions.

title: Corals and the Bay
review_text:
If you are interested in seeing virgin beaches and amazed by marine life and growth, visit to Jolly Buoy islands is a must. The place is open only 6months a year. It's a national marine park and Govt permission is required to visit. Don't have to give up the idea of visit hearing the permission requirement; it's a simple application at tourism department office along with photo copies of identity card of all the members who are visiting. It cost INR 75. Apart from this you need to buy a ferry ticket which is INR 885. This also has to be pre purchased from the same office. Basically remember that you can't just walk onto the island on the same day of your landing in portblair. The ferry point to Jolly Buoy is 32km out of City at Wandoor. They don't allow disposable plastic bottles on the island. So carry a metallic bottle or you can rent one at ferry point. They will give the bottle on deposit of INR 200. The cost of renting is only INR 5. No it's not a typo, it's just five rupees. Pay INR 5 and take the 200 back when you return the bottle. The boat ride from Wandoor to Jolly Buoy islands is 60min. On reaching the island, just before you disembark, your boat crew will make their pitch for taking a glass bottom boat ride with them for viewing corals. It's... If you are interested in seeing virgin beaches and amazed by marine life and growth, visit to Jolly Buoy islands is a must. The place is open only 6months a year. It's a national marine park and Govt permission is required to visit. Don't have to give up the idea of visit hearing the permission requirement; it's a simple application at tourism department office along with photo copies of identity card of all the members who are visiting. It cost INR 75. Apart from this you need to buy a ferry ticket which is INR 885. This also has to be pre purchased from the same office. Basically remember that you can't just walk onto the island on the same day of your landing in portblair. The ferry point to Jolly Buoy is 32km out of City at Wandoor. They don't allow disposable plastic bottles on the island. So carry a metallic bottle or you can rent one at ferry point. They will give the bottle on deposit of INR 200. The cost of renting is only INR 5. No it's not a typo, it's just five rupees. Pay INR 5 and take the 200 back when you return the bottle. 

The boat ride from Wandoor to Jolly Buoy islands is 60min. On reaching the island, just before you disembark, your boat crew will make their pitch for taking a glass bottom boat ride with them for viewing corals. It's offered in 3 tiers of INR 300,INR 600 and INR 100O for varying duration of 15, 30 and 60 min. 
If you skip this, you get dropped on to island straight away from the ferry on the same glass bottom boat. But there's nothing else to do on the island other than gaze at emerald blue waters and the jungle, with thatched seating areas. 

Corals can be viewed only if you take the boat ride. The collection of corals and marine species you will witness is better than what you get to see during Scuba diving. The boat man will be a localite giving running commentary on corals in hindi. So non Indians will rely only on what they see and not hear. 

All in all you will get two hours on the island. There's no watersports or any such activity there. No food stalls or water point. A washroom and changing room is all that is there in the name of amenities. 

You can swim in the sea in a small cordoned of area. The water will beat the swimming pool of any five star hotel. More

title: Mesmerising corals
review_text:
The azure blue crystal clear waters surrounding Jollybuoy are simply perfect for snorkelling. One can see a wide variety of corals, water lilies, sea cucumbers and diverse marine life. Schools of ‘Nemo’ and ‘Dory’ fish never fail to mesmerise children. For those who don’t want to snorkel, glass bottomed boats are available. One can see the corals from these boats. There is a swimming area where one can swim in the perfectly clear waters. If one is lucky, one may be able to see baby fish also. It is indeed a fascinating sight..... 

This pristine island can be reached by ferry from Wandoor jetty, which is about 45 minutes away from Port Blair by car. A special visiting pass is required as this island is in protected marine reserve area and only a restricted number of visitors are allowed per day. The visit timing is also restricted. Since it gets really hot during the day, an early visit is advisable. 

No plastic is allowed on the island, hence one may carry water in flasks. Also, there are no shops or eating joints on the island so it is advisable to get a picnic lunch packed from the hotel and carry it especially if one has young kids. 

A must visit place for seeing undersea marine life. More

title: India's own Great Barrier Reef
review_text: You must include in your Andaman Island program. Best in marine life, corals or just play in the water with your family and friends.

title: Crystal clear Turquoise water. Plastic entry restricted
review_text:
The boat from wandoor will take approximately an hour to reach the jolly buoy. There is a great coral reef surrounding the island. 
There are restrictions to bring plastic covers due to environmental issues and protection to coral reefs. 
Scuba diving and snorkeling facilities are available for some few charges. 
Glass boat ride is astonishing with superb coral reef viewing.

title: So much to keep this island clean !
review_text: You cannot take a water bottle and you have to rent a gourd and no plastic bag allowed obviously. After a nice boat trip in the national park, you reach Jolly Buoy Island to find garbage and plastic bottle. In addition to that, there is a shop which sells ships wrapped in plastic bag. Otherwise the island is very nice but no free snorkling as usual in Andaman Islands.

title: Second to the great barrier reef
review_text: A must visit to this island to see the marine life and corals that you cannot see anywhere else other than Australia. Kids loved it too!

title: The scuba diving in the Jolly Buoy reef is a heavenly experience
review_text: The scuba diving in the Jolly Buoy reef is a heavenly experience among the amazing array of coloured corals and fishes playing with themselves. From the reefs lots of beautiful dry sea shells of creatures and emeralds can be collected, which comes with the waves.

title: Beautiful Corals and very clear water
review_text:
This island is only for Corals and playing in water with no tides. They have reserved an area to play as it is maintained by forest department. This island is part of 15 islands of mahatma Gandhi marine park. Out of those 15 islands, only two islands are open for public. Jolly buoy is open for 6 months from 16 Nov to 15 May. And from 16 May to 15 Nov, red skin island is operational. 
It has India's best coral and world's second best coral. Glass boat is only activity here. 
We could spot sea turtle and many star fish. We had taken one hour glass boat which became bit repeatative in the end.. 
Due to one hour glass boat we got very less time to play in the water. 
It needs 3/4 day to cover jolly buoy island. 
Complimentary glass boat is for 5 minutes. More

title: Place worth for marine life to see
review_text: It is worth to visit the place and learn and experience marine life in glass bottom boat ride. It was a wonderful experience to see corals of different types and clear waters

title: Paradise island
review_text: This island is like paradise on earth. You have to do advance booking for this place. There is limited sit for this place. You get ferry from Wandoor jetty. Place is very beautiful. I enjoyed Snokeing. Best coral place.

title: Must visit: Painted by Nature
review_text:
This is a ABSOLUTELY must go place. You can see 3 colors of water in 20 meter span so you can assume the beauty of this place. This has no beach, no beach activities to be done but still its worth it. It opens only 6 months so make sure you plan accordingly. Coral reefs are beautiful and you can see more than 40 feet clearly with glass bottom boats. It is at par to Maldives and Lankawi in terms of water quality. Light green, turquoise, blue, dark green: All shades of water are clearly visible which is mesmerizing. How to reach: Ask your travel agent/ hotel owner to take permits for you in advance. Cost of them in 880 with GST. Ship sail to Jolly Buoy from Wandoor at 7:30 AM although they mention at 7AM. No good place to eat in Wandoor so bring your own food if possible. Plastic is not allowed on island so you have to give Rs 200 for each milton water bottle (Rs 195 is refundable after coming back). Charges: 880 including GST for reaching Jolly Buoy and 5-7 min complementary glass bottom ride. Extra charges: Rs 1000 for 1 hour 10 min for seeing all 3 coral reefs. Rs 600 for 2 reefs and 400 for single reef for 20 mins. But everyone goes for full ride cuz shelling few extra bucks at this place doesn't hurt. Reefs descriptions: First one is... Reefs descriptions: First one is the biggest and most beautiful. All the colorful fishes, star fish etc are in this place. 
Second one contains mollusk and third one is similar. More

title: sea time
review_text: its an preserved island which is opened for only six months in a year . the island is surrounded by corals and marine life . the island hold second position in world after Australia great barrier reef

title: Total cheating n waste of time
review_text:
The agent will take money in advance(1 or 2 days prior) saying that they need to take prior permissions from forest office 

On final day when one arrives at wandoor jetty they will take u to jolly bouy or red skin island n won’t tell u before boarding the boat 

Both these islands are just 2 kms from wandoor n clearly visible from the beach at wandoor but they will take u through the back waters so slowly to make it a 30 minutes boat ride which is actually just 10 min worth while coming back when they come directly through short route 
The agent will tell u jolly buoy but boat guy will take to red skin island 

Moreover the waiting time is almost 3 hours which is difficult to pass at red skin island 

So pls confirm the Destination before boarding the boat at wandoor 
The taxi charges from port blair to wandoor is Approx ?1500. 
These island are good for those who haven’t seen coral life at Havelock n Neil islands but not meant for those who enjoyed at Havelock More

title: Beautiful Island
review_text: The short boat ride to c the corals. Beautiful small island. We paid 1000rupees for an hrs ride to c the corals which was worth every penny. A must c if u visit port blair

title: Instruction ahead:
review_text: We couldnt see this Island because we did not take the permit a day prior. So beware of it and two day prior if there is any holiday. The ferry for this island is approx. 25kms away from portblair.

title: best place for coral and marine life
review_text: This has one of the best beaches. The glass bottom boat rides were best. The snorkelling and scuba diving was closed when we went.

title: Excellent coral and marine life
review_text:
Its a beautiful island with beautiful corals and amazing variety of marine life. 

I was amazed by the special care taken by the forest department to ensure the pristine island to be pollution free. 

Anyone visting the island should definitely go for a one hour glass bottom boat ride to experience to wide variety of marine life available in the island.

title: Of Course beautiful but you can skip...
review_text:
The Jolly Buoy island open ones in a year so you need to wait and accordingly you need to plan your journey. Of course, it is worth watching but you can easily skip with following reasons.. 
1. Coral and fishes are main attraction there which can be easily seen during your Scuba at Havelock or North Bay or during snorkeling. Further, you can have glass bottom ride at Elephant beach,havelock gives you same feelings. 
2. whole one day is passed to visit so instead of this you can spent one more day at Havelock or visit Baratang Island which is worth to visit. 
3 If you are travelling with Kids it is difficult to manage with limited water and packed food 
Above all,. if you have time, you can visit and also enjoy Wandoor beach bath... More

title: NICE PLACE
review_text: great place to visit one should go.. beauty of nature to exprience .. glass boating on crystal clear water

title: The best thing about The Andamans is "Jolly Buoy"
review_text:
A trip to Andaman without a visit to the Jolly Buoy island is incomplete. Andaman offers you many natural wonders but the best and most picturesque of them is this island. It is open for six months a year from October to March. This is done to maintain the ecology and balance of nature. You are not allowed to carry plastic. Water is to be carried in glass water containers. 
It is a day long trip from Port Blair. you need to take a cab to Wandoor beach and from there a ship will take you to Jolly Buoy Island. On your way, you will cross many islands and the trip is a tribute to the eyes. 
Jolly Buoy is the best place for glass bottom boat ride and snorkeling. The water is crystal clear and is perfect to look for corals. School of fishes are seen here and there and corals of many shapes and kinds could be seen. A wide variety of animal life starting from Sea Cucumber to Octopus can be seen through the glass bottom boat ride. 
Without doubt, its the best place in Andaman and arguably in India. More

title: Scenic place
review_text:
This tourist place is just only not for making money, but harassing tourists. Tourists with young children please do not visit. 
First, you must reach to the jetty by 7 a.m. Its open roughly between 9 a.m. - 1 p.m. Before sitting in the boat all plastic bags has to be removed. A fine of Rs.2000 who found carrying it to the island. 
One has to rent water bottle (very nominal charges Rs.5 only, Rs.250 deposit for one ltr. Bottle). It’s a quite appreciable move, to save the island from plastic garbage. 
It takes hardly 10 min. to see the island, unless one wishes to see the marine life. 
Keep remember, once you go there, cannot come early, even if you do not wish to spend more time there. You must stay there for full time. 
You need sufficient quantity of water considering the requirement, till you arrive back to jetty. Nothing is sold on the island. You need to carry everything with you. 
I have seen desperate people waiting for return boat, without food and water. BUT, I caught many local people carrying plastic bags and water bottles with them, I had fight with security guys on this issue. If you are local, you are allowed for everything. More

title: What a natural beauty
review_text: What a wonderful life time experience !! we took a one hour additional glass bottom boat ride . The boat man took us around 3 islands -- saw so many many types of Coral -- so many types of fishes and other sea animals . i belive this is the second best coral viewing in the whole world -- next to coral reef in Australia .Crystal clear water -- thru glass one can see the corals so close -- as if you can touch and feel them -- what plethora of colours , shape , size -- I very strongly recommend every one to go to Jolly Buoy island . More

title: MUst go.
review_text: This si little far from port blair. You have to take prior permit from the govt to go there. And thats the reason most of the non local travel agents do not even recommend it, But its a wonderful place n trip to Andaman is incomplete without it. No food is available there. U need to get ur food packed from the hotel and then leave early. Ideal place to see starfish, sea urchin, sea cucumber, anemone etc

title: A must visit island
review_text:
Believe me the memories of this island will remain with you throughout your life or till the time you visit again. 
This is one of the most beautiful crystal clear beach I have ever been to. You can easily see fishes swimming with you and see more than 15 feet under water with naked eye. The ferry guy will try to oversell the glass boat ride. Don't get overwhelmed. All the passengers went for it except for our family and I think it was the wisest decision. Swimming on this beach without any crowd was out of this world experience. Carry your swim suit snorkeling kit and swimming goggles and you will surely make good use of it. More

title: Great for glass bottom boat ride
review_text: Amazing fishes and corals to watch while sitting on the glass bottom boat. Avoid taking pictures and enjoy the beauty as the blue glass on the boat does not give good pictures, so enjoy the view as much as you can with your eyes.

title: What an island
review_text: Spotlessly clean, transparent water and great viewing of marine life. We took the underwater viewing glass boat ride and did snorkelling as well

title: One among the most popular excursion from Port Blair is to Jolly Bouy Island from WANDOOR, 30km southwest to Port Blair.
review_text: One among the most loved attraction at the Islands, Jolly Bouy offers travelers beautiful coral views through glass bottom boats. The long white sand beach here is littered with the dry, twisted trunks of trees torn up and flung down by annual cyclones. It is fringed not with palms but by dense forest.

title: Pristine Island
review_text: Jolly Buoy island is one of the most pristine islands near Port Blair. One needs to go to a place called Wandoor and catch a ferry from here. The ferry ride is also quiet interesting as it goes through a marine national park. The island itself is very small with white sandy beach. One needs to carry your own food as there is nothing available on the island. Overall a great place to visit in Port Blair.

title: Nature at its purest
review_text: Wonderful place. Excellent place to see corals. My kid was ecstatic when we got to see nemo fish also during the glass bottom boat trip.

title: Another Island with corals
review_text: Jolly Buoy is having very good coral but they do not allow scuba diving because of crocodiles. You can witness by glass bottom boat only. It is close on Monday so make the programme accordingly.

title: Beautifully maintained island
review_text: A very beautiful island. To reach here u need to get to the place called Wandoor. Frm there you will board a boat that will take you to this island. The boat ride is pretty amazing and scenic view around is very beautiful. The deapth is very steep so you are not allowed to go into the water except for the defined area. Its a very small island and cleaniless of the island has been mantined properly. If u r travelling to these islands you should not miss this little island.

title: Must visit place in portblair
review_text:
This is one of the cleanest beaches, never miss this opportunity if you are visiting Andamans.. They dont allow water bottles and plastic items.... 

Awesome place for Snorkeling, anyone can try but you got to buy the tickets before boating the boat in portbalir

title: My favourite island
review_text: Best place to do snorkelling,view the corals through the glass bottom ride,and just play in the beaches.

title: Must be visit this place.
review_text: Must be visit this place. I really recommend for this place. Ckz this is really nice and beautiful place.

title: Crystal clear water
review_text: Best Place to visit and enjoy the nature. enjoy scenic coral and live hood undersea. enjoyed a lot ...

title: Nice clean beach
review_text:
I was a nice experience but is suggested to those who want to explore coral life throuh glass bottom boat/ snorkelling . 
Snorkelling charges Rs 300 pp, and glass bottom ride varies from Rs 300 to Rs 1000 per pp. in addition to normal boat cost. 

We njoyed trip more cz it rained on our return journey from there otherwise a person is left on that island for 3 hrs if he does neither of these activities and he has no option to play in sea water in scrotching heat. Other than that this island is super clean like that of movies.

title: Awesome Beauty....!!
review_text: Must Visit if you want to see the natural beauty.....clear water..corals....snorkling......there isn't any other things to do on island....the journey to island is very good ...trip to Andaman is not complete without Jolly Buoy

title: Jollybuoy nehi dekha to kya dekha.
review_text: Actually the true essence of Andaman tour lies with this island. The crystal clear water, the changing colours of sea in different layers, the corals see through the water , the chalk white sands , the relaxing beach mesmerizes the visitor. We have booked one trip glass bottom ride for one hour 1000/ per person. Different types of colourful fishes, star fishes, sea orchins, sea lilies, sea feather, different types of corals, and many other sea animals are seen clearly from a distance of even 50 meters. Amazing it is worth of it's price. We have visited the North Bay island but nothing is comparable to Jollubuoy island. I wanted to post the videos and pictures of the corals but this will belittle the true experience , so it is wise to see on your own . More

title: Touristy - but worth a look see
review_text:
I generally avoid these touristy places but Joly Buoy was highly recommended and rightly so. The Island especially the corals is beautiful. It is a tad bit crowded but its organized chaos. The ferry guys will try and sell you a snorkelling and glass boat trip - id suggest the snorkelling as the corals are spectacular. If not then the glass boat also works. The water is extremely clear and not too salty so a dip is totally worth it for the remaining time. 

Note- they do not allow any polythene or plastic on the island. The bags are strictly checked and plastics are removed. Any plastic water bottles are emptied into a school water bottle for a deposit. I think this is an excellent measure as the number of plastic been thrown around by tourists is apalling. More

title: Just fab
review_text: You have to be there to believe it. If you've been to Andaman, and you don't have this in your itinerary, there's nothing much to write home about your vacation.

title: Most beautiful Coral Beach
review_text:
You need to reach to wandoor marine national park by road to visit this beach, from there its 45 mins journey via boat. No plastic is allowed on this island, you can hire water bottles and hand bag after depositing a refundable security. 
Overall this beach is very beautiful with the most amazing live corals you can see, they would provide a complementry glass bottom boat tour however if you want to see more it would be on a chargeable basis which is really good and worth spending the money. 
The beach is good for swimming and relaxing, it has the most crystal clear water in the entire Andaman island.

title: Virgin island in Andaman
review_text: Very beautiful beach with clear water. Very clean beach. Snorkeling is very nice we enjoyed lot in Beach.every One should visit once in a time this island to natural beauty. I suggest to travellers to take advance booking to avoid inconvenience. The glass bottom ride also very nice.

title: Beautiful beyond words! Beautiful beyond imagination!
review_text:
Jolly buoy is an experience of a lifetime. Clarity of water is unbelievable. Glass bottom boat lets you peep into the sea where you will picture numerous types of fishes and corals. I heard it is the second best after The Great Barrier Reef in Australia. Plastic is absolutely prohibited in this area, you even can’t carry disposable bottles instead they rent you water bottles at a reasonable price and also a jute bag to carry your eatables. The water is calm and so the snorkeling experience is better here. There are no water sports activities except snorkeling. This is in order to abstain the aquatic life disturbance. 

They have restricted the number of visitors for a day and this keeps the place quite preserved and also the island is closed for six good months so that the maintenance is taken care of. More

title: Best Coral island
review_text: This is best coral island in India. Limited government boat are visiting this place from Wandoor. Island is very beautiful. This place is good for swimming. This is only for day visit.

title: Nice place
review_text: Nice place if you have time then difinately visit this place .you have to go by boat to visit this place

title: A beautiful island
review_text: We really enjoyed our trip to the island. There were good facilities for changing after swimming. The glass bottom boat was very good.

title: Only Glass bottom boat- but must visit for unadulterated experience
review_text: This a visit undertaken on a boat ride. Its an early morning (around 8am) travel by road to Wadnoor beach which is around 20-25 kms to the south of Port Blair airport. A boat ride from Wadnoor jetty takes you to Jolly Buoy and takes approx. 45 minutes. The view on the boat ride is very pretty and serene. Just short of the island, you are transported onto a floating jetty wherefrom you board the glass bottom boats. The complimentary glass bottom boat ride of 5 min is available to everyone to lure people into taking the paid glass bottom boat ride which costs around Rs.1000/- and is of one hour duration approx. The glass bottom boat ride very pretty and is a must to see marine life in unadulterated for. Since entry to the Jolly Buoy is highly regulated, so, the effects of nuisance due to tourists is not there which makes the marine life available in pure and unadulterated for. The corals are wonderful though most have been badly affected by the tsunami of 2005. The colourful view of the marine life is breathtaking including turtles and sea anemones and nemo. After the one hour ride, you are taken to the island for enjoying the beach. Facilities for changing and washing are available- though they are not very good. But considering the experience you really do not mind it. More

title: My Holiday Trip to Andaman and Nicobar Islands
review_text: I think I have visited a lot of places around the world. Travelling is fun to me and it's very interesting to me.I think Andaman is one of the beautiful Island in India I had ever visited. When I planned for Andaman trip, I was so excited and never thought the trip will be so terrible just because of the service provided by the tour operator Andaman Tour Travel. They help greatly in organising and planning my trip and stays in the place of wonders in Andaman. I think Portblair was the best beach I had ever visited in Andaman. The seafront cellular jail is the main attraction in Port Blair. If anyone planning for an Andaman trip I would say Bhattu Caves and Jolly Buoy are must-see places in Port Blair. And don't miss the coral reef boat ride in Jolly Boy. I would recommend all the viewers to plan for at least a week to stay in Port Blair. There are many hotels which would provide you accommodation at a decent price. Port Blair is a romantic place for couples. Honeymoon Packages in Andaman offers romantic holidays for just married couples. Allover the world I think Port Blair is the best place in India for holiday trips. More

title: The best place for viewing corals
review_text: Has the best corals. Unfortunately we could not Snorkel since there was sighting of crocodiles and snorkeling was stopped. But I would recommend that any visitor add this to their itinerary without fail and take both the glass bottom ride and snorkeling here. The forest department has taken good care of the place and the boat operators are really involved in the explanation of the fishes and the corals and show you all the various marine forms.

title: Great experience
review_text: Excellent experience with glass bottom boat and a highly proper place to go for underwater marine life and is the best place for such a great beauty to see such clarity of water even at the depth of 20to25ft . Better than any other island every body should visit here first to experience the marine life

title: Must visit!
review_text: We did Havelock and Neil but the water in Jolly Buoy was of a different level altogether!! Amazing clarity, super corals and great underwater life. A must do day trip from Port Blair!

title: BEAUTIFUL PLACE ..NOT TO MISS !
review_text:
A must to visit place when in Andaman. You need a prior permit to visit this place . We have arranged the permit and ferry booking in advance through OnlineAndaman.com( just call them they will help you through all the details ). These people will get you the permit to your Hotel one day prior at Portblair if near by to their office( else you may have to collect it ) . The Taxi from Abardeen to Wandoor Jetty and back costed us 1500. 
The ferry ride is approximately an hour to reach this place. Government is maintaining this island to protect the corals and marine life hence few guidelines should be followed ( like no plastic..etc) . 
The Blue serene water is just therapeutic , you can take the glass bottom boat ride 9 charged as per the minutes of ride starting from Rs.300 - Rs. 1000) or choose to play / swim / soak in the turquoise water. We have taken the 1 hours glass bottom boat ride, this included 3 spots with different water creatures , it is fun to watch these aquatic flora and fauna in their natural habitat . 
Heard that Snorkeling is best here but it was closed on the day we went. 
There is one small kiosk serving small refreshments and cool drinks ,, no other food is available . More

title: Must Go Place!!
review_text: If you follow me on trip advisor! I just want to say if you are planning to go Andaman, dont miss this place, white sand still water lovely nature, All the best at their place! Just an advise dont waste time in glass bottom ride will spoil your 1-2 hrs! go and enjoy the unseen nature. My promise

title: Jolly Buoy Island - not to be missed during Andaman visit
review_text: Jolly Buoy Island is the best Island in Andaman to see live Corals. In fact in my view it is better than North Bay Island . The reasons are - 1. The water here is crystal clear and one can see the live corals even with naked eye. 2. There are more live corals, fishes and sea animals in Jolly Buoy Island as compared to North Bay Island. 3. Glass boat ride charges for viewing live Corals are much less as compared to North Bay Island. 4. Comfortable to swim in Jolly Buoy Island. However, it is advisable to do snorkling in Eleffanta beach in Havlock Island since the the masks available at Jolly buoy Island are pipe shaped and do not cover the entire face. Full face masks are more comfortable and are available at Eleffanta beach. Charges are same at both the Islands. More

title: The best area in Andaman to see the Corals and Fishes
review_text:
To me, this place is the best area to see the Corals. We took the best option of seeing coral at 1000 Rs per head and we really enjoyed corals and fishes in a Glass Bottom Boat Ride of 1 Hr 20 Minutes almost. The people who shows those fishes and corals and properly trained to take visitors through each and every minute things. 

Also, the crystal clear water is another attraction for this beautiful island. It has a maximum capacity of 250 people. So arrange this tour well in advance with your travel or tour operator. One needs permit to travel to this location. Don't leave Andaman without visiting this place. More

title: Jolly Buoy
review_text:
Book tickets in advance. this is definitely worth a visit 
Lovely corals 
Do take the hour long boat trip

title: must visit place in Andaman
review_text: it is a must visit place in port Blair , make sure you collect passes before going to this place you can get the passes from the tourist information center in port blare which cost around 150RS/person, many resorts and travel agents arrange the same but have to pay a bit more, and don't miss snorkeling from jolly buoy it is best place in A&N i have been in island for 8 days and snorkeling from diff places but cant find to match this place

title: Nothing to say, insanely beautiful
review_text:
Most beautiful place of andaman islanda. U will feel the energy of clear blue water with corals and fishes. 
Best place for snorkeling.

title: Mesmerizing
review_text: Crystal clear water and absolutely no crowd at all! Any day better than Havelock if Scuba is allowed. Unfortunately, only swimming and snorkeling are allowed here.

title: Excellent Corals
review_text: Main activity here is glassboating as snorkelling was closed. They keep people waiting in queue for about 1 hour at Wandoor. Plastic is not allowed to be carried. Anyways glassboat one hour ride was worth it. Corals and fishes are beautiful and plentiful.

title: Andaman Without Jollybouy Visit Is Not Worthy
review_text:
This is very very mesimerizing Island and the scenic beauty, the clear waters will stay in your mind for a very long time. Things To Do in 3 he's you will be given *Snorkeling - I rate this 10/10 - Anyone can do ( My 51 yr old mom, non swimmer did it) * Glass bottom boat ride - there were 3 package, INR 300, INR 600 AND 1000. We did the 1,000 one totally worth every penny. It was for 1hr 10 mins. The guy explains name of every coral, showed us millions of fishes , sea cucumber,star fish .. u name it and u see it in those Crystal clear water * Pose n chill in the island under nice shahed trees *Swim n play in water which has no waves at all I visited this place with my mom , a friend and friend's Mom. So we were 4 ladies. It's absolutely safe all over Andaman, I have strongly believed that Andaman has Zero crime rate. Now facts about Jollybouy. We left Port Blair around 7am , had asked the hotel guys to pack our break fast as we don't have time to eat. It was a drive for around 20-30mins to reach Wandoor Jetty. Here you have 2 queque, one to entry the boat Jetty and the other to buy water bottle. Plastics are not allowed strictly. Jollybouy is open 6 months in a year n... This is very very mesimerizing Island and the scenic beauty, the clear waters will stay in your mind for a very long time. 

Things To Do in 3 he's you will be given 
*Snorkeling - I rate this 10/10 - Anyone can do ( My 51 yr old mom, non swimmer did it) 
* Glass bottom boat ride - there were 3 package, INR 300, INR 600 AND 1000. We did the 1,000 one totally worth every penny. It was for 1hr 10 mins. The guy explains name of every coral, showed us millions of fishes , sea cucumber,star fish .. u name it and u see it in those Crystal clear water 
* Pose n chill in the island under nice shahed trees 
*Swim n play in water which has no waves at all 

I visited this place with my mom , a friend and friend's Mom. So we were 4 ladies. It's absolutely safe all over Andaman, I have strongly believed that Andaman has Zero crime rate. Now facts about Jollybouy. 
We left Port Blair around 7am , had asked the hotel guys to pack our break fast as we don't have time to eat. It was a drive for around 20-30mins to reach Wandoor Jetty. Here you have 2 queque, one to entry the boat Jetty and the other to buy water bottle. Plastics are not allowed strictly. Jollybouy is open 6 months in a year n we are at the right time there. I m not sure how Redskin is!! We gave INR200 deposit per water bottle,INR 195 was refunded. We had planned well n carried lot if snacks n packed breakfast. 
Once we took the boat, for around 25-30 mins we were sailing through many small small islands and reached Jollybouy. During this boat ride complete breifing abt things to do in Jollybouy will be explained. There is no Jetty in Jollybouy hence once we reach, we will be moved to a glass bottom boat ride for 10 mins free coral seeing and then we get off the island( it's totally tempting for more hence we took the 1000 per head package to see more corals n fishes). 
After reaching the island .. we took a walk around this very very small yet beautiful island , had our breakfast and then did snorkeling. 

The snorkeling staffs were very very professional n kind. They again explained us name of fishes n corals.. took us around for 20 mins and got back. This was for INR 300( Totally worth it). Snorkeling is also available for 600, 1000. I regret not doing them. 

There is changing room n one toilet. There were building a row of toilets wen i was there hence nxt time there will be better facilities. 

There was one small snack counter. We had our own food so dint try them. 

PLEASE DO NOT LITTER, DO NOT CARRY ANY TYPE OF PLASTIC. More

title: Awesome Corals!!
review_text: Visited here on saturday 10th March! Our bad that snorkelling was closed because of crocodile spotting a day before on jolly buoy beach! There was nothing to do as we were not allowed to step inside water hence took glass botton ride. Apart from the 800Rspp for the boat and permit fee from Wandoor jetty to Jolly buoy beach you have to shell out another 1000 bucks pp for the glass bottom boat ride(1hour 20 minutes and 3 reefs), 600 rs pp(40 minutes 2 reefs) 300 rs(15 mins single reef). So if you are going there for some activity please double check before buying tickets. water was crystal clear,corals and fishes abundant.. You are not allowed to carry any plastic items there as this is a protected marine national park and hence no water bottles either but you can get those milton cool thermas kinds at the counter. Coconut water chips and cucumber was available for sale at the beach but please carry food with you. the boat ridetakes about 30-40 mins. So its overall a 3 hour activity. Wandoor jetty is about 25km from portblair airport. the road is in very good condition and is doable on a two wheeler too. We booked a cab through our hotel and pais 2700 for the to n fro journey. Cheaper options may be available if you directly check with drivers. The permit to jolly buoy costs 50 rs and need to... Visited here on saturday 10th March! So if you are going there for some activity please double check before buying tickets. water was crystal clear,corals and fishes abundant.. You are not allowed to carry any plastic items there as this is a protected marine national park and hence no water bottles either but you can get those milton cool thermas kinds at the counter. Coconut water chips and cucumber was available for sale at the beach but please carry food with you. the boat ridetakes about 30-40 mins. So its overall a 3 hour activity. Wandoor jetty is about 25km from portblair airport. the road is in very good condition and is doable on a two wheeler too. We booked a cab through our hotel and pais 2700 for the to n fro journey. Cheaper options may be available if you directly check with drivers. The permit to jolly buoy costs 50 rs and need to be issued either from the tourism office or at the jetty. Its easier and safer to book it a day or 2 in advance. More

title: Wonderful experience watching marine life.
review_text: The trip to Jolly Buoy Island at Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park gave us the opportunity to see the underwater marine life. Sitting on a glass bottomed boat we could see corals, star fish, oysters, many fishes, sea cucumber and many other sea animals. It was once in a life time experience. The tiny Island was full of trees and birds, which were quite friendly.

title: First Snorkelling Experience of my life
review_text: Overwhelming!! Snorkeller / Diver - Arjun has fantastic Knowledge abt Marine life... Trust him and Go for it.. Water is crystal clear!!

title: Pristine under-water life, A once in a lifetime experience
review_text:
A trip to Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park or Jolly Buoy should not be missed when you are travelling Andaman & Nicobar Islands. Since it’s a national treasure the govt. has limited the number of visitors to Jolly Buoy. You need a prior permission (permit) from the Forest Department. There are many ferries trip from Wandoor Jetty (every half an hour starting 7am), but its recommended to reach Wondoor Jetty as early as possible, as all Jetties leave Wandoor by 9am. Jolly Buoy is a plastic free zone, so carrying plastic articles are not allowed including water bottles. One can hire a flask available near the Wondoor jetty gate. Journey to Jolly Buoy is approx. one hour through pristine blue water and thick tropical forest. Jolly Buoy is a small strip of an Island with white sand and clear blue water. This part of Jolly Buoy (a part of Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park) is the hidden under-water treasure with variety of corals, fishes and other marine life. The activities at Jolly Buoy are limited to Snorkeling, Glass Bottom Boat Ride and Swimming at the beach. Swimming at the beach is restricted to a small area. Having done snorkeling, Sea-Walk and Scuba Diving in my previous trips to Andaman & Nicobar Islands, Snorkeling at Jolly Buoy is still to die for. The sheer beauty of under-water life is mind blowing. If you are lucky you can also spot sea turtles... A trip to Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park or Jolly Buoy should not be missed when you are travelling Andaman & Nicobar Islands. Since it’s a national treasure the govt. has limited the number of visitors to Jolly Buoy. You need a prior permission (permit) from the Forest Department. There are many ferries trip from Wandoor Jetty (every half an hour starting 7am), but its recommended to reach Wondoor Jetty as early as possible, as all Jetties leave Wandoor by 9am. Jolly Buoy is a plastic free zone, so carrying plastic articles are not allowed including water bottles. One can hire a flask available near the Wondoor jetty gate. 
Journey to Jolly Buoy is approx. one hour through pristine blue water and thick tropical forest. Jolly Buoy is a small strip of an Island with white sand and clear blue water. This part of Jolly Buoy (a part of Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park) is the hidden under-water treasure with variety of corals, fishes and other marine life. 

The activities at Jolly Buoy are limited to Snorkeling, Glass Bottom Boat Ride and Swimming at the beach. Swimming at the beach is restricted to a small area. Having done snorkeling, Sea-Walk and Scuba Diving in my previous trips to Andaman & Nicobar Islands, Snorkeling at Jolly Buoy is still to die for. The sheer beauty of under-water life is mind blowing. If you are lucky you can also spot sea turtles and octopus, apart from different corals and variety of school of fishes. The farther you go in to the water the merrier and much-much better than Havelock (Elephant Beach) and North Bay Island. If you are not confident enough to go for snorkeling, viewing marine life through the glass bottom boat ride is the other option. Experiencing marine life through glass bottom boat at Jolly Buoy is as good as its seen in the Discovery Channel. More

title: A must visit...
review_text: You have to see it to believe it... It is so beautiful, one of the best and colourful coral reef. Had a very mesmerizing trip

title: Jolly buoy island heaven on earth..(Thanks Raju Bhai for wonderful trip)
review_text:
I visited this place on March 3rd 2018. Nice island well maintained by government plastic free zone. 
Need to take permit for travelling to this island which is around 50 INR. Ferry costs 800 per person . 
Plastic water bottles,covers not allowed need to take water bottles provided by them by depositing 200 INR.which they will refund and collect 5 rupees later. 
Glass bottom ride is must which costs 1000 per hour . 
I met nice gentleman Mr.Raju (Raju Bhai) local taxi person who can take you to all places budget friendly and good guide. Please get in touch with him if you have plans for visit.

title: Excellent place to vies Coral and beautiful fishes
review_text: About an hour drive by boat from Wandoor. Must see corals and beautiful coloured fishes from glass bottom boats. One can do snorkelling to see corals and fishes in clear water of island

title: Heaven on earth
review_text:
If visiting Andaman islands, please take an extra effort to visit this beautiful island. 

The island is accessible from Wandoor jetty, which is about 30 kms from Port Blair city. Since the island is protected under Forests and Environment department, permit from the forest department is necessary for visit. 

Only 200 tourists are allowed per day from morning 7 'o clock to afternoon 2'o clock. But the visit will be permanently etched in your minds. The island has the second largest Coral reef in the world. 

There is only glass bottom ride activity in the island which costs Rs.300 for 20 minutes, Rs. 600 for 40 minutes and Rs. 1000 for 1 hour 10 minutes (per person). The details of the Marine life is well explained by the guide. You will never ever get to see such beautiful marine life elsewhere in India. 

The permit costs Rs.50 per person and ticket to the island costs Rs. 650 per person inclusive of 10 minutes complimentary glass bottom ride. 

No plastic items are allowed to be taken to the island. The authorities provide you with milton bottles at the jetty itself at a refundable deposit of Rs.200 per bottle. however tupperware bottles are allowed. Only one shop is there in the island which sells fruit juice and chips. Washrooms and changing rooms are available. More

title: One of the best preserved marine national park
review_text: Its one of the well kept preserved place for marine life. Its really impressive that the management doesn't allow plastic bottles or food inside the marine park. Lots of coral life and marine life is available to see both by snorkeling as well as through "glass bottomed boats" which is really enjoyable. Well maintained island inside the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. the journey by boat from the jetty to the island is mesmerizing. Its tranquil and has a soothing effect. A must visit place when in Andamans.

title: The best part of Andaman
review_text: Jolly buoy is open for 6 months in a year. Number of tourists per day are restricted to 150 and hence booking in advance is highly advisable. The beach itself is lovely. One can do snorkelling here. We took a glass bottom boat ride. The view of the reef and the multitudes of fish and corals was really amazing. The guide was very knowledgeable. This , for me , was the highlight of my week long tour. I would love to retuen and snorkel. While you are not allowed to touch the corals, and for good reason, you can try and touch the fishes. We saw plenty of clams too. Though natural pearls are very rare now, the re were numerous clams of different colours. My favourite were th sea anemones and the clown fish made famous by the movie, "Finding Nemo". More

title: Disappointing
review_text:
We went here hoping to snorkle. All you are allowed to do is be led by a guide, wearing a lifejacket and holding onto a life ring, while being pulled around. This is certainly not my idea of snorkelling. You allowed to swim in a small roped off area. 
We spent a couple of hours on a tiny beach breathing the fumes from the boats.

title: Must visit
review_text: This place is one of the best for doing snorkeling and glass boat ride in Andamans. Amazing marine life and corals. Water is crystal clear... Best time to visit is Dec-Feb

title: Best in the East!
review_text:
After all the scuba and sea walk if your soul is hungry for more get to Jolly Buoy for snorkeling and you will not regret it! In fact even if you have missed scuba it is highly recommended to do snorkeling here to see the wonders hidden below. Getting to Jolly Buoy is a bit of a tedious process, you first need to reach Wandoor Jetty by road and then take the boats Even before which you need permission from the Forest Department which includes the ticket and Boat which you need to take. The boats all leave in the morning between 730 and 9. Additionally no plastic is allowed to be carried, so make sure you carry your change of clothes etc in a cloth bag. Even plastic water bottles are not allowed, at the entry to the boat you will be given different water bottle (like a flask) in which we can transfer your water, that bottle needs to be returned once your are back to Wandoor. Once you get to Jolly Buoy - the journey is close to an hour you will be transferred to smaller glass boats that will take you to the island. Jolly Buoy is just a very small strip of land but extremely scenic. You can do snorkeling based on your interest, small area or a wider area. The scenes you see down below are mind blowing and you can see all types... After all the scuba and sea walk if your soul is hungry for more get to Jolly Buoy for snorkeling and you will not regret it! In fact even if you have missed scuba it is highly recommended to do snorkeling here to see the wonders hidden below. 
Getting to Jolly Buoy is a bit of a tedious process, you first need to reach Wandoor Jetty by road and then take the boats Even before which you need permission from the Forest Department which includes the ticket and Boat which you need to take. The boats all leave in the morning between 730 and 9. Additionally no plastic is allowed to be carried, so make sure you carry your change of clothes etc in a cloth bag. Even plastic water bottles are not allowed, at the entry to the boat you will be given different water bottle (like a flask) in which we can transfer your water, that bottle needs to be returned once your are back to Wandoor. 
Once you get to Jolly Buoy - the journey is close to an hour you will be transferred to smaller glass boats that will take you to the island. Jolly Buoy is just a very small strip of land but extremely scenic. You can do snorkeling based on your interest, small area or a wider area. The scenes you see down below are mind blowing and you can see all types of fish and corals you have seen on Discovery channel! Carrying snacks / food is recommended as you may not get more than chips / maggi like stuff in the island. Incidentally the people selling also travel by the 1st boat and come back by the last one. More

title: printed by nature
review_text: Must visit the place and excellent island. Can't describe place in word and you can see beautiful coral & fish. Amazing!!

title: Best place for snokring
review_text: If you are in andman dont miss this place...its priceless view ......its 100 times better than scuba ....

title: Beautiful place, must visit
review_text:
Beautiful island, really abundant marine life. I visited this island in the 1st week of Feb and enjoyed the snorkeling here. I had heard that snorkeling had been temporarily stopped. However, it has resumed. It is one of the best places for snorkeling in Andaman and the corals are abundant in marine life.The clarity of the water is also amazing. I had done scuba diving at Nemo reef in Havelock, however the corals and marine life at Jolly Buoy is far better than that at Nemo reef. The only issue is that the time for which the guide takes you to snorkel is not fixed and varies depending on the crowd and if he is in a rush to get other customers. Prices quoted by the guide is based on the marine life that he shows you. Instead suggest you to decide on the price based on the time that you are allowed to snorkel. Prices are typically 600 rs for just 15 mins of snorkeling. As mentioned by others you require a special permit to visit Jolly Buoy island. The agent I contacted was not very keen on getting the permit / ticket for me unless I also booked a taxi to reach wandoor jetty through him. Since I had decided to hire a bike and travel to wandoor jetty, i ultimately had to go and get the permit / ticket myself on the day before the planned trip.... I didn't face any issue in getting the permit/ticket myself from ANIIDCO as there was no crowd at all. More

title: good island for water activities
review_text:
nice island clean and tidy also good for water activities. 
dnt miss the island as its very beautiful

title: Beautiful island in Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park - Andaman
review_text: Good for Glass boat ride! You can also do snorkeling! Very beautiful island!!! We visited in Feb 2018.

title: One shouldn't miss visiting this place on Andaman..
review_text: Amazing place.. Simply beautiful I can say.. The best part was snorkeling. Clear water and mesmerizing marine life to see

title: Jolly buoy Island
review_text: Best visit in andaman, you can't miss it visit it. They allow only 200 people per day and its open for 6 month a year. rest they open Red skin island.

title: Main attraction of Your Andman Trip
review_text: This island remains open for 6 months.This place has best corals.Do try snorkeling here.Pack something to eat before going to this place and no plastic allowed.

title: Best managed Island
review_text: The arrangements made to visit this island were very good. To avoid plastic water bottles water containers were provided on hire. No plastic materials was allowed to be carried to kep island clean and natural as it is not having any people staying there.

title: Nice, clean ,crystal water Beach
review_text:
It is reachable from wandoor jetty via boat. Tickets can be purchased from tourist information center , Port Blair . 
It is a sanctuary which require permission of forest dept, given along with boat tickets at tourist information counter in 2-4 days ago. It costs 800 Rs including permit charge and boat charges. Avoide plastic bottles there as it is prohibited. Take some snacks with you. Half an hour ride from wandoor jetty through boat ferry. 
There you can enjoy snorkeling and simple glass bottom boat ride to see Rich corals and fishes. It costs 300 to 1000 Rs extra. It's small islands and can enjoy sun bathing and sea bath. Changing rooms and toilets are there. More

title: beach awesom
review_text: nice beach hai or ferry se jaa skte hai or activity bhe hote hai ADVANCE booking hote hai clean water

title: Highlight of our visit
review_text: Beautiful island with crystal clear water. Only limited people are allowed each day and hence getting the tickets could be tricky but the place is worth a visit. Was amazed to see how protected the place is, which is a great and rare thing to see. Away from pollution and local people take great care that the island maintains its beauty. You can see the coral beach from top because water is very clear. Snorkeling was closed the day we went so unsure how it would be but would love to go again and do snorkelling there. People of all ages liked this island. (grand-parents to grand-children).

title: Not to be missed!
review_text:
A trip to Andaman & Nicobar Islands would be incomplete without visiting Jolly Buoy Island. This island is a part of the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National park which consists of 15 islands and several islets. This is one of the two islands open for tourists in this park and remains open only for six months. The waters around the island are teeming with marine life and corals. Since only a limited number of tourists are allowed each day, do make sure to get your permits in advance. The boats start early so arrive in time. Most Important - the island is a NO PLASTIC ZONE. So please do not take any plastic with you including mineral water bottles or food packets. Milton water bottles are available for a deposit which can be filled with your own water. The island is 45 min away by boat from the gate of the park. The ride is very serene with mangoves on either side. Once you arrive you can choose to view corals and fishes through a glass bottomed boat or by snorkelling. I would recommend snorkelling as it is an amazing experience. The guides are well trained and keep telling you about the fishes and corals as well.You can also take pictures using your own underwater camera if you have one. There is a small beach with a cordoned off safe area to swim in. The water is not very deep and... A trip to Andaman & Nicobar Islands would be incomplete without visiting Jolly Buoy Island. Once you arrive you can choose to view corals and fishes through a glass bottomed boat or by snorkelling. I would recommend snorkelling as it is an amazing experience. The guides are well trained and keep telling you about the fishes and corals as well.You can also take pictures using your own underwater camera if you have one. There is a small beach with a cordoned off safe area to swim in. The water is not very deep and very clean. 
Be sure to take a change of clothes and lots of sunscreen! There is a small canteen selling snacks at the island as well but please throw the trash only in dustbins. 
Do visit but please do not dirty! More

title: A LIFE TIME EXPERIENCE
review_text: A boat ride of 45 minutes from Port Blair jetty will take us to this island.Remember that plastic is totally and we have to carry water in a flask given to us by the forest dept after depositing a refundable deposit.Any snack we carry are paper wrapped.The water in the sea is crystal clear and we can see the sea bed even at 40 feet deep sea.The boat ride with a magnifying galss bottom left us speechless and amzed in a true sense.The corals are just stunning.The other sport activities like snorkeling are unforgettable.One is tempted to collect the pieces of corals on shore but they are not allowed to be taken out of Andaman. so do not get tempted to collect them...This island is the best of the lot and gives us life time memory More

title: Awesome island and beach
review_text: Jolly bouy island was awesome. Its beach looks like a foreign beach (Karabi). It has crystal clear sea green water and anyone can see colourful marine life during snorkelling and glass bottom boat ride. Perfect place for these activities.

title: This trip is Must if you want to see good CORALS and Undersea Life
review_text:
Very well-organized trips for glass bottom rides, coral reef viewing and snorkelling. The corals are very well-maintained as this area remains closed for 6 months in a year. You get to see a variety of live corals (Colourful ones also) and underwater animals (Colorful fish, sea cucumber, sea urchins, oysters, and so on). There are very strict rules against usage of plastic items. You cannot carry any plastic item to this island. You have to deposit money and get special water bottles from a counter before starting your journey. Never carry any plastic bags or items....your bags will be serached before the boat ride. I was very happy how well they are maintaining this island. To start the trip you have to reach the jetty very early in the morning, say by 6:30 am or 7 am. Some of the guides are knowledgeable and give you a lot of useful and interesting information on Corals and Underwater animals. You don't need to know swimming to snorkell. In fact it is a problem if you know swimming and try to flap your legs and arms.You wear jackets which help you to float and there are guides who hold your hand and take you into the sea for snorkelling.....trust me it is very very safe and there is absolutely nothing to fear. Don't miss this opportunity to view this heavenly sight of the undersea world...it is an experience to treasure and value... Very well-organized trips for glass bottom rides, coral reef viewing and snorkelling. 

The corals are very well-maintained as this area remains closed for 6 months in a year. You get to see a variety of live corals (Colourful ones also) and underwater animals (Colorful fish, sea cucumber, sea urchins, oysters, and so on). 

There are very strict rules against usage of plastic items. You cannot carry any plastic item to this island. You have to deposit money and get special water bottles from a counter before starting your journey. Never carry any plastic bags or items....your bags will be serached before the boat ride. I was very happy how well they are maintaining this island. To start the trip you have to reach the jetty very early in the morning, say by 6:30 am or 7 am. 
Some of the guides are knowledgeable and give you a lot of useful and interesting information on Corals and Underwater animals. 

You don't need to know swimming to snorkell. In fact it is a problem if you know swimming and try to flap your legs and arms.You wear jackets which help you to float and there are guides who hold your hand and take you into the sea for snorkelling.....trust me it is very very safe and there is absolutely nothing to fear. 
Don't miss this opportunity to view this heavenly sight of the undersea world...it is an experience to treasure and value for life time. 

The More

title: Excellent fun for half a day!
review_text:
The tickets need to be bought from tourism office at Port-Blair city in advance. The island is a heavenly place! The corals and the fish are amazing. The water is absolutely clear and turquoise - right out of the beautiful posters of Andamans! 

Snorkeling is way way better than the glass-bottom boat-ride. Get your own snorkeling kit and you can have hours of fun in the waters. Dont forget your swimming gear and change-of-clothes.

title: Amazing coral and sea life - must visit
review_text:
This island is part of the Mahatma Gandhi marine national park and hence a no plastics zone. U will need to carry water bottles in bottles that can be hired from the jetty. Ferry start from around 7am and take 45min to an hour to the island. 

Limited number of boats ply per day and hence each boat spends a few hours on the island before bringing you back. Lot of acitivies such as glass bottom boat ride, snorkleing available and well managed by the boat staff. 

Island has no facilities and It has to be just visited and then return back. You cannot stay overnight there.

title: Jolly Buoy island
review_text: Best island and must visit. It's a day trip and 1 day prior permission required from port blair. Travel agents don't recommend as they r not benefited from this tour . U hav to book direct after reaching port blair.

title: Site of Largest ,beautiful and colorful corals.
review_text: People hs to go to tandoor beach where the high speed boat for Jolly buoy is available.wandoor is around 40 km from port Blair and can be reached by road.Taxi is the best available mode of journey.From Wandoor high speed boat is available.Taxis generally charge 1500/- for to and fro journey.Costof boat ticket is 750/- per person .It is easily available in Port Blair.Boat generally take 45 minutes to reach Jolly buoy.people can't take plastic article to Jolly buoy. There is no any shop for etables .So people have to take it along with them.Glass bottom boats are available for 600 Rs where one can see the colourful corals and fishes at the see bottom.Water here is crystal clear More

title: Jolly trip
review_text: Visited last week of december. As the name suggest it's a jolly trip full of buoyancy. Must visit place. Clear water, exciting corals view during snorkeling.

title: best island in andaman
review_text: this is a memorable beach in my life.what a beautiful views in this beach.water is crystal clear and green and blue.there is a time limit in the beach.

title: CORAL ISLAND
review_text: Best island to view coral and fishes. Advise to pay the Govt. approved rate for Glass Bottom Boat riding. A life time experience.`

title: HOTEL GB OCEANIA is the highlight of our family tour
review_text: Our tour was failure as the weather in Andaman was not supportive during our visit. But the GB Oceania substituted our happiness by giving the best service. Good, clean, well furnished and spacious rooms, dedicated and loving staffs, Wonderful restaurant, Best in Andaman Banquet Hall etc. We will visit again next year

title: The most memorable experience!
review_text: Snorkelling at the jolly buoy island in the Andamans is an unforgettable experience. For my 12 year old son it was the memory of a lifetime. A must do once in your life!

title: Excellent... Lifetime experience
review_text:
Jolly Buoy island is open 6 months in a year. And if this island is open during your visit, please don't miss it. 
As the tag line for this island... Jolly Buoy, painted by nature. It is really so. 
The colour of water and marine life is amazing. All should experience glass boat ride and snorkeling here.

title: Beautiful corals
review_text: This island comes under mahatma Gandhi marine national park. We took the first ferry which was scheduled to start at 7am. It returned by 1pm. No plastics are allowed in this island. It has to be just visited and then return back. You cannot stay overnight there. It is a small island. You need to take permit before visiting this island. No plastic bottles allowed but Tupperware bottles can be taken. When we went only glass bottom ride was available. We took the 1 hour glass bottom ride for 1000/- per person. The corals are worth seeing.

title: Crystal clear waters
review_text:
A small island about an hours ferry from Wandoor jetty. 
Great place for some coral viewing through glass bottomed boats. 
Snorkeling was not allowed when I visited, maybe it had just been opened for the tourists. 
Water is crystal clear....one can view a variety of corals along with fishes. 
Carry your own snack items as nothing is available there and please don't litter.

title: "Good Corals but dont go if Snorkeling is stopped"
review_text:
Before planning a trip please ensure that you have obtained the requisite permits. Due to a recent crocodile attack in Wandoor only activity available here is Glass Bottom ride. Snorkeling and Swimming was prohibited when I went so please check before you go because going this far for only glass bottom ride is not worth it. 

The trip starts with a boat ride from Wandoor jetty which takes us through amazing scenery. Try to cath the morning ferry. 
Jolly Buoy is a National Park so don't expect any water sports activity here. But the place is rich in corals much more than what you see in Havelock or Neil. The complimentary glass ride is not much and you have to pay if you want to see more. 
Don't carry plastic. They provide water bottles on rent which have to be returned while you come back. More

title: Excellent island
review_text: Very nice place to visit. Generally 06 months remain closed for coral grow. You are take permission for this visit and per head boat charge Rs.800/-. Polythin & plastic bottle etc not allowed so you are to hire milton type bottle at the entrance with refundable amount of Rs 200/- for each bottle. Must take the original I-card with the permit for entry. In andaman best coral and species are seen with bottle glass boat so try to visit this place on 2nd day because if you visit there and utilize the bottom glass boat [Rs.600 per person] then no other place under water view is required or better than here. It is small island and only limited area is allowed. Better to start before 9 am and same boat returns at 1 PM or so. You can take bath here also, very clear water. More

title: Best place to view underwater live corals
review_text: This is very small island which is a part of Gandhi National Marine Sanctuary.The ride to Jolly Buoy Island gives you a complimentary glass bottom boat ride..But after watching one cant resist the view of Starfish, Oyesters, Sea Cucumber, Sea Anemones, Clown Fish(Nemo), and other corals, These will come on a package of Rs. 1000 per head of Glass Boating. If anybody is lucky then one can see turtles and Dugong (Andaman's State Animal.". The crystal clear water will make you very live and insist to go to see corals and underwater sea creatures.One who visit Andaman please don't miss to go to Jolly Bouy Island.

title: A gem to visit
review_text:
This is very small island which is a part of rajiv gandhi national marine sanctuary.. 
They take u by boat to this place..!! 
Water bottles are not allowed here..!! 
The water is crystal clear and it’s worth visiting this place for nature lovers..!!

title: Best place for snorkeling
review_text: They have 6months snorkeling in jolly buoy and 6months in red skin.make sure to check with agents about the best time to visit .it was by far the best experience in whole of Andaman trip.do not miss this.swimming in free ocean ,it's like watching Nemo movie in live theatre

title: Great glass bottom boat ride and snorkelling
review_text: The glass bottom boat ride is surely the best thing to do here. Snorkelling and scuba diving are better off in havelock but they give you star fish in hand during snorkelling.

title: Amazing
review_text: Must to see, look like a horror place but amazing. deer, peacock are there. there is a little cafe but they offer delicious food in right price.

title: a must go
review_text: To reach this island we need to travel for by a steamer from Wandoor ferry and then in a small boat. It is very pleasant journey . It is the best place to view amazing underwater beauty of creatures through glass bottom boat ride.You can view the underwater corals and variety of fishes through crystal clear water. Its beyond descriptions!!! Those who opted for snorkeling,completed their performance here. Price was not so high. Plastics are not allowed here.

title: Sagar darson
review_text: It is small and very neat and clean island, it is must visit place if you r visiting port Blair. Prior permission is required to visit this island with boat ticket of 850, one of the best coral available here you can do glass bottom boat ride and snorkeling here.

title: An offbeat place
review_text: It takes an entire day to visit this place. its near the wondoor beach. All kinds of activities are available here too

title: excellent beach with good coral life.
review_text: The journey to this beach is awesome, its a very good and clean beach, the water is very clear. its a paradise for snorkeling.lots of underwater life. Its a must visit destination

title: Beautiful Island
review_text: A Good Island to perform the activities available in the tour. We had bottom boat ride, scuba diving, snorkelling

title: One of the best in Andman
review_text: Before reaching this beach do not forget to buy the boat tickets to reach this beautiful island. The glass bottom boat ride is a beautiful things to do.

title: Open for 6 months so hurry up if you are in luck
review_text: It is an amazing place our driver told us to be, with corals and all underwater and overwater activities but alternately opens between Redission Beach and this. You would like to select this one if you have a choice.

title: Do Not Miss!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review_text: You should not miss this place. It is a small island tucked away in the Mahatma Gandhi marine National Park.You should enjoy glass-bottom boat rides.Awesome view from this place.

title: charming place to visit
review_text: beautiful place to visit. Loved the white beach and colorful corals. Though it took time to reach there, but was worth visiting the place

title: One place that must not be missed
review_text:
Don't miss this place when u r at Andaman." Mostly this will not be included in ur tour package" 

** PLEASE ASK UR TOUR OPERATOR TO INCLUDE JOLLY BUOY IN UR PACKAGE** 

To reach jolly buoy island u should book ur ticket(cost 850-1000) at least two day before during peak season. the tickets include entry permit to national park, boat ticket, free 5 min glass boat ride etc., . From wandoor u have to take a boat ride for 30-45 min to reach jolly buoy.(Blue Paradise) where u can see thousands of fishes, corals, etc 
Note: 
U have to reach wandoor around 0800 
If u book the ticket u can bargain by bypassing the tour operator's commission 
Plastics are banned inside national park U can rent a water bottle for 100INR near Boarding area 

Sick: Andaman works on commission/brokerage More

title: Pristine Beach & Best place to Snorkel
review_text: To reach this island we need to travel for nearly 2 hours in a small boat from Wandoor beach. It is very pleasant journey were you can see thick forests on both sides. It is the best place to view underwater beauty through glass bottom boat ride.. Snorkeling is excellent here(One can spot many turtles and variety of fishes(including Nemo(clown fish))). You'll be definitely allured by the underwater corals.. One can opt for a combo of Glass bottom boat ride and Snorkeling at cheaper price. Plastics are not allowed, even water bottles. You need to get themo flask at the counter by depositing certain amt during the start of journey. More

title: This place is really awesome and good for water sports activities.
review_text: This place is really awesome and good for water sports activities.Also you can get awesome coral view.

title: Must Visit in Andamans
review_text: Jolly Buoy Island is the most beautiful and clean Island in whole Andaman. Water is very clean. One can definitely fall in love with this island. Give one whole day. Please do not vanish the island with garbage and plastics while you visit. There are very rare island like jolly buoy which are very neat and clean. One can enjoy true nature on the island. Go for snorkeling here. Do free glass boat riding, do not go for paid glass boat riding. Return with full satisfaction.

title: coral island
review_text:
jolly buoy island is known worldwide for 2nd largest corals after australia great coral sea 
. 1 hr boat ride from wandoor jetty . try to get ticket from tourism directorate . 7am journey is the best option as you will reach jolly buoy by 8-8.30 am ..... glass bottom coral safari , is really awesome

title: Must visit place in Port Blair
review_text: The boat to jolly buoy starts from 8 am. You must reach the jetty at 7am. They will not allow any plastic water bottle or plastic packet. But they will allow you to exchange a water flux for a deposit. On your return from Jolly buoy you hand over the water flux and they will return your money. In a day there can be max of 358 visitor at jolly buoy. It is opened for 6 months. From 15th May it is closed for 6 months. We were lucky to visit on 13th. the boat trip was around 40 minutes. once you reach jolly buoy then you get to see corals in the glass bottom boat. If you pay more they will show you more. You can also snorkell but no underwater photography of coral. The water is turquoise blue. Best time to go is Dec & Jan and you will see more corals. take your food as nothing available on the island. More

title: Wow! is the word
