review_text:
Must visit, you will get the feel of abroad location in India. Its a so clean. You need to arrive at the place at 9:00am to catch the ferry. You will get just 2 hours on Island. Must do glass bottom boat ride. 

I really fell in love with the place.

title: Corals, Fish Pearl and Crystal Clear Water !
review_text: This place is amazing If you don't have any idea about corals, fish and how pearls created. If you are visiting here do full glass boat ride not only complimentary because this will give you more chance to see amazing creatures under water. Very little in terms of refreshments available, and plastics are not allowed, so make sure you are hydrated and fed.Tupperware water bottles r allowed to be carried if u don't want to take the Milton Water bottles provided. If you are visiting Anadaman in summer you will find this place hot. Its worth to visit here.

title: Angelic Island with Pristine Beauty and Amazing Marine Life
review_text:
Jolly Buoy, one among many uninhabited islands, is certainly worth your time. The government has taken special care of the island to preserve its beauty and charm. Its marine life, pristine beauty, clear water, white sand, no pollution and less crowd give you the fulfillment of luxury and the pleasure of the marine life and the corals. After a pleasant motor ride to the island, you will step into a small boat for a ride. This 10 minute boat ride gives enough indications of the spectacular marine life, available, at the island even at the 20 feet below the surface. 

The government has allowed only Snorkeling and glass bottom boat ride on the island to maintain the coral lives. Even the island remains close for 6 months to allow corals to grow without any unusual harm. As it’s a plastic free zone so carrying a plastic bag is a big no. Locals follow the laws quite strictly to maintain & preserve the beauty of the island. Hence all the efforts, of the Government and the locals, have contributed in maintaining the island’s angelic beauty. More

title: Great place to see corals - but little else
review_text: If you want to see great corals and sea life, this is the place to be at! Take a glass boat ride, avoid snorkelling. This is the place to see corals, but if you have done the sea walk at Elephant already, you might want to skip this. Very little in terms of refreshments available, and plastics are not allowed, so make sure you are hydrated and fed. The longish boat ride may be a dampener too. Need permissions/tickets to visit, so plan in advance

title: Crystal clear water...good place to see corals
review_text: Visited jolly buoy island yesterday..... Tupperware water bottles r allowed to be carried if u don't want to take the Milton Water bottles provided...for Indian standards? it's very expensive...750 rs fr to n fro boat ride....coral watching in glass bottom boat fr 600 rs an hour... snorkeling @ 300,500 and 1000 under categories of what u can see...boats start from wandoor beach @ 7 am...be there before...prior booking required n tkts r non refundable..permit to stay on island fr less than 3 hours only... strictly no plastic bags allowed.

title: Incredible and Eco friendly
review_text: My husband and I both enjoyed the fact that preserving the island is a top priority here. They really did seem to care and take great cautions on limiting plastics and garbage on the island. That was quite reassuring. The snorkelling was amazing!! This was the first place we snorkelled so we didn't know how much things would cost- I can't help but feel that the pricing strategies there are a little bit ridiculous. They charge you way more to go out further but it really isn't much more time I feel that you get for that money. If you can convince the guides to let you go out on your own, you're better off. Either way incredibly beautiful – we would go back with our own scuba equipment next time. More

title: Must visit island
review_text:
The most beautiful island for coral viewing in Andamans, it has 3 different reefs of coral. Only one is allowed for snorkeling whilst rest 2 can only be viewed through glass-bottom boats. Part of a marine park and so Govt has attempted to preserve the corals. 
Permit and boat tickets were arranged by our driver, as only 6 boats (200-250) people are allowed to the island each day. Reached Wandoor jetty at 7am and left for Jolly Buoy at around 8 in a boat. 45 min glass bottom ride at extra cost of 600 is absolutely worthwhile with the guide patiently explaining the different types of corals and sea animals. Started back at around 12 pm. 
Nothing much available to eat so carry your own food and water. More

title: Best place to explore coral life
review_text: This is one of the best place to see the coral life and variety of fishes and see animals. A must visit during trip to Andaman.

title: To get a taste of coral reef...
review_text:
Features: Plastic not allowed. Have to deposit Rs 200 per thermoflask for carrying drinking water. On return from the island, this amount wl be refunded & only rs 5/- is kept as charge per bottle. Jute bags can be availed by deposting rs 100 as deposit, for carrying wet cloths. Ferry leaves from Wandoor jetty(30 min ride from port blair) betn 7:30-8 am. Hv to report at around 7am. Bag frisking wl b done & any plastic bags, chips etc,if found, wl not b allowed to be taken. Pass & ticket for Jolly buoy hs to be taken from ANIIDC Tourism office(near court,port blair) hv to be taken in advance. Fee is Rs 750 per head. From Wandoor to Jolly buoy by ferry it takes almost 30 min. Food as such is not available at JB. Chips, cakes,juice are sold for light refreshment. Breakfast cn be packed from hotel and taken to wandoor and u cn eat it before reaching JB. Best placefor snorkeling and glass bottom ride( scuba and sea walk facility not available). Coral life and various fishes cn be seen from close. Charges for snorkeling are rs 300, 500,1000. Suggested one is rs 1000 which they give away at rs 750 per person. Swimming is not required for doing snorkeling. A guide goes along with u and he shows different corals and fishes. He wl bring shells, sea cucumber, star fish etc from the shallow bottom and... Features: 
Plastic not allowed. Have to deposit Rs 200 per thermoflask for carrying drinking water. On return from the island, this amount wl be refunded & only rs 5/- is kept as charge per bottle. Jute bags can be availed by deposting rs 100 as deposit, for carrying wet cloths. 
Ferry leaves from Wandoor jetty(30 min ride from port blair) betn 7:30-8 am. Hv to report at around 7am. Bag frisking wl b done & any plastic bags, chips etc,if found, wl not b allowed to be taken. 
Pass & ticket for Jolly buoy hs to be taken from ANIIDC Tourism office(near court,port blair) hv to be taken in advance. Fee is Rs 750 per head. 
From Wandoor to Jolly buoy by ferry it takes almost 30 min. 
Food as such is not available at JB. Chips, cakes,juice are sold for light refreshment. Breakfast cn be packed from hotel and taken to wandoor and u cn eat it before reaching JB. 

Best placefor snorkeling and glass bottom ride( scuba and sea walk facility not available). 
Coral life and various fishes cn be seen from close. 
Charges for snorkeling are rs 300, 500,1000. 
Suggested one is rs 1000 which they give away at rs 750 per person. Swimming is not required for doing snorkeling. A guide goes along with u and he shows different corals and fishes. He wl bring shells, sea cucumber, star fish etc from the shallow bottom and wl let u touch n feel it. 

Good experience! Not to be missed... 

Changing room is there but no locker facility. More

title: The "guides" themselves are ruining the reef, by walkign over the coral
review_text: The "guides" themselves are ruining the reef, by walkign over the coral. Despite the facade pretending they try to protect it all, the guides themselves walk over the reef and corals while dragging along the tourist.

title: Best corals and fish
review_text: Plastic not allowed , about 90 min ride from port blair through mesmirizing scenic beauty..very good glass bottom ride (10 min free with boat ticket) , snorkelling is best- just do it

title: Nature's paradise
review_text: This is an absolute must-go if you are in Andaman islands. You need to book a ferry ticket at least one day before. It is a half-day activity including to and fro travel. Once in the island, please do additional glass-bottom boat (Rs 600 per head) to see amazing corals. Jolly Buoy corals are the best in andamans... much better than North Bay. You can also do snorkelling (Rs 300 or Rs 500 per head).

title: Best place to view Corals!!
review_text: Island with crystal clear blue waters and this make the visibility of corals excellent. Had a great time in snorkeling.

title: Must place to visit when you are Andaman
review_text: Best place to see underwater corals and marine life. Definitely better Marine life to watch than North Bay and Havelock. Best place to do Snorkelling at Andaman also take glass boat ride. If you don't do Snorkelling and Glass boat ride then better to stay at Port Blair as travelling is in a slow boat for 1 hour which is tiring. Best places water sports – Sea walk at North Bay, Scuba at Havelock and Snorkelling at Joly buoy.

title: Must Visit Place
review_text: Jolly Bouy Island is the cleanest (as its protected place by Forest department) place in Andaman. Must visit place for Snorkling.

title: Must Go
review_text:
Truly untouched paradise. You can visit this place in half day. 
Before going there make sure you have Pre-book ferry ticket with special permit which is must to visit this island. I guess daily approximately 150 permits they provide. You can catch any local travel agent to book this (750 rs PP ferry ticket + 50 rs Permit Charges). You can spend max 3 hours on this island. It closes after 1 or 2PM. 
Don miss glas bottom ride & snorkling here.

title: Excellent experience
review_text:
Jolly Buoy island is one of the most serene beach we have visited till date...It's about 30 mins drive from Ferry from Wandoor...It has the best snorkelling in Andaman and the corals are probably only second to Australia...Don't miss the Glass Boat ride...It's worth all the time and money spent..Overall must go... 

Carry enough water as this is a conserved island and that's the beauty of it..No plastics..We had super fun..

title: Crystal blue waters
review_text: Jolly Buoy is a three hour ride by ferry. You can catch it from Wandoor. It is one of the best places to view corals.

title: Lacks basic infrastructure
review_text:
The tourists are taken by ferry to indulge in activities like snorkeling, coral watching etc. The ferry journey is tedious , involving long waits, queques, which is unnecessary. 
The island does not have provision for drinking water, and in the name of conservation things have been messed up totally. 
The ferry passengers are made to wear dirty , suffocating life jackets which is torturous, to say the least. It is like making passengers in airplane sit with inflated life jackets.

title: Must come in top 5 attractions of the world
review_text: I have visited so many beaches around the world, will keep it on the top of list. Must see underwater corals and fishes.

title: One of the best Nature maintained Location
review_text: One of the best Nature maintained Location, Plastic is banned on this island.Island is having Water sports activity ( Glass Boat Ride and Snorkeling) . Recommended do visit place

title: Awesome place to visit
review_text: It's part of the mahatmas Gandhi national park and as all parks have a nominal fee so does this one rs50 per head only. The boat ride to the island is extremely pleasant and we were able to spot a crocodile or two along the way near the smaller islands enroute. The boat ride costs approx 700 to 750 rs per person which can we booked through an agent as we did. The island is marvellous with Cristal clear waters which is ideal for snorkelling or glass bottom boat rides both of which are available at the island . Beware plastics are not allowed on board the boats or the island so do carry alterative ways to cart water refreshments etc. There aren't any shops etc on the island so ur basically on ur own were food etc is concerned. More

title: A small island, where everything is Restricted
review_text: It's a nice place to visit, but from swimming to snorkeling is restricted by administration. If you are not visiting Neil or Havelock Island, this is a must. Else if you have a day to spare.

title: Activities
review_text:
This island first of all had some of the most gorgeous shells that I had ever seen. 
There is snorkeling and glass bottom boat ride. The boat ride was amazing and as you go you can see the corals and fishes clearly swimming below you. 
Snorkeling is amazing too, there aren't many good corals but there are amazing fishes and the beach is amazing to sit and chill at.

title: Tranquil and serene Island
review_text:
Surrounding of this Island is rich in coral and marine life, Calm Beach, Clear Water, Good place to do snorkeling and Glass bottom Boat rides. Jolly buoy and Red Skin island are opened for 6 months alternatively in a year to protect live corals, so before planning, make sure that Jolly buoy island is open for visitors. Please Note - When its open for visitors, its closed on Mondays - so plan accordingly. To visit this island, you need permit, either have an agent book permit for you or go early to get the permits, its issued right in front of the Wandoor jetty 30km southwest to Port Blair. This island is No plastic zone, so your bags will be checked for that, if you have a any plastic in your bags, for each plastic items, you have to pay Rs 100/- on bring back those plastic items back your money will be returned. Even Plastic water bottles are not allowed so you can get thermos water bottle at the office by depositing Rs 150/-, which will be returned on returning the bottle. After an hour long boat ride, you will be taken to Jolly Buoy, complementary glass boat ride of 10 mins is included in the ticket, if like to do complete ride, you can do it for additional Rs 600. Then you can explore the island or do snorkeling (you have to pay Rs 1000/- for 30 mins).... Surrounding of this Island is rich in coral and marine life, Calm Beach, Clear Water, Good place to do snorkeling and Glass bottom Boat rides. 

Jolly buoy and Red Skin island are opened for 6 months alternatively in a year to protect live corals, so before planning, make sure that Jolly buoy island is open for visitors. 
Please Note - When its open for visitors, its closed on Mondays - so plan accordingly. 

To visit this island, you need permit, either have an agent book permit for you or go early to get the permits, its issued right in front of the Wandoor jetty 30km southwest to Port Blair. This island is No plastic zone, so your bags will be checked for that, if you have a any plastic in your bags, for each plastic items, you have to pay Rs 100/- on bring back those plastic items back your money will be returned. Even Plastic water bottles are not allowed so you can get thermos water bottle at the office by depositing Rs 150/-, which will be returned on returning the bottle. 

After an hour long boat ride, you will be taken to Jolly Buoy, complementary glass boat ride of 10 mins is included in the ticket, if like to do complete ride, you can do it for additional Rs 600. Then you can explore the island or do snorkeling (you have to pay Rs 1000/- for 30 mins). You wont get any thing in the island, so you have to carry any food or water you need. you can explore island for 3 Hrs once you reach there, by 2PM/2:30PM last boat will leave the island. More

title: Must visit beach in Andamans!
review_text:
It is the cleanest beach around with good corals and aquatic life. This island is open only for 6 months It is a part of Mahatma Gandhi National park and you need prior permit to visit this place (Rs 50 per head ) . The boat takes around 50-60 mins to reach this place from jetty and they charge around Rs750 per head(including complementary glass bottom ride) . You could do snorkeling there as well along with additional glass bottom ride. You stay in the island for around 2-3 hours. Few things to keep in mind : 
1) you are not allowed to carry plastics. So you could rent Milton bottles or jute bags at a nominal charge (Rs.200 per piece as refundable security and they charge around Rs5 or Rs10 per piece once you return) 
2) Ensure that you carry photo Ids of all the people travelling More

title: too touristy
review_text: Go for it if you got one full day. A small island opened only for 6 months, have some serious Marine life. For doing snorkel, you have to SIT or play in water for your turn..the wait may lasts for 1hr 2hr can't say..as they have 3 or 4 guides only for the entire 50 people present in the island.

title: Rich coral & an island painted by nature !
review_text: It's a must visit Jolly Buoy Island for a traveler in Andaman. Near Port Blair, its radius is 1.72 square kilometers. Take forest permission and boat fare totaling Rs.1000/- from counter. No plastic zone! For seeing coral in sea bed - no need of scooba diving ! You can experience the rich treasures of sea from a magnifying glass bottom boat - costs Rs. 600/-. The very beach ranks second in the world! Love it! But it remains open for 6 months in a year!

title: Awesome island!
review_text: Crystal clear water. You can clearly see fishes and coral in the water. Very good ambience. There are few water sports activities. Snorkelling is a must try here.

title: Second best thing to do in Andaman after Radhanagar beach
review_text:
Jolly buyo island , really your heart will go jolly here when you see this island for the first time, very small but very beautiful island. It is must visit place. 
This island is opened for six month only and for next six month red skin island opened , so check before going there. This island is one of the 30 island which is part of mahatama gandhi marien national park. 
Ferry go here in the morning time fro 6 am and last ferry will be back at around 3 pm. But you have to go and come back in same ferey and you have only 3 hr to stay there. You have to take permission from forest department to go here which is included when you take ferry tkt. 
Here you can do two thing which is glass bottom boating, and snorkling . Both are best here because water is very clear and and marien life is also best here as this is preserved island. 

I recommend to do snorkeling and glass bottom boating here only rather than any where else in andaman as it ranked 2nd in the world only after great bareer reef in Australia. More

title: Clear waters and clean sand
review_text: This is in Marine National Park at Wandoor beach. It takes about 45 minutes from Port Blair. Forest dept issues permits and a copy of ID proof is required in order to obtain the same. Our Driver did the job for us. The fee is Rs 50/- per head. I saw some people buying their permits at the counter on the beach. From here the Jolly Buoy boats ride is to be taken. It's a one hour smooth journey. The boat ride ticket is Rs 750/- per head. Plastic water bottles have to be deposited and the water has to be refilled in the water flasks given at the counter. Deposit is Rs 200 per bottle. Sealed snacks or plastic containers are allowed but plastic bags to be kept in the car. When we reached the island we were transferred in a smaller boat with glass bottom. A 10 minutes coral ride is included in the boat ticket. But the marine life is so colourful and enchanting that we opted for an additional 45 minutes ride @ Rs 600 per head. And we were glad we took it. It's once in a lifetime experience! Those who wish to do snorkeling can do it here. There is a small shop for drink/snacks but when we reached nothing was left. Luckily we had taken eatables with us. The boat returns by 3 pm. There are couple of hotels at the beach to... This is in Marine National Park at Wandoor beach. It takes about 45 minutes from Port Blair. Forest dept issues permits and a copy of ID proof is required in order to obtain the same. Our Driver did the job for us. The fee is Rs 50/- per head. I saw some people buying their permits at the counter on the beach. From here the Jolly Buoy boats ride is to be taken. It's a one hour smooth journey. The boat ride ticket is Rs 750/- per head. Plastic water bottles have to be deposited and the water has to be refilled in the water flasks given at the counter. Deposit is Rs 200 per bottle. Sealed snacks or plastic containers are allowed but plastic bags to be kept in the car. When we reached the island we were transferred in a smaller boat with glass bottom. A 10 minutes coral ride is included in the boat ticket. But the marine life is so colourful and enchanting that we opted for an additional 45 minutes ride @ Rs 600 per head. And we were glad we took it. It's once in a lifetime experience! Those who wish to do snorkeling can do it here. There is a small shop for drink/snacks but when we reached nothing was left. Luckily we had taken eatables with us. The boat returns by 3 pm. There are couple of hotels at the beach to have breakfast/lunch. Original ID cards are checked before boarding the boat. One can see the remarkable shades of blue and green waters of the sea here. And of course the variety of colourful fish and coral under the clear still waters is a MUST treat for the eyes. More

title: Awesome is the least word
review_text: It was unreal for an Indian place. No littering.. Crystal clear water. Hats of to the Andaman tourist authority for keeping it so clean. The best thing we did in our trip. Don't miss it. We hired a two wheeler and kept at the wandoor jetty. So that you can save your car hire. Take the permit one day in advance. Take the pain to reach and you will not regret. Do Snorkelling. And go for the 500rs Snorkelling which is larger and is worth the penny. Coral is really good.

title: Must visit place to spot some beautiful corals in crystal clear water
review_text: Jolly Buoy Island and Red skin island are part of 15 island which can be visited with prior permission from forest department. These two islands are opened alternatively to preserve the corals . It is a totally plastic free zone. Before we get into the boat people the forest department provides water bottles for refundable amount of 200/- . Once you are back from your trip to island you can collect it from the counter and you will get the money back. To visit the island please carry original ID proof and permit from the forest department.Permit cost is 750/- per person. From Wandoor jetty it is about 40 minutes journey by boat and after 3 hours you need to come back in the same boat . The island is open till 3 PM. You are allowed to do glass bottom ride and snorkeling only. Red skin island is supposed to have the best corals in the world after Australia . We did both the activities to experience the beautiful marine life . Before you get down from the boat there is a guide who will explain you the dos and don'ts, rates for different activities etc. There are changing room, seating places available in the island. Must visit if you are in Portblair , you will get to see some beautiful coral and marine life . More

title: A Must See in Andamans
review_text:
Its a very small but most beautiful island off Port Blair, it takes more then one hour drive from Port Blair to reach the jetty and then about 50-60 minutes to reach Jolly Buoy Island. Host of water activities are provided here. The water is crystal clear and a ride in glass bottom boat gives you amazing view of the corals and marine life below. 
Adequate number of shady huts are provided on the island along with wash rooms and change rooms. 
White sandy beach and crystal clear blue/green water is very fascinating, although it gets hot during day time.

title: A hidden gem amidst bay of Bengal
review_text: Mind-blowing scenic beauty you will ever see. The ride via steamers is thrilling. Must try the snorkelling, got wide variety of flora and fauna. The sand is white and water is blue. Plz.dont take plastics with you while travelling, carry food for sure but not in plastic careers. They won't allow you.

title: Beautiful and Cleanest Island .
review_text:
Its a small island near Portblair. You have to get some permit in Marine park office to visit this place. 

No waterbottles are allowed to be carried inside the island,Book tickets for snorkeling @ the jetty. 

Its a 40 min boat ride to the island. You will see one the best beaches in the world. Its also one of the best places for snorkeling.

title: A jem that should not be missed
review_text: Part of mahatma ghandi national park, this tiny Island and a white sandy beach and cristal clear water with beautiful reef. Highly recommend. Make sure to get your tickets and permit in advance

title: not so much remained after tsunami
review_text: A must viait place for everyone to have some fun in water. I have visited two time there and i found not so much remains after disaster but still enjoyable.

title: For the water sport.
review_text: The island is located close the the main city but the loneliness of the island seems like it is far from the city. Enjoy the peace round here.

title: Best of Andaman - Nature's swimming pool
review_text: Jolly buoy island is a beautiful day trip near Port blair. We got permit on the same day, in Marine park office, near its Jetty point. Water here is crystal clear, and extremely mesmerising. We opted for 45 minutes of Glass bottom boat ride for Rs. 600 per person, and it was amazing as well as informative. We saw 100+ types of variety live corals and fishes. Then we went for Snorkeling session in its waters and that was a heavenly experience. We found snorkeling here better than Havelock. Swimming and playing in this shallow, blue and turquoise colored water is my greatest Andaman memory. Mr.Pradip was our guide and he was a knowledgeable and a humble person. Jolly buoy is a must do trip, you can't afford to miss! More

title: Independent snorkelling not allowed
review_text: The snorkelling here is good but be aware that snorkelling independently is not allowed. You are obliged too take and pay for a guide. It was around 500 INR for about 30 mins. It was also very confusing to get and understand the information as when we arrived in Jolly Buoy we were subject to a very long spiel, but only in Hindi. So we had to ask some of the Indians if they could give us info. It turned out that there was a snorkelling guide associated with the boat you'd arrived on, but I was concerned that out there was only one guide and many people wanted to go out, you could be restricted on time or maybe not have an opportunity at all. This would have been very frustrating as the whole reason for going to The Andamans was for snorkelling. However as long as you manage your expectations accordingly it's worth the trip. More

title: Mesmerising
review_text: There is nothing better than this place. The marine life- coral reef is outstanding, a must visit. do snorkeling over here

title: Must visit island of andaman islands ??
review_text: This is a very beautiful island of the andaman islands. I have visited in january 2017. I have a numbers of corals, fishes n all

title: kaleidoscopic corals in andamans
review_text:
it has beautiful and kaleidoscopic corals and flora and fauna. 
best place for snorkeling. a must visit.

title: Simply AMAZING!!!! MUST VISIT
review_text: This is one of the BEST islands I have ever been to . It is maintained by Forest dept and No. of visitors allowed every day is restricted .Clear waters . We did snorkeling and took a glass bottom ride here(Normal boats with magnifying glass at the bottom, No Dolphin boats ). Varieties of corals and fishes can be spotted. Island has changing rooms and toilets . Food and water needs to be carried along with you.You can take a ferry from MG national Park at around 9.30 which takes you back at 3 pm . [Jolly Buoy is operational for six months a year , other six months Red Skin islands operational] More

title: Awesome place. Heaven on earth
review_text:
It's an awesome island and a part of Gandhi National Marine Park. It's a heaven on earth. So much clean beaches, Cristal clear water and gorgeous under sea world. So much of a soul southing world and peace at its best. The government is also committed to protect the natural environment here. You're not allowed to carry any kind of plastic on this island, not even water bottle. There are separate Hilton water bottles which can be carried on this island for which we have to deposits 200 bucks (refundable). Only 358 tourists are allowed to visit this place in a day and strictly its followed. Pls carry you're ID proofs without fail while visiting this place. The ferry from wondur takes around 45-50 min to reach this island. If you're luck you might also cross the path with one of the deadliest creature ie. sea crocs. And of course you must see the under water world. It has one of the best Snorkling places in the entire Andaman. You must do it and there is no prerequisite that you should know swimming. 

I recommend this place to be visited once in a life time. More

title: A must visit !
review_text: This island is a part of 15 islands at Mahatma Gandhi National Park. Only 2 islands from the 15 are open to tourist I.e Jolly Buoy and Red Skin. Jolly Buoy is open to tourists from Nov to May and for remaining months Redskin is open to tourists. It is one of the best place in Andamans to see corals through Glass Bottom Boat / snorkelling. To reach Jolly Buoy it takes 90-100 minutes from Port Blair. First 40 mins by road and another 40-50 minutes by boat. You need permit to visit Jolly Buoy. Our local agent had managed the permit and Boat tickets. After all the travel, u get 3 hrs at the island to enjoy Glass Bottom boat / Snorkelling/ Swimming etc. I feel the time is little less. Just as 2 hrs get completed the local ship operators start making ppl sit in the boat for the return trip. Do remember this island is free from plastic and you will not get any food / water once are at the island. Though they rent you Jute bags / water bottles at a token amnt of Rs 5 before you take the ship. Their effort to preserve the Corals is really evident once you reach there. Its a must on your visit to Andamans !!! More

title: Visit to live Coral
review_text: Excellent formation of coral. Lots of fishes. Good place for snorkelling. A place must visit by any tourist coming to Andaman.

title: GLASS BOTOM BOAT RIDE
review_text: Best Glass bottom Boat ride beast.Other adventure sports available.Worth a visit.No eats available.One afternoon os enough.

title: Face 2 face with marine life
review_text: This place was one of the best experiences during my visit to Andaman. It is the 2nd best coral beach in the world after Australia. Plastic is strictly prohibited. One can enjoy snorkelling and ride in glass bottom boats there. I suggest glass bottom boat is best here to view marine aquatic life.

title: Must visit place in Port Blair.
review_text: Awesome experience which can't be described in word. Please book previously otherwise instant booking is difficult. Online booking is not available. So you must have to book after reaching Port Blair. Book one day before visiting the island. You can take help of the local agent for easiness of booking.

title: Excellent!!
review_text: The island is only open for 6 months in a year (November to May). The jetty is almost 45 minutes outside the Port Blair city. Once you reach the Jetty, ferry will take you to the island. The ferry trip takes around 1 hour and the view is very scenic with trees around on the both the sides. The water is very very clear and is perfect place for snorkelling. The corals are excellent here. There are also other activities such as Glass Bottom boat, which i feel is good for people who are scared of water, otherwise, snorkelling is better than doing the glass bottom boat. One very important thing to note is that the island is free from plastics i.e. no plastic bags are allowed, however, chips, biscuits can be carried along, provided you bring the empty packets back along with you to port blair. Also, there are no eateries on the island, which means you have to carry your lunch along with you. More

title: Superb Place . . Limited things to do.. Difficult to get there ..
review_text: You can only reach Jolly Buoy after getting a government permit. Then taking morning ferry from Wandoor which 30 kms from Port Blair (takes 45 min by Bike). The ferry takes 1 hour and get you back after 3 hours. There are no hotels or restaurants at the island. It comes under the forest reserve hence has a great collection of coral. If you have not done scuba at Havelock then snorkelling here is a must. The operator try to hard sell all activities; beware.

title: Awesome place for snorkellling
review_text: This place is not easily accessible (boat rides are very less) and very minimum facilities. But the problems are worth once you reach the island. The water is very very clear. Snorkelling here is definitely recommended. Glass bottom ride is also good. This is not plastic zone, so dont carry plastic here.

title: Best sightseeing place which i have ever seen in Andaman
review_text: Best place to go Jolly Buoy island, if one goes to Andaman should not miss this place. Good clarity of water and best place for Snorkelling which we amazed to see corals and more types of fishes. Had so much joy and fun here, the nature and sceneries were awesome. Snorkelling charged us for 1K and touched more fishes lively. No swimming required. The disadvantage is less time there. We have to pack up within 3 hrs and one should avoid plastics. The boating travel there was slow and adviced to wear life jacket which was so hard.

title: Best sight seeing place in Port Blair
review_text:
If you go to Andaman , this is one of the best 5 place and best near port blair. Though you have to start early. Dont miss snorkelling or glass bottom. 
They have 3 category in Glass Bottom Free (10 min included with the ticket), Rs 300 and Rs 600. Also 3 category in Snorkelling Rs 300, 600 and 1000. And dont bring snacks you will get a snacks corner there. Dont forget to carry non plastic water bottle though.

title: Jolly Buoy Island
review_text: Jolly Buoy Island is very beautiful and neat island. a must visit place for the people who want to enjoy in nature.

title: If you miss. You will regret It.
review_text:
The place i liked the most in my entire 10 day andaman trip was Jolly bouy. 
You have to take permit a day before , which ur driver can arrange. Best beach. With very little crowd. Snorkelling should be done here. Worth to have a ride in glass bottom boat also. Lot of variety of corals , fishes u can see here which u wont find doing Scuba also at any other beaches. Dont miss it.

title: Simple the best in Island : Please don't miss
review_text: Wowwwwww...Just Wooowwwwwwww ...What a place ..... Gem of a Island .....most clear water ...beautiful sand ..... awesome snorkeling experience .....do not miss it ....

title: Don't miss the glass boat ride
review_text: 30 mins boat ride away from Port Blair, this beautiful island offers an amazing experience of the underwater sea life when you take a ride in a glass boat. Must visit.

title: Thailand in india
review_text: The ride to the Island and back is a mesmerising experience, be sure to get a good seat and dont miss going on the deck , carry your camera too.These pristine beaches are lovely, clean and absolutely to be experienced

title: Corals Nd crystal clear water . Must visit
review_text:
Its a must visit from portblair. Part of marine national park, you have get the permit. Your hotel or travel agent will rasily arrange it 1-2 days before. You have to reach Wandoor jetty point. From there, half an hour of ferry ride to this beautiful island of area less than 2 sq km. One of the most beautiful sites for underwater corals in Andaman. Scubaa not allowed. The glass bottom boat ride is a must ( though they overcharge abt 600 ph for 30 min ride, still its a lifetime opp.) . The stay there is for 3 hours approx. After 3 pm, Jolly buoy is a no man's land. 

Not to be missed. More

title: serene & sublime experience
review_text: water is so pure and the glass boat experience was out of this world .was excited to see the LIFE in water. its truly aqua blue Emrald!

title: Excellent place to explore marine life, options for all age groups and non swimmers as well
review_text:
We were a family including senior citizens and kids, we explored on a glass bottom boat as well as snorkeled in the sea. The permit for Jolly buoy should be applied in advance to avoid disappointment as there is a huge demand during peak season. 
The visibility underwater improves drastically if there is sunlight , though not so bad with a slight cloudy weather in day time.The weather may clear up with intermittent showers so if you are in a mixed weather conditions try to time your visit / ride / snorkeling session during the clear sunshine period to have a better view. 

Snorkeling gear is provided with a flotation tube ( traditional snorkel mask and a sturdy plastic tube around your waist to help you afloat ) and a seasoned guide to take you around. In case you need a full face mask for snorkeling please carry your own if possible. 

Changing rooms are available, when we visited a stall with drinks was set up , but more or less every one took water and food for the trip along. 

It is a no plastic zone so please take care and pack food in paper boxes / cartons/ proper lunch packs/ carry PP / Tupperware/ flasks or proper water bottles . ( no bisleri / kinley bottles are allowed), A Milton Flask is available for rent ( 100 INR ) at the boarding point in a Kiosk. More

title: Nice Place to Sorkeling
review_text: Water clearity is very nice & very beautiful island, clear water, we can sand while traveling in ferry.

title: Must see attraction of Andaman
review_text: If you are coming to Andaman and not visiting this island, then I would say that your trip is not completed. I have no doubt that this is the best place to do snorkelling and see marine life. Me and my kids had the experience of lifetime. If I ever come back again to Andaman, I will visit it again.

title: Amazing island, colourful marine ecosystem, but very restricted!
review_text:
The location is amazing and the views are beautiful! Any traveller must try snorkelling here as the underwater sea-life here is colourful and breathtaking! 
The only qualm is that visitors weren't allowed to snorkel on their own because of prior accidents with non-swimmers which meant that confident swimmers couldn't take full advantage of the marine life in the island. 
Also, the boats that take you here operate on a timed basis so they could take more than one trip and thus make more money at the end of the day so the whole trip is restricted to 3 hours!

title: Marine Beauty
review_text: About half an hour from Vandoor beach by ferry,this island boasts of most spectacular coral reefs after Great Barrier reefs. Waters are so clear,one spot and identify variety of coral fish in Glass-bottom boat. Snorkelling here is never-to-miss delight. Scuba is prohibited. Open from November to May. Variety of corals is fantastic and guides take extra trouble to satisfy the visitors. Beyond changing rooms,washrooms and very humble temporary shop,dont expect any luxury. But the experience is beyond one's imaginations. Leatherback turtles,variety of marine life and soft-spoken guides make it delightful experience.

title: Must visit while in port Blair
review_text: It's very clean , scenic spot near port Blair. The clearest waters near port Blair. You can see corals and Verity of fish within 15 meters from beach. You must do paid long snorkeling and glass bottom tour to enjoy it fully. Paid activities. Other things like n permit need to be taken before trip. Now in city tourist center it is available 2-3 days before in quota.

title: great for first time underwater experience and scenery. Useless for anyone who has done snorkeling or scuba diviing
review_text:
1. Tickets through tourist IP&T port blair. only a day in advance opens at 8:00 am usually over in 15 min season time. so either queue up in the night or use agents. 2. do not carry any plastics you get milton water bottles on hire 5rs/bottle in which water can be taken. food stuff as long as not in plastic packets is allowed 3. you are allowed to swim in only a small patch of water with white sands where you cannot see any coral. independent snorkelling is not allowed. 4. comlimentry 15 min glass bottom boat allows you to view mainly fishes and some corals if sea state is nice. excellent for first timers. further hiring of the same is availaible 5. The are snorkeling guides who are supposed to charge Rs300 per 30 min but they actually have a fixed buoy tied to a rope along which they take you in a tube to show you underwater sights. let you touch and hold a sea cucumber and starfish.all this within less than 10 min. it is a great experience for elderly non swimmers and anybody who has not done snorkeling or scuba diving in a coral reef. The live corals are far and few esp in the guided tour where the guide is walking half the time. all in all an absolute no go if you are looking to explore the sea life and coral reefs of... 1. Tickets through tourist IP&T port blair. only a day in advance opens at 8:00 am usually over in 15 min season time. so either queue up in the night or use agents. 
2. do not carry any plastics you get milton water bottles on hire 5rs/bottle in which water can be taken. food stuff as long as not in plastic packets is allowed 
3. you are allowed to swim in only a small patch of water with white sands where you cannot see any coral. independent snorkelling is not allowed. 
4. comlimentry 15 min glass bottom boat allows you to view mainly fishes and some corals if sea state is nice. excellent for first timers. further hiring of the same is availaible 
5. The are snorkeling guides who are supposed to charge Rs300 per 30 min but they actually have a fixed buoy tied to a rope along which they take you in a tube to show you underwater sights. let you touch and hold a sea cucumber and starfish.all this within less than 10 min. it is a great experience for elderly non swimmers and anybody who has not done snorkeling or scuba diving in a coral reef. The live corals are far and few esp in the guided tour where the guide is walking half the time. 
all in all an absolute no go if you are looking to explore the sea life and coral reefs of andamans but a great picnic site and wonderful for a first experience of a coral reef More

title: Mahatma Gandhi national park is heaven
review_text: Simply awesome place, Enjoy glass bottom trip there, lot of beautiful corels are speciality of this place, this island is one of the 15 island in national park,

title: Beautiful and serene
review_text: By far the best island that I have visited till date. The water was crystal clear. Snorkeling was an amazing experience with the guide showing beautiful ocean world and naming the different corals as well as fishes. The glass bottom boat was another worthwhile experience.Please note plastic containers are not allowed in this island. You can rent a thermos flask for storing water. They charge around 200 deposit per flask (refundable) and a rent of Rs.5. For a place which takes care so much for not littering there is not a single dustbin in the entire island. No locker facility available but we did not face issues.

title: Fantastic virgin Island
review_text:
Think of a romantic virgin beautiful island with clear unpolluted waters, fabulous corals and vividly colourful marine life. That is Jolly Buoy Island for you. 
To keep it that way, the authorities impose a strict "no plastic" policy. Before getting on the boat, they check your luggage in order to ensure you don't carry plastic to the island. If you wish to take water along, you can rent bottles against a deposit. But once you reach the island, you will be awed by the beauty of the place. Make sure you do the glass boat trip and snorkeling - it is better than anywhere else.

title: Quaint island, mirror like water
review_text: The island is under the Forest Department, very well maintained, eco-tourism site, strict enforcement of rules. The boat ride is lovely. The waters here are absolutely blue, clear and gentle. The underwater sites are totally worth it!

title: Hidden Treasure of Andaman
review_text:
One among the 15 Islands that together constitute Mahatma Gandhi National Marine Park. Only 2 Islands are open to Public. Jolly Buoy and Red Skin (6 months each). You can reach here from Wandur Jetty by a Ferry that takes about 45 minutes. Wandur is 45 minutes drive fm Port Blair. Ensure that you have booked tge Tickets and Permit in advance. You are allowed 3 hours on this Beach. 

Jolly Biuy dies nit have a proper Jetty. It has a makeshift Jetty fm where Glass Bottom Biats will take you to the Island. 15 minutes of Coral and Marine Safari is part of your Ticket. You can extend it by another 30 minutes by paying 700 Rupees per person. Its worth it. Cirals and Marine life around this Island is awesome. 

You are not allowed any plastic on this Island. Water bottles are issued at Wandur Jetty againt a Security deposit of 200 Rupees (refundable). No eatables are available on this Island. All these measures are taken to protect marine life. Great place to visit. More

title: Clear waters and corals
review_text:
It's a fantastic trip, since everyone has raved on about that, I'll give out some required advice. Its kind of a package deal, you get to Wandoor, get your tickets (which run out pretty fast), there are about 3-4 boats of approximately 30+ seats each. The first leaves at around 7:30 and the last at around 10:00 am. The cruise is a nice steady paced drift through about 5-6 uninhabited islands till you reach Jolly Buoy itself. Please note that no food will be available anywhere. No plastic/plastic bottles are allowed inside. The ticket booth will let you borrow a water bottle (like we had in school) for a deposit of Rs.200 at a charge of Rs.10/- only. Once you reach the island you have two principal options, take the glass bottom boat ride or go straight to the island for snorkeling/swimming. Snorkeling is by means of assisted swimming so you dont know how to swim, you just hang on to a buoy and wear a snorkeling mask, a swimmer then drags you along the corals and you can see them quite clearly. There are three price options there. 1 It's a national park, not a resort. Treat it with respect. Do not litter. Do not treat it as a matter of right. 2 Please carry cash for every expense and deposit. 3 Its about 4 hours in total and no food or water will be made available. 5 Go... It's a fantastic trip, since everyone has raved on about that, I'll give out some required advice. Its kind of a package deal, you get to Wandoor, get your tickets (which run out pretty fast), there are about 3-4 boats of approximately 30+ seats each. The first leaves at around 7:30 and the last at around 10:00 am. The cruise is a nice steady paced drift through about 5-6 uninhabited islands till you reach Jolly Buoy itself. Please note that no food will be available anywhere. No plastic/plastic bottles are allowed inside. The ticket booth will let you borrow a water bottle (like we had in school) for a deposit of Rs.200 at a charge of Rs.10/- only. Once you reach the island you have two principal options, take the glass bottom boat ride or go straight to the island for snorkeling/swimming. Snorkeling is by means of assisted swimming so you dont know how to swim, you just hang on to a buoy and wear a snorkeling mask, a swimmer then drags you along the corals and you can see them quite clearly. There are three price options there. 

1 It's a national park, not a resort. Treat it with respect. Do not litter. Do not treat it as a matter of right. 
2 Please carry cash for every expense and deposit. 
3 Its about 4 hours in total and no food or water will be made available. 
5 Go for a swim, even if you cant swim, just run about in the water within the fenced in zone, short of Radhanagar in Havelock this had some of the softest and clear sands I've seen in India. More

title: Jolly Buoy - Must visit
review_text:
We almost said no to Jolly Buoy on Day 4 as kids were tired.. BUT Sooooo. Glad we went.. crystal clear refreshing waters, ideal place to spend half a day. 

Beware.. pl take food n water to drink bcos the ferry takes 45 min eat way n you are on the island for at least 2 hrs before the ferry comes back... travel with cash if you intend to do snorkeling but they don't take you too deep into waters for snorkeling here.. 

Don't miss the glass bottomed boat rides- yes 2 rides.. 1 is complimentary and the other one - which is the real good one - is at a cost.. More

title: Corals at their best!
review_text:
The ride is a bit too long from the Jetty, but the Glass Boat Ride is a must followed by Snorkeling(the max priced one) is excellent!! 

I have not tried North Bay yet, but Elephant beach doesn't beat Jolly Buoy!

title: best island
review_text: best place to visit near portblair..not to miss this special island... very clean n very blue water,,,

title: Excellent
review_text: One of the must places to visit if you plan to try snorkelling! Very rich in aquatic life,beautiful and mesmerizing corals

title: Nice way to spend half a day
review_text: Underwater sea tourism . View corals etc through glass bottom boat and snorkeling facilities available.

title: Excellent place to see coral reef and marine life
review_text: This island is part of the Mahatma Gandhi National Park and is under forest department. Part of the cluster of 15 islands which is of the park is opened for tourist only between Nov - May. It's an hour ferry ride from Wandoor jetty. Its an restricted area and excellent place to see live corals and marine life. Snorkelling is must do here. The water is crystal clear and you can see the colourful marine life. No plastics are allowed to be carried. One of the best island to visit during your trip to Andamans

title: Must must visit
review_text:
Jolly buoy is heaven on earth. When we visited, it was raining that day and the scenery was a bliss. 
One of the most beautiful corals and marine life. 
Snorkeling here is a must do. If you do snorkelling or glass Boat ride here, then you can avoid it at all other places. 

Sad that scuba diving is not allowed here. 
Must visit in your itinerary. 

No plastic bottles allowed. Thermos bottles are allowed which can be taken on security deposit of Rs 100 which gets refunded when you get back on payment of Rs. 5 as service charge. 

Rs 750 per head for the permit cum Boat charges from Wandoor to Jolly buoy and with this a 10 min Glass Bottom ride is complementary. 
Take your snacks along and that too in tiffin boxes or other containers. Plastic is strictly prohibited. More

title: Small Island with Water Sport Facilities,but lacks infrastructure
review_text:
While in Andaman, we visited this Island recently.This small place does have some water sport facilities like scuba , under water walk, 
and glass bottom boat ride.Level of facilities can be considered as reasonably good,although weather dependent.What is striking is lack of good washroom and change room facilities.There is no place even to have tea and coffee.One has to carry drinking water in the water bottles (to be taken on rent) before you board the boat on the main land.Concern for clean environment is well understood, but there is a need to look into hygiene and other facilities to make the place tourist friendly.

title: Very nice
review_text:
Nice place to visit with family or solo. Lot of Corals can be seen with many kinds of fish. 
My best place of Andaman tour.

title: Experience of a life time
review_text: You need to go by a ferry to the islands. No plastics allowed, not even water bottles. The ticketing office would give you bottles which you need to return afterwards. You need to fill in the forms in advance and carry your identity cards. Last 10-15 minutes of the ride is in smaller glass bottom boats. One must do snorkeling in these pristine waters and see the marine wealth -the corals and fishes.. beyond words!!

title: Good place for day trip
review_text: Good clear water for fun day outing. Need to get up early to be there by 0800h positively. Nice place.

title: Don't miss this one
review_text:
Excellent beach. Must try snorkeling at this place for 300 Rs. Complementary glass bottom boat is provided. 

I traveled to Andaman from 22nd Nov to 30th Nov and had chosen jst2andaman tour agency. The tour was very pleasant and one of our best tour. The owner Jeetander Singh and Anju mam - +9194742-03287 themselves co ordinates the tour and the travel plan and also seeks feedback each day of your tour. 
The best part is that they keep it flexible so that we can decide which places to visit on which day. 

Recommend Ammu restaurant where the food is cheap and of good quality. Also there is a punjabi dhaba which is pure veg with excellent food in the market area near Gandhiji statue. 
In havelock Shakahar is excellent choice for veg food. More

title: Overhyped
review_text: Too over hyped .. The local boat operators are minting money through these tours. After travellling an our or so out of port blair and then another 45 mins jetty ride which i admit was enjoyable, the actual complementary coral view on the glass boat was just for 10 mins..!! Instead these jetty operators promise an extended tip on payment of 600 p.p which is total misuse of the positin. Avoid if possible!

title: Must visit
review_text: Best place to see marine life- corals and fishes. Must do snorkeling and glass boat ride there. Take big round if glass boat. Don't miss this island trip. This is opened from Nov- Apr.

title: Absolutely mesmerising
review_text: Omg... Where should i start?! I was dumbstruck by the pristine crystal clear water. Loved the snorkeling activity there..... I have never seen such variety of corals and underwater fauna. It was AMAZING. I just hope people don't spoil the natural habitat. Must go place but make sure you come back without messing the place.

title: Best ever beach i have ever been
review_text: Superb beach.. beautiful corals. Snorkeling experience could be the best here.. nice trainer for snorkeling. There is also an option for glass boat. Around 10 mins of glass boat is complimentary. Overall worth visiting.

title: Untouched natural beauty
review_text: Jolly buoy island is open for tourists only from November - May and is a must visit on your trip to andamans. It is the best place to do snorkelling. You can see a variety of corals and fishes. The natural beauty of the place is a treat to soul.

title: Best place for Glass bottom boat and snorkelling
review_text:
Jolly Bouy and Red skin are two Islands where tourists are allowed for 6 months each. These Islands are far better than North Bay as the water is much more clear, there is less boat traffic, the water is calmer and the corals and the aquatic life is better. 
I took the glass bottomed boat and I saw some of the biggest sea cucumbers in Red skin. I did not see any sea cucumber even half that size anywhere else. 
This is a good place for snorkelling ot to take a glass bottomed boat ride.

title: Best location real paradise
review_text: This is really worth to visit in Andaman.. you have to book ticket 2.3 days advance from tourism department, portblair.. it's open only for 6 month from November to March..and locals say it's best location to visit..750 rs pp charged for two way ferry.. coral beauty is awesome..very small n maintained island.. u can't even take any plastic item there..kudos to forest department

title: Best Island I have ever visit
review_text: This Island is very clean and they don't allow any plastic to carry there because of the pollution (not even water bottle). Very crystal clear water, I have never seen this kind of clearity in my life. You have to submit your Government Id card and get permission to go there. Its open only for 6 months in a year. Recommend to everyone.

title: Must visit this island if you are at Andaman
review_text:
As title suggest you cannot miss this island if you are at Andamans. Have to take permission from forest official one day prior to visit as this island is under national park and protected. Here you can enjoy glass bottom boat ride and do snorkeling. Water here are crystal clear so u can see till bottom from top of water. My daughter saw octopus as well as dozens of fish as well as corals while snorkeling. 

This island remains closed for six months a year from May to November. At this time Ross island is opened for tourists. It is opposite to jolly bouy island. Although we were able to see jolly bouy islands. Ross island closes when jolly bouy island opens. More

title: Best part of Andaman trip
review_text: Its nature at its best, completely magical! Permits are needed in advance. Also, there is no food or water on the island, so best to carry adequate supplies when visiting. Best place to see corals and a ride in glass bottom boat is a must (costs approx. 650 per person when not peak season). Also, nothing can be left on the island and one has to carry back all garbage (which is good, because it maintains the island as pristine). Visitors are not allowed to carry back anything from the island.

title: Best place to do Snorkelling
review_text: This island comes under Mahatma Gandhi National Marine Park. The access to this island is restricted to people with permission from tourist department. You can not take any plastic material with you and that is why this place is still undiluted. The water is very clean. Only some part of the beach is good for swimming. Rest of the part is rocky and filled with corals. Glass bottom ride will be also good.

title: Beautiful and clean beach
review_text: This beach was the best in terms of cleanliness . We enjoyed our outling at Jolly Buoy. You need to carry some food to eat as nothing is available in this not commercialized beach.Recommend this beach for snorkelling and a good swim

title: Clear water and good view of corals
review_text: Clear water and good view of corals. Snorkeling and viewing corals on a glass boat are the activities done in this island

title: Family outing
review_text: Actually we would not visit this place . When we visited port blair. Reason is this place is closed for maintenance from May to November. But I heard that this place is also awesome.

title: Jolly buoy is a visual delight...
review_text: One of the best places to go for snorkeling and water activities.The water is crystal clear at Jolly Buoy.One can literally see clearly beneath the water.Your Andaman experience is incomplete if you miss out on Jolly Buoy.It is indeed going to make a person Jolly after the visit.

title: Must Visit
review_text: Thes best beach ever, highly recommended, it is just beautiful and there is snorkeling as well. Do visit.

title: Beautiful island of Andaman Sea
review_text: Awesome beach, nice location in Port Blair. Lots of activities and natural beauty. Colorful sea, clear water. Must visit

title: "Touristy"
review_text: We were told this was the best place to snorkel. Should have instead marketed as easier/cheaper place to snorkel, for it's no way near the best places (go to Havelock instead). It has a "touristy" feel throughout - people flocking for that glass-bottom boat hoping to get glimpse of washed out

title: Jolly Buoy Island - Best place for Glass Bottom Tide and Corals in Port Blair
review_text:
It is located 30 Km outside the city. One have to get the permits and tickets from the concerns department. It is located at Mahatma Gandhi National Park - which has 13 Isolated island and Jolly buoy is the assert of it. 

On reaching the MG Park - you have travel in speedboat - Don't get fooled by Travel agent for complementary Glass bottom ride. 

From MG Park - one have to travel in speedboat and in the bottom - Glass will be there - for limited distance you can watch the corals 

But when you pay it will worth spending your time in Jolly buoy... 

Snorkeling also available for cost

title: Beautiful corals
review_text: A prior ticket is must. The boat takes a limited number of people and we get to stay there for 3 hours. The boat ride is ok a little tiring 1 hour. Plastics are not allowed and so u cant carry plastic water bottles. U can rest a bottle there and transfer your water but better to get your own bottles. Glass bottom boat ride was good and water is so clear you can easily see the corals and reef . Snorkelling was a good experience.

title: Lovely place to visit on a nice summer evening
review_text: Time to relax and lay back? this is a good place to be. Its got its only little silence and you can see the moon rise as a red, orange yellow, and than to a full white at the cusp of the water. There are open nights and movies shown every now and then and its quite a sight to see the hilly regions of Andamans and the city lights in the distance.

title: An Okay Experience
review_text:
We were really bored when we got onto this beach as all the activities which were available here were already covered by us on other beaches during our Andaman visit.The stay at this beach is almost 4-5 hours and you would eventually end up getting bored after taking pictures if you have nothing planned here. 
Very- very few Food options which are are surely overpriced. 

Tip: Include this early in your trip if you want to enjoy the coral life.We had this scheduled on the last day, which was a mistake from our end.

title: Best Corals!
review_text:
Its indeed the most beautiful island of entire andamans trip. Jetty ride of 20 mins takes u there. Its an irony that u cannot carry plastic water bottles there (they ll give u milton bottles to transfer your water), but can carry lays, biscuits etc, which are also wrapped in plastic and many irresponsible travellers leave the wrappers behind! The government is making a lot of effort to keep the island clean and so should we.. 
Glass boat ride and snorkeling are offered here by the jetty guys only. The best corals are witnessed here, so glass bottom ride is a must here!

title: Excellent Island..... best Coral I have seen in India
review_text: If you want to see the real and beautiful corals.....its must visit Island. Glass Boat ride and Snorkelling is best activities to do here.

title: Nice and clean beaches
review_text: A small but clean island good for peace loving travellers. Beaches are superb clean water is very clear a short visit is enough to enjoy this island.

title: Amazing experience at the beach
review_text: This island is approachable through a streamer that takes about 30-40 mins. The ride to the island is simply breathtaking. Lush green mangrove forests surround the route to the island, and your eyes feel refreshed with so much greenery. Once, you reach the island, you are amazed to see the clear blue water with no waves. You can easily swim in the water, and snorkel, to see the vivid and bright coral life. a must-do and beautiful experience. However, the island is open only for 6 months in a year, and till 1 pm everyday. Post that, is high tide and the streamers don't take you there. Please carry your own food and water, as nothing is available there. More

title: Jolly buoy
review_text: I my self did not find any thing great. It is just an small island or another word you can say another point.where you can have a scuba diving or can see the under water corals. Thatsit

title: My best memorable beach ever!!!
review_text:
Best beach with low waves.. I can enjoy 24 hours in that beach ;-) 
Green waves, blue sky, Rusty ships,clear water marvelous combination

title: Mesmerizing Experience
review_text: The coral island in 1 hour away from jetty and we need to take permission one day before to visit the island. No plastic bags allowed. The jetty which will take you there are expert and they will show you coral reef. They have two activity glass bottom ride- from which we can see the coral clearly and snorkeling.We did both the activity and it was a out of world experience.

title: Out of the world Experience
review_text: The coral island is 1 hour away from jetty. No plastic bags, bottles are allowed in the ferry to the island. Once you reach the island, calm and quite and deserted island welcomes you. There is no habitat on the island and all visitors must leave the island before sunset. The coral reef is excellent and one of the beautiful seen in any Indian ocean.

title: Real jem of India
review_text:
You should never miss this place if you are visiting andaman islands. 
You will never find such beautiful corals any where els in andman. 
Corals in jolly bouy is so colorfull. try to do all sort of glass bottom ride and snorkeling here . 
As mentioned its a no man island , so no food and water available

title: Must visit
review_text:
Amazing experience, must visit... 
Done a glass bottom ride, snorkeling, must watch wonderful underwater corals and sealife...

title: welcome to the sea world.
review_text: experience the underwater world. take a deep breath and go deep into the blue. witness te other side of beauty that you don't often see everyday.

title: Disappointing!
review_text: The visit to the island requires prior permission and the tickets are inclusive of a 5 minute glass boat ride. The journey from the jetty to the island is around 3 hours which could be quite monotonous. And there's practically nothing to watch or do there. Swimming is not allowed as the underwater currents are said to be strong here. Spending the whole day on this little island is a total waste. If you have already been to North Bay Island or Havelock, there is no need to come here.

title: Scuba diving
review_text:
We enjoyed a lot at jolly buoy island. 
Main attraction is scuba diving. Its once in a life time experience. Trainers are very good.

title: Nice place
review_text: Jolly boy island is very nice place.. White sands and Cristal clear water takes you to the new world.

title: Fantabulous Jolly Buoy
review_text: Jolly Buoy Island comes under Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. Situated in Wandoor, people needs to get prior permit from the Govt. and also buy ticket to visit this island. This island is same as the island called Red Skin Island. It is opened only for 6 months in a year, to protect its rich corals and natural wealth of this islands. Rest other 6 months red skin island will be opened. People do activities here like snorkeling, glass bottom boat ride. A full day is required to visit this island. This island is one of the best destinations in Andaman peoples must visit.

title: Enjoy the coral varieties ....
review_text: It is one of the best spot for enjoy the coral varieties.. sports activities like .. scuba diving .. glassbottam boats .. snorkeling. .etc .. very good beach . When I visited this spot 17th of this may I think that is the last day and they closed it with next day and redskin island is opened. . So next 6 months no jolly buoy island .. anyhow I have enjoyed both islands...

title: The Best place i have ever been to
review_text:
This is a place which everyone will love, be of any age. 

I went to Jolly Buoy in May, 2016 with my wife and 3yr old son. 
And we all were amazed by the beauty of this place. This island is even better than Krabi, Thailand. Clear water that you can see 40 feet below. Waves are calm and that's why my son could enjoy as else where he gets afraid of the wave sound. 
We went for Glass bottom boat ride, it was worth its money. 

Must go place for people visiting Andamans.

title: Around with marine rich life
review_text:
Jolly buoy island comes under the mahatma Gandhi marine national park,(wan door).This island consists of fifteen new islands ,many an islands not opened yet for visitors.Jolly buoy is one of the best destination for the travelers,who experience an unusual beautiful corals and rich marine life. this island usually opened for six months in a year,because to protect the rich corals and natural wealth of this islands.This trip takes the whole day, 
because, lack of ferries and there is no anchor facilities in the jolly buoy island.jolly buoy island is opened alternative months in a year when red skin is opened it is closed .So visitors can enjoy the island trip without any problem. More

title: Unbelievable beauty of the turquoise blue water!
review_text: No matter this was the place that witnessed the horrible outburst of my partner who wanted me to join her in the waters, I could have easily spent the whole day in the shades and immersed myself in the water half the night! You cannot do that because by about 4 p.m you need to take the last boat out...

title: Crystal clear
review_text: The only island in India with crystal clear beach. Mesmerising and beautiful this island can definitely be rated number one. Completely pollution and litter free. You cannot carry any plastic item with you. You need to rent water cans from the department to carry water.

title: Ultimate Beach
review_text: Buy a ticket in advance from Port Blair Tourist office to visit this place. You need to take jetty to this place. Beautiful place little bit isolated . This is most beautiful place. You need entire day for visit to this place, not much of facilities just sit and relax and enjoy snorkeling or glass bottom boat ride. You can also take a dip in crystal clear and safe waters of sea.

title: Untouched and pristine island!!
review_text:
If you are in Andaman, a trip to Jolly Buoy is never to be missed. Overall it takes one day to go and come back. Better to leave early to take the first ferry in the morning at 8 am so that you can come back by 2 pm. I arranged the tickets and permits in advance through my hotel. Good thing is that authorities are trying to preserve the pristine nature of this ecologically sensitive island. You cannot carry any plastic mineral water bottles. You can get water bottles on rent. Make sure you carry enough of them if you are going in summer. It will take one hour in the boat to reach Jolly Buoy. Life jackets are provided for all passengers. Once you reach the island you will be amazed by nature and clean ocean around it. Waves are not so strong, so kids can also enjoy swimming. You will find instructors for snorkeling (mostly they will be part of the ferry's crew) and this is one experience you should not miss. 

No food stalls or water stalls are available here, so carry your own food. I hope people will keep this place litter free and preserve this island in this way free for the next generations. More

title: Must visit in Andamans!
review_text: This is a must visit in Andamans. Its isolated. You need to take jetty to this place. You need an entire day for this visit. But its worth every effort! Very clean, no plastic allowed. Water is crystal clear. Excellent view of corals. Probably the best places to see corals anywhere in the country. A dip in the waters is very relaxing especially in the summers when the heat can get to you. One of the very few places where you get the feel of international beaches.

title: Wow factor
review_text:
Most beautiful & under rated place in Andaman. We visited march 2014. Not so many activities available there. 
Just sit back & enjoy the nature.

title: Daylight Robert
review_text: Now the boat ride from wandoor jetty to jolly boy island is nice but the boats are very old looking and they could upgrade and charge more because once people get to jolly boy island most of the tourist who r from India who live away from sea rivers and backwater are robbed by the men who provide snorkelling and glass bottom boats I am in tourism for the last 29 years in India and have travelled most states in India and quite a few locations in the world and cane compare this to the rip off In Srilanka which is state sponsored where as this is done by by the guys who offer these extra and at the end of the trip as these tourist are back in the boat for the return trip o wandoor the guy in my boat went round and was collecting Rs.7000, and Rs.4000 etc from the innocent tourist saying this much for snorkelling this much for glass boat ride in fact I have seen corals in many parts of the world this is very little. But a good beach for swimming the authorities should do something about this More

title: Glass bottom boat a must try.
review_text: Right from the color of the water to the corals and the sand color.. Everything is down right amazing. Glass bottom boat is one of the out worldly experience. It's a must try there.

title: Natures beauty at its best
review_text: The ferry ride is good.. the beach is breathtaking... clean and beautiful... snorkelling is good and reasonably safe

title: A MUST Visit island in Andamans
review_text: If you are travelling to Andaman, Jolly Buoy island is a must visit island around the place. It is a no plastic zone and is open for only 6 months a year (Alternatively, Red Skin island is open for the visitors) to preserve its marine life. The snorkeling experience here is breathtaking. It is some 30 kms from Port Blair city by road followed by an hour in a ferry boat. It requires an entire first half of the day to enjoy the island adventures.

title: Must visit
review_text:
This journey is a memorable journey for the thick forest surrounding the clear pristine sea. It is one to one and half hour journey from Wandoor beach. Check out the opening of the Jolly buoy in the particular season of the year as it is not opened during the entire year. 
Boats are available from 9.00am onwards. Visitors are supposed to deposit INR 200 against their each plastic items carrying to Jolly Buoy at the ticket point. The journey gives an out of the world experience.Snorkeling are available here. Jolly buoy is a no man's land.

title: Tiny Island with Clear Turquoise waters and a good marine life
review_text:
I had heard about this tiny Island before my visit and hence was a must visit place in my itinerary. I planned my trip via Andaman Excursion (AE). Thanks to AE guys Ganesh & Shekhar for arranging for permits to visit Jolly Buoy Island and making a smooth trip for us. This island can be visited only for 6 months a year and can only be visited by a limited no. of people in a day only for 2-3 hours, hence one needs to arrange for a permit beforehand. This tiny Island gives a breathtaking view of Natural beauty - blue & clear waters are so tempting that we could have spent the entire day there. I & my wife spent some quality time roaming around the island and in the water. We also did snorkeling but felt the corals quality was not that good as it was mentioned in some posts. It was below expectations and mostly corals were dead. Few things to note:- 1) Plastic in any form is strictly NO 2) Only govt boats are permitted with 20-30 people on board 3) Milton water bottles are available can be bought at 10-20 Rs 4) Snorkeling was good but they charge much, try to bargain. The real price according to me should be 300-400 Per person, above it is a waste as the same can be done in Havelock with better corals view 5) Glass bottom boat ride... I had heard about this tiny Island before my visit and hence was a must visit place in my itinerary. I planned my trip via Andaman Excursion (AE). Thanks to AE guys Ganesh & Shekhar for arranging for permits to visit Jolly Buoy Island and making a smooth trip for us. This island can be visited only for 6 months a year and can only be visited by a limited no. of people in a day only for 2-3 hours, hence one needs to arrange for a permit beforehand. This tiny Island gives a breathtaking view of Natural beauty - blue & clear waters are so tempting that we could have spent the entire day there. I & my wife spent some quality time roaming around the island and in the water. We also did snorkeling but felt the corals quality was not that good as it was mentioned in some posts. It was below expectations and mostly corals were dead. 

Few things to note:- 
1) Plastic in any form is strictly NO 
2) Only govt boats are permitted with 20-30 people on board 
3) Milton water bottles are available can be bought at 10-20 Rs 
4) Snorkeling was good but they charge much, try to bargain. The real price according to me should be 300-400 Per person, above it is a waste as the same can be done in Havelock with better corals view 
5) Glass bottom boat ride was just OK as the view was not very clear. More

title: Must visit place
review_text: It's a no-stay island for human, you will need to take permit to go to this island. (better to take it in advance or contact a travel agent). The corals and water life is really good to watch here, the water is very clear and hence if you want to visit corals - opt for either snorkeling or glass boat trip. You don't need to know swimming for snorkeling 'here', they take you on a life-tyre. 'Must-visit' place in south PB

title: Spellbound!
review_text: A must visit. A Large variety of marine life. Snorkelling at its best here.Very clean and well maintained.Crystal clear water!!!! Dont miss this island in your Havelock Trip

title: Cleanest beach with beautiful corals
review_text: Jolly buoy island is supposed to be the no.2 island in the world known for its beautiful corals which can be viewed from a glass bottom boat ride. Tickets from wandoor are Rs800 each including forest permit. Plastics are not allowed and no food is available on jolly buoy. Carry your own food. Milton water bottles are available on hire from wandoor at Rs200 each. Jolly buoy is a 45 min journey from wandoor. One can also do snorkelling at jolly buoy.

title: Mesmerizing!
review_text: This was the most beautiful thing we saw in port blair. just mesmerizing. Can never forget the beauty of this place.

title: very beautiful island
review_text: this island is surrounded by a mangroves .the scenic is really beautiful .we enjoyed going there. island is full of colourful corals.from wondoor jetty its take 25 min. to reach over there.

title: Must Visit + Best corals species' variety + Snorkelling is must
review_text:
Jolly Buoy is visited over a day trip from Port Blair. It is the best beach in terms of clear water, beautiful blue & green color water shades and marine life. To visit, you need to book a boat trip from there, ask your travel agent. 
Don't miss Snorkeling here at any cost as this place has maximum variety of corals in minimum area. Boat guys will pitch you for 2-3 plan rates of snorkeling like INR 300 - 500 - 1000. choose the 1000 one for sure as they give their best to show you everything. You can negotiate if more people are there. But remember experience is priceless. 
Note 1: Carry an underwater camera if you can as you would love those pics for life. Boat guys didn't have it here. 
Note 2: Jolly Buoy is operation 6 months only, rest months they open Red Skin Island. They close these islands for letting corals develop naturally. So before planning, please check which island will be operational at your tour time. 
Note 3: Boat guys offer complementary glass bottom trip here. But that is like a demo only, paid glass bottom ride is detailed one. I didn't do paid one as snorkeling was more exciting for me. More

title: Awesome Experience
