review_text: Jolly Buoy is a "must see" and would suggest Snorkeling - there are different levels but even the basic one is terrific.

title: Nature at its Best in Andamans
review_text: The Jolly Buoy island forms part of the Mahatama Gandhi Natinal Park region. One must get a forest permit and advance booking a day prior to visit this place. Area is kept virgin by strict access control and no constructions being allowed. A 45 min ferry ride through scenic waters takes you to Jolly Buoy. It has activities like Snorkeling, Glass bottom boat ride and swimming. The waters are extremely clean and the best sea life is visible in them. It is a plastic free zone and kept with minimal amenities. Please carry drinking water and packed food as nothing available on the island.

title: Joyfull
review_text: We visited the location in Feb 15.We visited the site through a tour package. We left our hotel at Port Blair early in the morning to reach at wandoor.It took approximately 1 hour to reach wandoor. There is small marine museum in wandoor.We reached early so and there was time for the first cruise to leave so we visited the museum which was completed in 15 min and OK for time pass. It took approximately 1 hour to reach jolly bouy from wandoor. In between we enjoyed paid gloss bottom boat ride to see under water life of sea. We were able to see many fishes, octopus and corals. Finally we reached the beach. Small but very beautiful. White yellowish sand with crystal clear blue water, small sitting area under trees shadow. Very enjoyable. On return from wandoor to port blair, we also visited rubber plant and betel nut plants. More

title: Best place in Andaman
review_text: I can say this is the best place in Andaman. You can enjoy corals as much as you can. I can tell you this is far better than Pataya. I visited both the place and any day I will choose Jolly Buoy. Journey to Jolly Buoy Island is also superb. You need to borrow milton water bottle before the journey.Tip: Please borrow minimum one bottle per head, otherwise you can noy buy it from the island. Also do the snorkeling which cost you around 1000 rupees. Don't buy the t-shirts offered in the boat as you can buy better t-shirts with less price from Port Blair.

title: Pristine waters! Abundant Marine life!
review_text: Jolly Buoy island is one of the two islands open for public in Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. The waters are extremely clean and clear. The island is small but never felt over-crowded due to restricted access. The corals and marine life can be viewed through glass-bottomed boat or snorkelling. We went snorkelling and the guide took care to point out different fishes and corals. Highly recommended!

title: Must Go at any cost
review_text: this is so beautiful place, one should go if he visits portblair at any cost. if u have short time, u may miss baratang visit but never miss. so clean water, so clam place, u will enjoy it too much. Here u will see green senieries which u sees in Maldives and at discovery channels.

title: A must visit
review_text: You can visit this place from Port Blair. Snorkelling and Glass boat rides are activities which you must do. Please carry your own water bottle as plastic bottles are not allowed. Also carry some food. This is really a good experience. Swimming is also another activity you need to carry out.

title: Must go activity if you are going to Port Blair
review_text:
I had to say that the management or government has kept this place in pristine condition. 
The snorkelling starts from few meters of the beach and the marine life is so shallow that you can see it very closely. Photography is not allowed here for coral and marine life, as mentioned by the guards but its not written any where. Beach has changing rooms but not so clean. Plastic not allowed at all. There is no facility to buy anything to eat or drink on the island. We took Milton Water Bottles after paying a deposit of Rs 200 per bottle at Wandoor Jetty which is facilitated by forest department. I really want to appreciate that Govt is taking all the measures to keep the beach plastic free and clean. 
The time given by the boat operators to enjoy the beach is little less I felt but overall its a very nice place. We did glass bottom ride and were lucky enough to see a giant sea turtle. Good place if you are visiting with your kids. More

title: Love the island and the corals, but the guides are destroying it
review_text: I went there. The othere reviews have details about what to do and how to get there. The corals are amazing. What turned me off are the guides and the officialdom. They are destroying the place. During the snorkelling, they are stepping and breaking all the corals. I cant believe the pressure on the island. I saw the local guides litter more than the tourists. They should really educate the guides on how to care for this place better. They only care about the extra money and keep promising you to take you to more exclusive experience at the expense of the environment.

title: Beautiful island
review_text:
Firstly some of our best memories from our entire trip to Andaman are from this island. Though quite expensive for a day visit but worth every penny. 
Snorkelling at this island is the best compared to entire Andaman,if you have missed your chance of scuba diving at Havelock than trying snorkelling will give almost the same under water experience. 

To visit this place you need to take a permit at least a day or two before and ferry ride should cost all together 800 per person. Ferry ride might take around an hour to the island from Gandhi reserve.

title: Awe striking experience
review_text:
This is a must visit. Since Jolly Buoy is a protected island, the water here is as clear as glass. And the fishes!!! amazing..I had never witnessed such a sight before. Fishes of all shapes and sizes and colours swimming past you. An unforgettable experience. It is better to visit Jolly Buoy before you move on to Havelock or any other island. The snorkelling here is much better than any other place. Also each person has one guide who takes an effort to tell you the name of every fish and coral which you come across. We did scuba at Havelock after Jolly Buoy. but during scuba the instructor cannot tell you the names or descriptions of the sights you see. Because I had prior knowlege obtained during Jolly Buoy sightseeing, I enjoyed scuba because I knew what i was seeing and could appreciate the same. The fishes and corals also could be seen clearly through the glass bottom boat. We took an extra 45 min ride for Rs.600/- per head. Those who cant do snorkelling can see through the glass bottom boat. You have to reach wandoor jetty from where ferries depart for Jolly Buoy. All the ferries depart one after the another. Tickets are difficult to obtain since they are not available online and many times are sold out. So its a risk to try getting them at the window. We had requested our hotel manager to obtain... This is a must visit. Since Jolly Buoy is a protected island, the water here is as clear as glass. And the fishes!!! amazing..I had never witnessed such a sight before. Fishes of all shapes and sizes and colours swimming past you. An unforgettable experience. 

It is better to visit Jolly Buoy before you move on to Havelock or any other island. The snorkelling here is much better than any other place. Also each person has one guide who takes an effort to tell you the name of every fish and coral which you come across. We did scuba at Havelock after Jolly Buoy. but during scuba the instructor cannot tell you the names or descriptions of the sights you see. Because I had prior knowlege obtained during Jolly Buoy sightseeing, I enjoyed scuba because I knew what i was seeing and could appreciate the same. 

The fishes and corals also could be seen clearly through the glass bottom boat. We took an extra 45 min ride for Rs.600/- per head. Those who cant do snorkelling can see through the glass bottom boat. 

You have to reach wandoor jetty from where ferries depart for Jolly Buoy. All the ferries depart one after the another. Tickets are difficult to obtain since they are not available online and many times are sold out. So its a risk to try getting them at the window. We had requested our hotel manager to obtain the tickets for us beforehand. Though we had to pay an extra commission of Rs.100/- per ticket, we did not mind, since our travel plan was tightly scheduled. The official ticket is 750/- plus 50/- permit. You have to submit identity proof at the time of purchase and while boarding. 

You need to carry snacks and water since nothing is available on the island. But one request please, as the board on the island states that " Leave back nothing but your footprints", please carry the garbage, plastic wrappers back with you. 

It was heart wrenching to see a family discard cold drinks cans after drinking on the beach and a young couple leaving behind packs of frooti and wrappers of wafers on the island . This same couple and family when they will travel to the nearby malaysia or thailand will not dare do such a thing. Why is our country officially regarded as a open garbage bin by our very own and even so called "Educated people". The adminstration alone cannot do this. We as tourists also have to help. More

title: Beauty in a small package
review_text: This island is a very small one. I did snorkeling and glass boat ride which was awesome. The water was very very salty. It helps you to float on water easily, who cannot swim too can easily float on water which is a nice thing from my point of view. Please take good amount of cash with you whenever you are not on port Blair island because many islands do not have any or few ATMs. Jollybuoy do not have any residents living on the island and that's why they don't have any facility on this island.

title: Nice Island
review_text: We went there during october.we were lucky enough that we could go to jolly buoy island on the very first day of that season.You can visit either Red skin or jolly buoy.Whichever is kept open during your visist.Local aithorities keep both the islands open for public for several months alternately.We enjoyed glass bottom boat ride.Since it was d opening day we got to see lots of corals and many fishes through the glass bottom.U can do snorkelling too.Skuba dive is not available at jolly buoy or red skin.The beach was also clean and the so the water.One can have bath in neat blue ocean n hv fun wid family n friends.It's a no plastic zone. More

title: A wow snorkeling experience!
review_text: Memories of snorkeling at Jolly buoy and the dip in the crystal clear sea can be cherished forever. A must see tourist attraction in Port Blair. A one day trip to the island by ferry. Carry food and water with you. Plastics will not be allowed. You can also enjoy a ride in the glass bottomed boat watching the lovely fishes, corals and other underwater sea flora and fauna.

title: Serene Coral viewing
review_text: Great corals and fish variety via glassboat. Though the permits , transport tiks etc are a hassle to organise without an agent

title: Nice, but not the best in Andamans
review_text:
Jolly buoy is called as the must see attraction on Port Blair visit, but going there is expensive, journey is long and time allowed is very limited. Although glass bottom boat rides are good, it seems that all the tourist invasion is having its effect. The small. Island is filled with around 300 people when you visit and there is zero privacy. 

There is a lot of natural beauty, but where in Andaman it is not.

title: A wonderful experience, highly recommended
review_text:
Jolly Buoy island offers some thing unique to the traveller. That is to see a different form of sea life. Many of the travellers would have done trips on boats and ships, across rivers and the seas. Jolly Buoy island uniqueness lies in the coral reefs present in its vicinity, and the amazing and colourful types of corals and the variety of fishes which exist around these corals. Fishes which many of us have seen only in acquariums can be seen in more lively and natural surroundings here. The journey to this island starts from the jetty near the Wandoor beach. The area is an eco-friendly zone, and this brings in some restrictions on the traveller. Plastic items are to be avoided. The A&N Tourism authorities seems to focus on plastic bottles and the plastic covers (used to wrap home made snacks etc.) than on bigger containers (like Tupperware bowls etc.). The authorities provides water containers (Rs.5 per container, and Rs.200 as refundable deposit), in which the tourist can stock up the water required. The journey is by a motor launch which takes around 40mins to reach Jolly Buoy. A smaller boat with glass floorings gets towed by the motor launch. Jolly Buoy island is uninhabited and only day time tourism is allowed out there. At the island I did find a shack erected by a cooperative society which was to sell snacks and light refreshments. I visited the place... Jolly Buoy island offers some thing unique to the traveller. That is to see a different form of sea life. Many of the travellers would have done trips on boats and ships, across rivers and the seas. Jolly Buoy island uniqueness lies in the coral reefs present in its vicinity, and the amazing and colourful types of corals and the variety of fishes which exist around these corals. Fishes which many of us have seen only in acquariums can be seen in more lively and natural surroundings here. 

The journey to this island starts from the jetty near the Wandoor beach. The area is an eco-friendly zone, and this brings in some restrictions on the traveller. Plastic items are to be avoided. The A&N Tourism authorities seems to focus on plastic bottles and the plastic covers (used to wrap home made snacks etc.) than on bigger containers (like Tupperware bowls etc.). The authorities provides water containers (Rs.5 per container, and Rs.200 as refundable deposit), in which the tourist can stock up the water required. 

The journey is by a motor launch which takes around 40mins to reach Jolly Buoy. A smaller boat with glass floorings gets towed by the motor launch. Jolly Buoy island is uninhabited and only day time tourism is allowed out there. At the island I did find a shack erected by a cooperative society which was to sell snacks and light refreshments. I visited the place on a Sunday, and it was not operational. This also gave me a feeling that the restrictions on carrying own food etc. also ensured that the refreshments shack got a good deal of business. 

Jolly Buoy offers two more attractions - snorkelling & viewing the sea life from the glass-floored boat. Rs.300 for 15 mins of snorkelling and Rs.600 for a 45 mins trip on the glass-floored boat. The boat ride is worth the money paid for. As the boat moves on, through the glass floor the corals and the water bodies can be clearly seen. The crew also are good guides who explains each and every type of coral and fish. For a person who has only seen such things in an artifical acquarium, this would for sure change his perspective. 

I travelled with a two your old kid, and she was able to cope up with the boat ride as well as the 3 hour stay at Jolly Buoy. The island has some greenery around, and in it are also some shacks/shanties setup for the tourists to relax. There are also toilets for ladies and changing rooms for men and women. The water available at the toilets are limited so this may cause problems to the women. The island does not have any electricity, nor any piping to fill the water tanks automatically. Sea water is carried bucket by bucket to fill the tank. A very old man was the staff allotted to fill up the water tank (used in the toilets) and some of the lady tourists had complained that he was asking for tips etc. to keep the tank filled. More

title: Visit to Jolly Bouy Island
review_text: Awesome place to visit. Try to reach their by first boat. Carry food in non-plastic tiffins boxes. Plastic is No-No on island. No food is available on island except some biscuits and cakes. No water available on island, so if you dont carry it, you have it douse your thirst by Coke or mango la kinda soft drinks. Non -plastic Water bottles are provided at wandoor Jetty. This island is open for public for 6 months only from Nov till May every year.

title: Must visit in Andamans !!
review_text: We visited the Andamans last week.. Jolly Buoy islands was kept in the last day of the itinerary .. Save the best for the last they say.. And why not.. From the crystal clear waters to the vibrant marine life jolly buoy will surely make you think of visiting Andamans all over again.. We reached jolly buoy and got a complimentary glass bottom boat ride.. We were more interested in snorkelling.. Snorkelling at Jolly Buoy islands has been one of my most enriching experiences in life.. The water was crystal clear, the sea bed laden with corals and exotic marine lives..Words are not enough nor this review at trip advisor.. Do visit the islands, snorkel in the waters and showcase the memories .. More

title: An amazing expereince
review_text:
Jolly Buoy is one of the many islands that comes under the protection of marine life guards protection authorities of Govt of India.so You need to get special permission to go to this island 1 day prior to your visit. 
Also this island is only open for 6 months in a year , therefore you need to check and go. 
This island has extremely strict rules when it comes to the littering , even a small plastic wrapper can land you in jail. 
There is absolutely 0 tolerance on throwing garbage. 
This island is 2nd best place to see marine life and corals , and the marine life here is extremely preserved. Even the fishermans are educated enough to not catch a fish and preserve the fauna. 

You can enjoy a glass bottom ride tour for 45 mins which covers all types of corals as well fishes present there. 
Or you can try snorkeling and sea walking. 

Overal;lts a must must visit place if you are in Andaman More

title: Crystal clean
review_text: This place has got the best corals in Andamans. This is a beautiful place with lot of greenery . The ferry ride to island is very nice. The beach is very clean with white sand. Would love to come here again.

title: One of the best islands in Andamans
review_text:
The trip to MGMNP, Wandoor from the town takes 45 mins. After alighting at the Park Visitor's Center, the ferry tickets to Jolly Buoy Island and the Special Forest Entry Permission tickets have to be bought there. Also, regular water bottles can't be carried inside but can be exchanged for water bottles supplied by the Forestry Dept on refundable advance. You can carry food to the island but the leftovers and packages have to be returned back with you. It's advisable to carry packed lunch since the return from island will be by 3/3.30 PM in the afternoon and you can find a good restaurant at Bathubassi junction which is half a hour's drive away. The ferry ride to the Jolly Buoy island takes one and a half hour. The ferry ride ticket includes complimentary snorkeling and complimentary glass bottom boat ride to see the corals at a single spot. But on paying extra money, you can see corals at 3 different regions and do snorkeling to 3 different depths. The return ferry starts after spending 2-2.5 hrs. And again the return journey takes another 1.5 hrs. 
The water is so clear that corals are very beautifully seen. One of the must-visit islands in Andamans. More

title: Coral reefs around Port blair
review_text: Jolly Buoy island is open only for 6 months of the year (for the rest of the six months it would be Red skin Island). The best coral reefes around Port Blair are found at Jolly Buoy Island. This island too is adjacent to the Wandoor beach.

title: Truly heavenly
review_text: One of the best places to visit in Andaman. It has one of the best coral reef. Snorkeling and glass bottom boat ride highly recommended.

title: Beautiful island . Snorkel and glass bottom
review_text:
Beautiful island of Andaman 
Getting permit is tricky we were not able to get permit earlier so we went very early morning to give a try to get Permit. we waited for like 2-3 hrs before it opens but it was all worth. 

Beautiful corals and fishes. 

Do visit but make sure to get permit in advance

title: Heaven On Earth
review_text: Must visit place while travelling to Andaman. Need to take permit (750 Rs. Per Person) One day prior visiting. Contact your hotel manager, they will arrange it for you.

title: Amazziiingggg experience
review_text:
very well preserved marine national park 
got to see the most exclusive species of corals and fishes and sea animals 
Great place to chill for a day and one does not need to be a swimmer to experience snorkelling there...

title: Serene beach with lots of corals in nearby shallow water.
review_text: Pristine beach with living corals in & around the island. Journey to Jolly Buoy island in boat from jetty is around 50 mints to 1 hour & very refreshing. Viewing glasses of glass bottom boats are well maintained & clear which makes the viewing of marine life from safety of boat memorable. Snorkeling is equally enjoyable.

title: trip to jollybouy islands
review_text: A very good day trip,Small beach clear to swim. One can easily see corals till a depth of 20 - 30 feet. This island is plastic free zone and so your mineral water bottles have to be discarded before going to this island. They will provide special bottles to transfer your water on rent basis.overall a good day trip to the islands if you staying more than one day in port blair you can try this trip.

title: Corals, corals !!!
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
review_text: Crystal clear water. Corals & marine life all around. Well maintained by the Forest department. Wish they had better facilities of wash rooms.

title: Best Place for Snorkeling
location: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
review_text:
Known for its crystal clear water and exotic marine life, Jolly Buoy island is a small island in the group of islands under Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park, Wandoor. This island is open for the tourist between October to April.. and for the rest of the months, tourists can visit the Redskin island, which is again under the same national park (This is done for the restoration and maintenance of both the islands). The Jetty for the Mahatma Gandhi National Park can be reached by Buses plying from Port Blair or by Tourist cars. The security checking here are pretty tough and you wont be allowed to take any plastic bags, water bottle or any sort of pollutant which may affect the marine life there if left behind. Also, make sure to keep your I-Card handy. 
This place is best among all of Andaman Islands for snorkeling. 
The snorkeling price starts from 300.00 INR and goes upto 1000.00 INR. Here each and every penny spent seems absolutely worth the experience you gain. 
If you ever travel to these Islands, keep the visit to Jolly Buoy in your itinerary before you travel to any other island for underwater experience. 
Glass bottom boat rides are also available here. More

title: A must vist, as a part of Port Blair
review_text:
The most favourite beach among the ones I visited. The most attractive part is it's clear water; you will find cluster of small fishes near the shore itself. 
It is open for 6 months, from November to April. And a permit is required for going to this island. You cannot stay there. And for conservation of coral you are not allowed to carry any plastic bag, not even plastic bottles. 
For carrying water, you need to rent bottles and fill water in those. 
Number of visitors are limited and applying for permit before hand is advised. 
The boats carrying passengers are not allowed to carry more than 50 pax, and total number of boats are also fixed. 
But even after all limitations I will suggest that it's worth. More

title: Great Place for Unwinding
review_text:
While several travellers choose to take glass-bottom boat rides here, I would not be one recommending those. The corals are beautiful and fish abundant but if it is worth your time and money to take an hour-long boat ride is something you might need to consider carefully before deciding. In case you do, just a heads-up, those cameras won't be very handy, so if you do decide, go in for a 'live' visual experience and keep those cameras aside. 

In general, the island is a must visit and is a treat to the eyes. Do plan a visit here and relax on the beach after taking a swim in the clear water! More

title: Excellent beach, blue clear water, photogenic
review_text: This is really a nice island. There are around 14-15 main tourist attraction islands in the entire Andaman archipelago and this one is definitely one among them. We went there on a sunny day and the photos clicked were amazing. Even a mobile selfie with 5MP camera looks great with blue water background.

title: Very good island beach
review_text: Very good island beach- Travel journey by boat is superb , coral viewing by coral boat and snorkelling is worth

title: Clear water
review_text: Great place to go and do snorkeling. No scuba diving here. Take own food as nothing available there. Permit needs to be taken which can be got by hotel or yourself on same day.

title: Excellent beach for swimming and snorkelling
review_text: Crystal clear waters and one of the best beaches to snorkel and view corals and underwater life. Take your own snorkeling kits if you can. It costs 300/500/1000 to do the snorkeling with the instructors. Beach is very clean. Cannot carry water bottles and plastic carry bags.

title: Much too far and overrated
review_text:
I had heard a lot about Jolly Buoy before coming to Andamans and made sure that I visited it. 
I was somewhat disappointed with the place in the end. First thing, it takes quite some time to reach here. It is far away from Port blair city and takes more than an hour to reach the boarding point (Wandoor). Then you have to get in a long queue for a govt ferry. After all this, the ferry itself takes quite some time in reaching the Jolly Buoy island. There are a number of restrictions on what you can take there. No food. No plastic. And when you reach there, you can only roam around in a very small area. Rest of the area is barred for visitors. 
I just dont see the point of all this hassle. It took a full day and we reached a restricted sort of a beach with very limited water and no food or other amenities. 
Its no doubt quite beautiful, but it just doesnt seem worth it. More

title: pristine and beautiful
review_text: best place to snorkel in the whole of andaman's . lot of Marine life , clear water and great guides. Boats start at 9 AM and it takes 45 mins to reach jolly buoy where you have 3 hours to do snorkelling and/or glass bottom boat both of which are great

title: GREAT CORAL REEF.
review_text:
wonderful island and journey to it is also awsome like paradise on earth. 
coral reefs are like we see on discovery. 
variety of colorful fish and corals sea animals are visible and sea is sooooo clean.

title: must visit for Snorkeling
review_text:
Very clean surrounding. 
Best for corel watching. 
Glass bottom boats and Snorkeling facility. 
Well maintained, no plastic allowed to be carried. 
Has small shop for buying packaged fruit juices / milk/ cold drinks.

title: Clean water of sea like Heaven
review_text: Top class experience on Coral reef. Rare government run establishment which is extremely Eco-friendly. All plastic is strictly banned here. My family had the best Snorkeling experience and Glass boat view of Corals on this island , which is squeaky clean. Kudos to the forest department officers.Great to see marine life. Must do at least snorkeling. It really worth. Glass bottom boats are al execellent. It will help only those who can't afford snorkeling due to either age or ill health. To entire this island, advance pass from Forest Dept. is required. Total time spent on the island would be approximately 4-5 hours after which the boats leave carrying same set of passengers. Changing rooms and toilets are available as also some snacks, juices. Jolly Buoy is open between November - March each year and remains closed for rest of period, thus ensuring corals get time to grow. Visited 31 Jan 2016 . More

title: Amazing
review_text:
Amazing island. Small beach clear to swim. Go for snorkelling here and nowhere else as the water is very clear. One can easily see underwater till a depth of 20 - 30 feet. This island is plastic free zone and so your mineral water bottles have to be discarded b4 going to this island. They will provide Milton bottles to transfer your water on rent basis. 200 rs per bottle and once u return it bak they will cut 5 rs and return remaining amount. 
Overall a must visit destination. 
Note - this island is closed for 6 mnths of the year when another similar island (Red skin island) is opened. More

title: Amazing place for snorkelling
review_text:
Jolly Buoy Island, located approximately about 45 minutes (by boat) from Wandoor is a beautiful island with amazing collection of corals, thus making it a great location for snorkeling and enjoying the glass bottom boat ride, in addition to just playing on the beach. Boat tickets cost Rs. 750 per head. The main boat is not capable of reaching till the beach so they transfer you to a small floating jetty and then shift you using glass bottom boat (a ten minute ride aimed at whetting your appetite) included in the package. 
Snorkeling and glass bottom boat rides both are recommended. We took the Rs. 1000 (per head) package for snorkeling and Rs. 600 (per head) for the glass bottom which ensures almost every part of the wonderful coral reef is covered. Total time spent on the island would be approximately 4-5 hours after which the boats leave carrying same set of passengers. Changing rooms and toilets are available as also some snacks, juices and water for sale. 
Jolly Buoy is open between November - March each year and remains closed for rest of period, thus ensuring corals get time to grow. More

title: Clean like Heaven :)
review_text: Amazingly clean waters...can actually see the light blue and green of the water when the sun shines! Beautiful!

title: Must visit
review_text: Jolly bouy is beautiful beach..and must visit place..beautiful marine life view frm glass bottoam boat.and snorkelling..only thing is they take high charges den fixed rate..officials take action only if people complain..

title: You just can't miss this !!!
review_text: Please modify your plan, if Jolly Buoy is not part of your Andaman trip. Yea, that should sum up everything. This amazing island provides a wonderful under-water experience that you would cherish forever. You should never miss this place. Currently, JB remains open for visitors from November to May, so plan your trip accordingly.

title: Wish i could have given it more STAR. Best place for Snorkelling in entire Andaman
review_text: Jolly Buoy!!! Oh Boy!!! what a place, Blue water, Dream Land. Believe me fairy land stories can also be true. This is the place i would never forget in this lifetime. You can see your toes in neck deep water. Don't forget to breath while admiring the beauty of this island. Hats off to Indian Govt. and Navy for maintaining this place so beautifully and religiously. No port / Platform for ferry is built there till now, since it requires brick and mortar which might harm the nature. They are doing all that can be done to keep it pristine and harmless from Human. The passenger ferry will stop 200-300 meters before the beach where water floating stand is installed, from there small boat will take you to island in batch of 9-10 people. With lot of contrast colour, this is the place you are looking for if you love snorkelling. Seriously don't waste money for Scuba / Sea walking, check out this place first for live colourful Coral life and under water beauty. Other places also offer you under water experience but this is THE best. Please note that water current can spike sharply here so you can try and listen to the staff and stick to their advice for one day. Even professional swimmers can misjudge the same. Stick to rope they have tied during snorkelling else water current might take you to miles before you realize. Inside... Jolly Buoy!!! Oh Boy!!! what a place, Blue water, Dream Land. Believe me fairy land stories can also be true. This is the place i would never forget in this lifetime. You can see your toes in neck deep water. Don't forget to breath while admiring the beauty of this island. Hats off to Indian Govt. and Navy for maintaining this place so beautifully and religiously. No port / Platform for ferry is built there till now, since it requires brick and mortar which might harm the nature. They are doing all that can be done to keep it pristine and harmless from Human. The passenger ferry will stop 200-300 meters before the beach where water floating stand is installed, from there small boat will take you to island in batch of 9-10 people. With lot of contrast colour, this is the place you are looking for if you love snorkelling. Seriously don't waste money for Scuba / Sea walking, check out this place first for live colourful Coral life and under water beauty. Other places also offer you under water experience but this is THE best. Please note that water current can spike sharply here so you can try and listen to the staff and stick to their advice for one day. Even professional swimmers can misjudge the same. Stick to rope they have tied during snorkelling else water current might take you to miles before you realize. Inside entry into the island is restricted. Animals like Monitor Lizard can also be seen in island but that's nothing to worry about if you stick to your business. Don't forget to take sun screen lotion and extra pair of cloths with you if you are planning for snorkelling. Also pack your food. Also you might want to visit ATM before visiting this place if you are planning for snorkelling and glass bottom boat ride. It is said that this place offer you worlds 2nd best underwater life after Australia. Take the Rs. 1000 Snorkelling option and Rs. 600/- glass bottom boat ride option; They are the best and worth spending as we don't go there everyday. Glass bottom boat ride can be enjoyed by Children and elderly citizen. North bay also offer glass bottom boat ride, you can skip that if have Jolly Buoy in your card and take the ride here instead. Last ferry from island departs at 2:30 and you will be free after 4 PM so you can plan activities and day accordingly. After coming back you can also visit Wandoor beach which is nearby only and enjoy the sunset there. More

title: Awesome experiance
review_text: Best Island in Andaman. Please do a high paid snorkeling session here. It is worth doing than Scuba Diving. Corals, fishes, star fish, magic flowers are wonderful. Overall island is superb and very scenic place. Even Nimo fish kissed on my hands several times during my snorkeling session.

title: A unique opportunity
review_text: Temperatures rise during2006 tsunami killed almost all of colourful corals and rendered them colorless.Process of rejuvenation has now started.This is a rare opportunity in one's lifetime to be witnessing coral formation.Glassbottom boats at Jollybuoy take you to journey of emerging life in ocean.not to be missed.

title: good and relaxing stay
review_text: comfortable drive in high speed jet. excellent view of corals and sea life from the glass bottom of boat

title: The best island there
review_text:
A very beautiful island. The way on the ferry to this place in itself is so beautiful. The mangrove filled shores are breathtaking. 

Do not miss the snorkelling there for the world! Go for the 1000Rs one. Worth every rupee. 

Also carry swimsuits. The water is so clear and pollution free. You can swim as much as you like. We had an amazing time there.

title: Quite and beautiful
review_text: A wonderful white sand beach, clear blue water, less waves. We spent 2 hrs on this beach. Views are great to see the beach from the water. Clean and neatly maintained, guards are very active, keep watching the swimmers. One should not think of travelling to far destinations from India for pristine beaches, just come to Jolly buoy island.

title: amazing view of coral
review_text: The trip was through ferry and almost similar fauna of mangrovers as sunderbans. The snorkling for 1 hr was for 1000 inr and truly speaking worth it. The corals at jolly buoy island are living so you see almost most variety of fishes and their participation in food chain...one of the visit places to visit if you are in port blair

title: Never Seen Better Corals and Cleaner Beach in India
review_text:
This Island had the "Clean India Initiative" years ahead of the rest of the country. 

Three things about this Island: 
1. Never seen as clear water as here 
2. Really Safe Beach as restricted crowd is allowed 
3. Really Clean Beach with strict staff 
4. Will not see better corals 

If you are planning to do snorkeling on the Andamans, then do it here cause everywhere else is just waste of money compared to this place. 

There are numerous types of corals and fishes. 

Note: You need to take prior permission to visit this place so plan ahead.

title: Mesmerizing
review_text:
Jolly Buoy is heaven on Indian earth. It is straight out of animal planet/national geographic. 
This island can be accessed by boat (advance booking required) 
Everyday between October and April boats ply between 9.00am-10.00am from Wandoor to Jolly Buoy island and take a limited number of people.The last of the boats returns back to Wandoor by 2.30pm. Plastics are a strict no no in this island. Here you can do snorkeling in abundance. You can avail the services of glass boat ride and see the corals and fishers to your heart content. You are transported to another world here and you will love it. You need to carry your own food and water(in flasks provided by the dept of Environment and Forests,Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Remember this area/island is maintained by the forest authorities. More

title: Best viewed corals and pearls
review_text:
Among all the island I have visited, Jolly Buoy experienced me with the best view of corals and pearls. 
However you need to get a permit to visit this island, so get it done well in advance and don't keep it pending to be done on the same day morning. 
The ship in which we have visited to jolly Buoy has a package included to show the various fishes via Glass Bottom Ride. However, you can pay more to go more deeper and to see some more under-water experience. 
You should go for snorkelling over there which is for 300, 500 and 1000. I have done for 500 which really worthy with the under-water scenes that I have experienced. 
The water over there is deep but waves are not that high, so you may also go for swimming within an area boundary. 
You will not be able to carry any plastic items over there More

title: Easily the best place to visit on your andaman trip!!
review_text: An half an hour trip by ferry from Vandoor into the sea, Jolly buoy island accomodates only 40 people at a time max. Fish here havent sufferd man and you will see all types coming out of the water to get a peek at you. The glass bottomed boat ride is one of the sights to never miss

title: The Bestv Coral hub
review_text: Don't miss to visit the best coral and marine life view point . excellent view , clean and clear water . Vary attractive for kids and family . The best snorkeling experience for ever. Any one whpo visit Portblair , must visit this island .

title: The best place in Andaman. A paradise!!!
review_text:
This island was scheduled on the last day of our 4N5D trip and we were pretty tired. But till then, we were satisfied with our site seeing and were enjoying the islands. We had already done scuba and snorkeling at elephant beach and though what else this island should offer. Nevertheless, the day started pretty early since we had to travel for 1.5 hrs to reach wandoor beach from where we have to leave for the island. No plastic bottles are allowed to be taken into the island and no food will be available there, so we had to take the cello bottles given for rent and fill them with the packed water. But surprisingly, there was no restriction to take lays chips packet or biscuit packets even thought they're also plastic. It took about at least an hour to reach there. When we reached there the purity of the island took us by surprise. I've never seen such crystal clear blue water in beach in my life. The experience of being on that island, even though only for a few hours, will be in our memory for lifetime!!! Pure bliss!!! Do not miss the glass bottom ride and snorkeling there. It's a must do activity if you ever go to Andaman in your life time!!! Snorkeling here is 1000 times better than what we did in elephant beach. You can see variety of fishes and corals, touch them and... This island was scheduled on the last day of our 4N5D trip and we were pretty tired. But till then, we were satisfied with our site seeing and were enjoying the islands. We had already done scuba and snorkeling at elephant beach and though what else this island should offer. 

Nevertheless, the day started pretty early since we had to travel for 1.5 hrs to reach wandoor beach from where we have to leave for the island. No plastic bottles are allowed to be taken into the island and no food will be available there, so we had to take the cello bottles given for rent and fill them with the packed water. But surprisingly, there was no restriction to take lays chips packet or biscuit packets even thought they're also plastic. 

It took about at least an hour to reach there. When we reached there the purity of the island took us by surprise. I've never seen such crystal clear blue water in beach in my life. The experience of being on that island, even though only for a few hours, will be in our memory for lifetime!!! Pure bliss!!! 
Do not miss the glass bottom ride and snorkeling there. It's a must do activity if you ever go to Andaman in your life time!!! 
Snorkeling here is 1000 times better than what we did in elephant beach. You can see variety of fishes and corals, touch them and have a small glimpse of what the huge marine world has underneath us..... More

title: Minus Bengalees trip was awesome !
review_text: Its amazing island with crystal clear water arround. Its pretty small island with not much to do except chilling on white sand and get yourself soaked in blue waters along with watching coral reefs from glass bottom boat. When I went there there were more than 70% bengaleese only and they created too much nuisance everywhere (known for shouting all the time and littering), I even went into argument with one of the lady there for throwing garbage in open. Anyways coming back to island its amazing and a must visit place.

title: Great Beach and lovely place to get your own snorkel
review_text: But do not pay the money for the guided snorkel if you are a decent swimmer. Stay within the netted area. This place has VERY strong currents even for an expert swimmer. The guided snorkel is a rip off. They are destroying the corals and the fishes and display and manhandle fish and corals.

title: Wonderful and the best point in Andaman
review_text: Take a car to Madoor and then board a boat. Carry photo identity cards for police checking. Carry food but no plastic as they fine Rs 300. Good for glass bottom boat and snorkeling. Even 3 year old kid can do snorkeling. Can see beautiful corals and touch as well. Treat to watch the fishes. You can also see sea cucumber, tiger fish, magic coral and real pearls under water and so on. Their is only few restaurants in Mandoor

title: Best Corals i have seen in Andaman
review_text:
Worth the trip. lovely beautiful corals and fish. 
The guides (boat men) fleece you with charges. even if you want to go on your own and yu have all the equipment you still need to go with them. 
they are hand in glove with the government people and the guy who comes as security. they say the guides are trained, but actually, they step on all the coral and show you. they even pick up starfish etc and give in your hand which is the worst thing we could do. but as usual, it is govt. organised so no training no education. they, in fact, ask you to touch the coral and disturb the fish. which I feel should never be allowed. 
but for the beauty of it, you cant miss it More

title: Very excellent island for Snorkeling
review_text: This island is located in Mahatma Gandhi National Park. Island is about 60 km away from Port Blair, out of half we go by bus up to Wandoor and the by boat. half of the year Red Skin Island is open for visitors and next half Jolly Buoy Island is open for visitors. Jolly Buoy island is very reach for corals to see. Water is clear, can see clearly up to 30 feet. Colored fishes, star fish and many types of fishes you can see here. If you go around 300 meters away from sea shore you can see all three stages of corals and with help of guide can touch some of them. Here guides are also very helpful. This is full day trip. More

title: Crystal clear water
review_text:
Best place for snorkeling. Awesome marine life. You can touch many varieties of corals with rates ranging from Rs 300, 500, 1000. There is complementary glass bottom boat ride for all for 10 mins. If you like, you can pay additional for extra ride. 
Blue and green ocean :) a must visit

title: Paradise....
review_text:
Do not miss this place if you are planning to visit Andaman. 
This island is no plastic zone hence you can experience beautiful corals and wide variety of marine life at this place. Water is crystal clear hence snorkeling experience we had here was amazing. This is one of the place that I will definitely remember for rest of my life.

title: Amazing!!!
review_text:
Jolly buoy island - is accessible by government ferry which takes around 40-45 mins from wandoor jetty... The ferry ride in itself is boring and very slow.... But the things change the moment you start approaching Jolly buoy island... The sea colors change dramatically... White sand beach is visible at a distance... 
And when you reach the island..... The place is truly mesmerizing... White sand beach.... Water is crystal clear... Sea is multi colored... Total bliss to be at the place!!! 
I guess it's the Best place for snorkeling in andamans, much better than havelock atleast!!! One should not miss the glass bottom boat ride as well... One short round is complementary with the ferry ride.... But should go in for bigger round by making extra payment, it is totally worth!!! 
This island is closed for 6 months - may to November!! 
Must visit on trip to andamans.... Amazing amazing place!! More

title: Must visit !!
review_text: Though this island was not part of trip but got added later and it was worth it...Amazing corals and various fish ....Must visit ...

title: Best Beach In India
review_text: Jolly Buoy Island is the best attaraction in whole of Andman.Water is very clear.Corals in the sea are superb.I have not seen such beautiful corals in my life,not even in pictures.One must visit this place.

title: Must Visit
review_text: Jolly Buoy is a must visit destination for all. Everybody should do the snorkelling here the corals are just fantastic here much better than the Havelock island corals

title: Splendor of nature
review_text: Jolly Buoy Island, this was the last minute inclusion to our itinerary. Jolly Buoy is part of the 15 islands, that form the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. It is open for only 6 months in an year, and lucky for us that it opened on 17th Nov,about 5 days prior to our travel. Mr. Rao secured the permits for us by submitting our photo IDs. A half an hour boat ride from Wandoor beach took us to the Jolly Buoy Island. The Rs. 750 boat ride includes the glass bottom boat ride/snorking at Jolly Buoy. You could see waters of 3 colours in the National Park. As you go near to the Jolly Buoy the water becomes crystal clear and you could see the marine life as deep as 30 ft. quite clearly. We got down from our boat onto the jetty and was given a 10 min. tour in the glass bottom boat, just to entise us with the beautiful flora and fauna of the sea. This ride was complimentary. You could additionally book the ride for another 40 min. by paying extra. We opted for snorkling instead. This proved to be the best decision ever. The variety of corals, fishes (parrot fish, zebra fish, star fish, Nemo fish, ball-star fish), sea anemone and sea cucumber that we saw and touched could be seen only in Discovery or the Nat Geo channels. I found snorkling much easier than... Jolly Buoy Island, this was the last minute inclusion to our itinerary. Jolly Buoy is part of the 15 islands, that form the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. It is open for only 6 months in an year, and lucky for us that it opened on 17th Nov,about 5 days prior to our travel. Mr. Rao secured the permits for us by submitting our photo IDs. A half an hour boat ride from Wandoor beach took us to the Jolly Buoy Island. The Rs. 750 boat ride includes the glass bottom boat ride/snorking at Jolly Buoy. You could see waters of 3 colours in the National Park. As you go near to the Jolly Buoy the water becomes crystal clear and you could see the marine life as deep as 30 ft. quite clearly. We got down from our boat onto the jetty and was given a 10 min. tour in the glass bottom boat, just to entise us with the beautiful flora and fauna of the sea. This ride was complimentary. You could additionally book the ride for another 40 min. by paying extra. We opted for snorkling instead. This proved to be the best decision ever. The variety of corals, fishes (parrot fish, zebra fish, star fish, Nemo fish, ball-star fish), sea anemone and sea cucumber that we saw and touched could be seen only in Discovery or the Nat Geo channels. I found snorkling much easier than sea-diving. Even my 8 year old daughter could do it. More

title: A well planned vacation to Jolly Buoy Island / Port Blair / Havelock Island / North bay / Baratang Limestone cave
review_text:
Dear Friends, Plan. Planning a vacation in Andaman Islands (hub being Port Blair) required communicating with individuals at Port Blair (PB) where at times communications were inconsistent. This did not deter us but we maintained our objective to locate first a suitable accommodation next a reliable operator. Main apprehensions were the numerous forms / approvals / rules that are in vogue is unknown to “non islanders” as also the necessary convoy / boat / ferry timings. It certainly is a “burden” for less informed vacationers. Given below is the program that we prepared and executed with the help of operator at PB. The operator’s name is KP Mathews whose mobile numbers are +91 9679536122 / +91 9474238384 and the land line being +91 3192260110 and email ID being kpmathew.shsi@gmail.com. 2. Cleanliness. An interesting fact that we witnessed was that all beaches and areas outside PB is litter free. No plastic or any litter was observed. Suitable disposable containers were around for disposing litter. As a result the beaches were beautiful soft clean sand were all around. PB is a different story but cleanliness was noticeable. 3. Eateries. Apart from PB, eateries were simple and few. For example early morning convoy assembly point had roadside simple stalls serving Idli and Vada plus coffee/ tea. Whether we ate at Havelock or Wandoor eateries, the fare normally comprised Fish Rice some vegetable curry and lentil. Bottled water is available. Costs you could average... Dear Friends, 

Plan. Planning a vacation in Andaman Islands (hub being Port Blair) required communicating with individuals at Port Blair (PB) where at times communications were inconsistent. This did not deter us but we maintained our objective to locate first a suitable accommodation next a reliable operator. Main apprehensions were the numerous forms / approvals / rules that are in vogue is unknown to “non islanders” as also the necessary convoy / boat / ferry timings. It certainly is a “burden” for less informed vacationers. Given below is the program that we prepared and executed with the help of operator at PB. The operator’s name is KP Mathews whose mobile numbers are +91 9679536122 / +91 9474238384 and the land line being +91 3192260110 and email ID being kpmathew.shsi@gmail.com. 

2. Cleanliness. An interesting fact that we witnessed was that all beaches and areas outside PB is litter free. No plastic or any litter was observed. Suitable disposable containers were around for disposing litter. As a result the beaches were beautiful soft clean sand were all around. PB is a different story but cleanliness was noticeable. 

3. Eateries. Apart from PB, eateries were simple and few. For example early morning convoy assembly point had roadside simple stalls serving Idli and Vada plus coffee/ tea. Whether we ate at Havelock or Wandoor eateries, the fare normally comprised Fish Rice some vegetable curry and lentil. Bottled water is available. Costs you could average at Rs 120 – Rs 150 /- per head. PB is a different story where more varieties are available. To estimate costing one could plan Rs 500/- to 800/- per head per day depending on taste and ambience. It must be remembered that on an average the cost of items are generally 30% higher than mainland. 

4. Accommodation. Sufficient accommodation both at PB and Havelock is available to suit different tastes ranging from Rs 2500/- to Rs 15000/- per night for double bed. It would be prudent to latch on to a tour operator and plan accordingly. Rains could never be predicted however a spell would last 30 minutes down pour generally in the evening / night. 

5. Interesting. We found the visit to Cellular jail, Marine Museum, Catamaran Makruzz ride to Havelock, Anthropological museum, corals and colourful fishes, litter free beaches at Havelock and Chidiyatapu and the limestone cave at Baratang plus the convoy ride through jungle while also fortunate to see a few aborigines and their thatched huts along our road. Overall a good outing for a week costing us besides air fare and accommodation cum meals at PB was Rs 28000/- (includes all ticketing / approvals and permissions) just for a week’s tour by road cum boat. 

21 Nov 15 Saturday Port Blair 

1340 - ex Madras by air Arrive Port Blair 
1400 – By hired transport Transfer to Accommodation – Lunch 
1630 - By hired transport - Visit Corbyn's Cove Beach. Hiring a speed boat (cost Rs 300/- per head) sped across to view Snake Island where sea snakes nest. We did not land there. 
1800 (approx per show timing) – By hired transport proceed to witness the Light and Sound show at Cellular Jail. Price of ticket Rs 50/-. Post light and sound show which was fair, we returned to Accommodation – Dinner. 

22 Nov 15 Sunday Port Blair –North Bay and Ross Island 
0600 After Breakfast – By hired transport proceed to ferry (Rs 550/- per head) at Aberdeen jetty, for a Visit North Bay and Ross Island. Please check your ferry timing. First, North Bay visit you have glass bottom boat to view corals below. Thereafter sea walk and snorkeling is also available which we did not venture. Lunch is available at a eatery costing about Rs 150/- per head. As the same Ferry at about 1400 hours departed for Ross Island. This place has a lot of history since British rulers of days gone used this Island as their Headquarters to govern India. You will also see Japanese Gun placement and bunkers as also old building structures which today are covered by nature. Entry ticket is Rs 50/- per head. There are deers, rabbits, squirrels and peacocks which strut about in front of you. You will also sight the North Bay light house which incidentally is on the reverse of each Indian 20 Rupee note. The Island is maintained by Indian Navy. 
PM – Return to Aberdeen jetty by Ferry and subsequently by hired transport to accommodation - Dinner 


23 Nov 15 Monday – Havelock (WOULD REQUIRE FERRY to and Fro TIMING DETAILS) 

0600 – By hired transport proceed Phoenix Bay for Catamaran (named Makruzz) Ferry to Havelock Island. Cost of ticket Rs 3450/- per head. It was a comfortable ride in AC comfort to Havelock Island. Upon landing there your operator should have organized hired AC transportation to visit Kalapathar beach and Radhanagar beach. Lunch could be had at one of the eateries, depending upon your palate. I would recommend Sree Hari a simple eatery but good food was served. Cost Rs 200/- per head. The beaches and sands were a sight at both beaches. The waves rolling periodically gave a beautiful sight. Those interested for additional underwater sports would require staying the night in a suitable accommodation on Havelock Island. We preferred to return to Port Blair. Accommodations are available suiting various pockets are available but needs advance booking else you may be stuck. 
PM – Return by Makruzz Ferry to Phoenix Bay jetty and by hired transport to accommodation - Dinner 

24 Nov 15 Tuesday – Port Blair and Chidiyatapu beach 

1000 – In order to have a respite from early rising, a relaxed program was executed. After Breakfast By hired transport proceed to visit Sagarekha (Government Emporium where its believed you would receive appropriate items at reasonable prices, and post lunch depart for Chidiyatappu beach to view the sunset. It is supposed to be picturesque. Unfortunately, overcast sky prevented such a view but the beach was a pleasant surprise. 
PM – Return by hired transport - Dinner 
25 Nov 15 Wednesday - Port Blair 

0400 – By hired transport visit Baratang Island and Limestone Cave (Stalagmite and Stalactite). Such early rising is view a convoy collects and departs at 0600 hours from about 28 Kms from PB. The route is through aborigines Jarawite inhabited land. Though the Jarawites do not venture out on the high way but if you are lucky you may spot a few on the fringes of the jungle, we did. We also saw thatched huts on raised ground at a distance. Nobody is allowed to slow down / stop / attempt to meet the aborigines. Suitable protection force is at hand keeping an eye. Upon arrival at Baratang you need to disembark from transport and catch a vehicle ferry which carries you across to the other side where your operator should have made arrangement for a speed boat to convey you to the limestone cave which is hidden in between mangrove. Your boat will convey you to landing spot where your boat operator will double up as guide and a walk of about 3 Km undulating path to limestone cave entrance. At the cave you will see a sink hole atop, Stalagmite and Stalactite (each formation formation depends on viewer perceptions. The cave is about 50 meters long, single path, dark and security permits limited entrance by queueing. Photography is permitted but a professional would do an excellent job. There are sheltered seating arrangements outside at the waiting area. On completion of cave visit a return walk of 3 Km through mangrove path to your speed boat on jetty. Cave visit takes about 3 hours. Upon arrival at ferry station, lunch could be had at a eatery atop the adjacent building to the disembarking point. There is nothing much to remark about the said eatery. Cost about Rs 150/- per head, The boat returns you to Ferry station for return ferry to your parked vehicle across the river. 
PM – By hired transport return to PB. Dinner 

26 Nov 15 Thursday – Port Blair 
1000 – We had planned for a visit to the second highest spot named Mount Harriet but unfortunately the road was not motorable as repairs were in progress and this was cancelled. In lieu By hired transport we proceeded to Cellular jail to view the bell tower (bell no longer there), anthropological museum, marine museum and Samudrika. 
PM - By hired transport return to accommodation - Dinner 
27 Nov 15 Friday - Jolly Buoy / Red Skin. By hired transport visit Wandoor jetty for motor launch ride to Jolly Buoy. Red skin and Jolly Buoy is open alternately every 6 months to permit coral life respite from “tourist”. We proceeded by motor launch to Jolly Buoy and upon arrival the vessel went alongside a plastic pontoon where passengers were disembarked for waiting smaller boats. Here once more glas bottom boats were available for visiting 6 spots of coral life costing Rs 600/- per head. Snorkeling is also available at a cost which we avoided. Total time required was about 5 hours. There were no eateries there, even drinking water carried is required to be carried in water bottles provided by Forest Service at a deposit of Rs 200/- which upon return is refunded and Rs 5/- is charged. Police men and women are stationed on the beach to ensure no littering as also adhering to rules. Motor launch after appointed time returns to Wandoor jetty where eateries are available. Simple food is served but costs about Rs 200/- per head 

28 Nov 15 Saturday – Return to Madras/ Bangalore 

1200 – Breakfast and Post Lunch clear all Bills and proceed by Transport to airport for onwards flight to Madras / Bangalore by air. More

title: Marian Beauty
review_text: This is an unman island, only visitors allowed through boat service. This is a place for enjoying Marian beauty.

title: Good coral reef
review_text: Govt controlled waters and park. They are very strict and will not allow plastic even water bottles. Carry your own food. Nothing available. All the boat people are after your money so bargain and they will reduce for the water activities.

title: Torquoise blue waters
review_text: Your trip to Andaman and Nicobar islands is incomplete without Jolly Buoy detour. Serene blue crystal clear waters you can be in all day long, and still won't have enough of it. Snorkeling here is a MUST to experience! You could also a take a glass bottom boat ride if you are scared of snorkeling to view the beautiful underwater life. The beach that maintains a 'no plastic zone' in true sense.

title: Jolly bauy Island
review_text:
It is a must visit to Jolly Buoy - it takes nearly 30 to 40 min boat journey from jetty. It is compulsory that not to take any plastic water bottles, only packed food items allowed to the island . Very clean and nice coral viewing . Very different kind of corals can be easily viewed from glass bottom boat. 
It is very clean feels like in foriegn sea. 
Limited acess and limited entries per day , so better to go early morning at the jetty.

title: Beauty Beyond Expectations
review_text: Best place in Port Blair.Beautiful beaches crystal clear water what else needed .Worth going ,.Changing rooms are also available there .

title: A heaven for Marine Ecosystem Lover..!!
review_text:
Jollybouy Island, situated in the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park is at a sailing distance of 2 Hrs from Wandoor Jetty. 

The island is an excellent snorkeling destination with a very rich underwater life and the activity is done under proper guidance and safety. 

The islands needs a special forest Permit which can be obtained a day before from the Forest Counter in the Tourism Department office near the High Court building. The permit cost somewhere around Rs.50/- and the boat fare is about Rs.750/- Per Head. To attain the permit one should apply with the ID proofs of the visiting travelers. This is sometimes a tedious work for travelers can outsource the tickets to agents. They charge around Rs.100/- per ticket. 

Also, the ticket & permit can be taken on same day at the Wandoor Jetty too but the numbers are very less, hence the chance too. 

So i would suggest if possible make a prior arrangement for the trip. 

Note: No snacks counter so please take some refreshment but request you to keep the island clean. More

title: Amazing ..... Clean & Turquoise sea
review_text:
Though in entire Andaman all the island are clean and have turquoise/blue water but this island is even better due to restrictive and no plastic zone. Entire beach is extremely clean. I did snorkeling and scuba at 5 different islands in Andaman and found that surprisingly this one has best marine life. Very colorful corals with very good visibility inside water. 
The only flaw is the jetty that operates to bring people from Port Blair to this island. That boat was old and very unsafe. All the safety jackets were torn off and very dirty. 

If you can bear 45 mins of this boat, it is worth to go this island. 

It is clean and wish it will remain like that. More

title: Ravinderjit Singh Bajwa
review_text: Could not go to the jolly buoy island as the ferry leaves at 9am.And we reached at about 11 am. Saw the museum there, which provides good knowledge about the marine life in and around the islands.Next day we had to catch our flight back.

title: Can give a miss
review_text: The Jolly Buoy islands are about 30-35 kms from Port Blair and are part of a marine ecosystem. The Govt operates ferries for a 3- 4 hour tour to these islands which is a godo expereince. However the tour is not well managed & hence many toursits skip. Scuba diving is also done

title: Not worth the travel
review_text: The Jolly Buoy islands are close to wandoor and are maintained by the Govt. They offer ferry visits at around 9 am which takes us through the marine ecosystem with options to do scuba etc. However these are not well planned & hence do not give a very soothing experience which anyways we can have at other islands

title: A piece of Maldives in India
review_text:
You need to take a steamer boat to the island. The journey itself was awesome - among the mangroves, lurky turns along the creek, crocodiles at some places of the lagoon...and then it opened to the vast sea with dark blue colour. A must go for scuba diving lovers. You can enjoy the underwater corals hiring a glass bottom boat. Customized trips with individual boats are also available for foreigners. 

The corals have been slightly destroyed after the Tsunami, still what is left is wonderful for first timers. You can also plan to visit the nearby Red Skin Island.

title: Excellant island
review_text: I could not visited this site due to restriction of military. It will be opened on 1.11.15. But I have seen from distance and heard from the people that the island is very beautiful and glass bottom boat and snorkelling are excellant .

title: Good timepass
review_text: Water games, clean water, cool air, it will attract child to play games and family also. Neatly maintained

title: ROBINSON CRUSOE'S ISLAND
review_text: Out of nowhere we approach this white patch of sand in the middle of the Ocean ...and PRESTO...it turns out to be sheer MAGIC.Snorkeling is best done here. Loved the Experience...See Photos. Dont Miss this Island EVER !

title: A Great Place for Snorkelling/ Diving Enthisiasts
review_text: Jolly Buoy Island is one of the best snorkelling and diving spots in Port Blair. It can be reached by a 45 min boat ride from Wandoor National Park. The island has shallow waters with corals for about 60 - 70 mtrs. Thereafter, the ocean floor falls to several hundred feet. There are glass bottom boats that provide a glimpse of the corals in shallow waters. One can snorkel in the shallow areas (or along the drop, if confident). For the accomplished swimmers, the free dive along the face of the sheer drop is a great experience.

title: An interesting day out, grilled fish, some diving, and generally having fun on the water.
review_text: I went as part of a group to jolly Buoy island, most of the group were there to do a try dive. A few of us were more experienced divers and wanted to do two good dives. The first dive we did from the shore was adequate, the kit was good, the instructors were competent and fun, but the visibility was poor. after a longish wait we went out on the boar in the late afternoon and conducted a shallow ( 10m) but rather wonderful dive. One felt as though no-one had ever ben diving here before, we saw some fish, a turtle, but mostly a collection of excellent corals and nudibranchs coming out in their full UV splendour. Would I go back- perhaps, but I think there are better dive set ups in Port Havelock. If you want a taste of diving this is a simple and easy way to conduct a try dive. Overall a good experience, and good value for money. More

title: Oct 2015 _ Andaman
review_text: Nice place. But not much to do.. sea walk and other activities are best done at North bay. Good place for photographs.

title: Amazing Place & a must visit
review_text: This is among the top 5 best place to visit once ya in Andaman. Perfect sandy beach cum island.. Beware of one often said thing that scuba diving is nice over here. There is no scuba diving done over here as it comes under M.G National Park area. Snorkeling can however be done. The water over here so clear that almost everytng can be seen from top of the water only. Coral density and also variety of fish over here is very large as it is an undisturbed area except morning till late afternoon when travelers are allowed. After that no one is permitted to stay. Out n out its an amazing place to stay. More

title: Breath taking boat journey
review_text: Excellent journey from Wandoor and the beach emerges in the noon. This place is closed for six months to allow corals to grow.

title: Scuba Diving / Snorkaling for seeing Coral Reef
review_text: Best place for Scuba Diving and Snorkeling. Average south Indian / Bengali type foods are available in local shops. If you have a plan to go Ross island on the same day Either get parcel or have food there it self.

title: good Island
review_text: It is nice to share my experience that I found you must visit this Island during your trip,clean water etc.

title: coral island
review_text: One of the coral island of Andaman island. is the best for snorkeling and glass bottom boat ride, now days here is some other water sport also available. but one bad thing is here limited tourist permits is here.

title: Must visit of Andman
review_text: One of the best island of south andman.This Island is also known as Mahatma Gandhi National Park.I enjoyed a full day here.

title: Amazing island
review_text: Wonderful island where u can see underwater coral... clean water, amazing view...., u can see lots fishes in d sea specialy jelly fish.... feels very good ....

title: Mr
review_text: Fantastic location. Lovely underwater. Must visit place. Most beautiful place I have visited in India

title: Good place to see corals and different fishes
review_text:
It is really good place to visit. 
You get to do snorkeling here. 
Corals and fishes are unique in this beach.

title: snorkling
review_text: Excellent clean water and corals.Get ready with your snorkling kit.Make sure you get up early to catch the ferry from wandur.

title: Jolly good, Atta Boy!!!
review_text: Top class experience on Coral reef. Rare government run establishment which is extremely Eco-friendly. All plastic is strictly banned here. My family had the best Snorkeling experience and Glass boat view of Corals on this island , which is squeaky clean. Kudos to the forest department officers.

title: A must visit in your Andaman itinerary!!
review_text: turquoise crystal clear water & a huge variety of marine life.....!! Snorkeling here is a heavenly experience!! Mother nature at her best!

title: Clam Island
review_text: This island is very clam and quite area. We went the island by boat. Journey to island was very exiting.

title: Awesome Place !
review_text: The place is awesome ! The water is crystal clear and the corals are awesome and love the view ! No plastic bottles or any such thing allowed so the place is clean as well !

title: Nature hunt
review_text: It very nice place, we enjoy the bot ride to the island. we see under water marine, colour full fishes in natural surroundings

title: A must visit place, coral viewing site, scuba diving
review_text: A must visit place, coral viewing site, scuba diving. "It's one day trip...enjoy the under water coral view through snorkeling..."

title: Must watch
review_text:
It is not include in make my trip and thomas....tour company... 
But it is must visit place... 
I booked my car and govt. Apporval with the help of my makemy trip tour advisor. .. 
Best palce for snorkling....far better than elephant island snorkling... 
Well preserve island by forest department. .... 
Cant carry plastic.... 
Keep money with you as no ATM nearby.....

title: Jolly Buoy - True Jolly Island
review_text:
Wow! Crystal Clear Water, Wonderful Travelling Experience in Ferry into Sea up to Redskin Island. Greenish Trees everywhere in Island. Museum located in Island displays very reality of Animals (Crocodile, Tortoise, Fishes, Forest, Corels etc... ). 

Important thing is Pollution Free. (100% Plastic Banned Area) 

Glass Boats used to See Corals. Wonderful Experiance.

title: Great, unbelievable experience of marine life
review_text:
Great to see marine life. Must do at least snorkeling. It really worth. Glass bottom boats are not that good. It will help only those who can't afford snorkeling due to either age or ill health. To entire this island, advance pass from Forest Dept. is required. Which may be collected before the tour at the main gate of Mahatma gandhi National marine Museum at Wandoor. But pls. keep in mind, that during peak season, it is easily exhausted as only a limited no. of travelers are allowed to visit per day. So pls. collect it from Tourism office in one day advance. You may also ask your travel agent for this. 

Go ahead and just enjoy. Pls. don't miss at all! More

title: Coral and blue water.
review_text: Time restriction and life time experience to see coral and nature from so close. Nice and very good and popular island.

title: Ordinary visit
review_text: Jolly Boy trip was an ordinary one. Though there was a lot of scope to make it adventurous. A thick dense tropical mangrove rainforest all around. The islands are very attractive from distance. But the tour was dull as usual. Glass boat ride, snorkelling. More variety was expected by me. The sea was fantastic clear blue water. Very comfortable for swimming on your own. I enjoyed swimming but not the trip at all.

title: Snorkelling and Sea Paradise
review_text: Wow what a place this is. White sands deep blue water and the most amazing coral life you will ever encounter. These waters are restricted areas for ships and boats and falls under the marine protection dept. You need a pass to get here but once you do the hard work this paradise really pays off. Scuba diving is also not allowed in order to protect the precious coral life but you have great options of snorkeling with a guide here. The Coral life is something to be seen close and by touch. The guides really hand you star fish and corals to touch and the experience was nothing short of heavenly. More

title: jolly buoy island portblair
review_text: it is a one hour ride from the Mahatma Gandhi National Park. Nothing is available at the jolly buoy island. It is advisable to carry your own water and snacks. Snorkelling, Corals can be seen from the glass boat

title: Really pretty place!
review_text: I liked my trip to Jolly Buoy and the walk in coral beach. The colours of the waters here are just amazing. Ross island is certainly more interesting but Jolly Buoy is a must do as well.

title: A Must visit Island
review_text: the clean and clear water for snorkelling. Though the corals are dead after 2004 tsunami, still this island is one of the best.

title: must visit place in portblair
review_text: must visit place in portblair. the journey leading to this place is really scenic in between many island an the crystal clear water just adds to the natures beauty.

title: Highlight of Port Blair trip
review_text: This is something just not to be missed at Port Blair. The long drive to reach is followed by a 20 min boat ride to a secluded lovely island patch. Snorkelling there is super fun.

title: Pristine Beauty
review_text:
It's a racket where your movement restricted by drawing perimeter where you could hardly see any coral/ fishes . They will take you out of it once you pay them extra and wow the world is so different !! What an experience with fishes and live corals. 
Must visit place

title: Best island I have ever seen !!!
review_text: Best snorkelling experience, the corals are best that one can find in Asia. The island is open for just 6 months and other 6 months they give time for corals to grow. Dont miss it if you visit Andaman !!! No changing room... Carrying plastic is not allowed...

title: Lovely place for snorkelling
review_text: One of the finest location for snorkelling. They have maintained this place plastic free. Tourists are not allowed to take plastic bottle. You need to hire water bottles paying Rs.5 from forest deptt. Beauty of place is unparelled.

title: best Snorkelling
review_text: a day trip where you will see best corals of Port blair. if you have some time to visit this island its a must go...

title: Nice experience but expensive!
review_text:
Make no mistake Jolly buoy is a pristine island with white sands and heavenly green waters! But the only water activity available is snorkeling which is priced between 800-1500 which is unnecessarily expensive for a short ride. 

Adding the expense of the ferry ride, it can be a little less value for money especially since beaches on Havelock are all as good as Jolly buoy hence it might be an unnecessary add on to itinerary, and can be skipped. I would rather suggest spending as much time in Havelock than here! 

Though discounting the expense part, it was a great experience, especially since its completely non commercial and has no shops or resorts of any kind. The beach and waves are beautiful and it was a memorable experience for us :) More

title: Pristine clear beach with corals
review_text:
Jolly buoy island is very famous for under water corals and the pristine clear beach. This place is one hour journey from Wandoor beach. Snorkeling and scuba diving are available here. 
This is located in Mahatma Gandhi National Marine Park, 30 Kms from Port Blair by road. Jolly buoy island will not be opened throughout the year as it is protected for live corals. 
The normal time leaving to Jolly buoy island is 9.00am. All the ships leave at the same time and come back together at 2.00pm. 
As a standard trip, while getting down from the ship and transferring to the island through small boats, visitors will be taken through a complementary ride and will be shown these under water corals through glass bottom. This is for only a very short duration (10 minutes). People willing to see more of these can hire a boat independently and enjoy by paying extra amount. Additional amount has to be paid also for snorkeling and scuba diving. We can see more spices in snorkeling since they are highly protected here. 
The beach is clear and best place to walk and swim. More

title: One of best of best at andamans
review_text:
Snorkeling should be done at jolly buoy, A lonely island clean and crystal clear water. 

Tariff: 

1. Ship journey to and fro- 750rs, includes 5 mins glass boat drop to Island and forest department fees. 

2. Various packages for snorkeling starts from 300rs to 1000rs 

3. Different tariff for glass boat ride 300rs to 1000rs. 

For more details :http://www.thetravelreminiscences.in/2015/02/amazing-andamans-day-1-jolly-buoy-island.html

title: Nice place
