review_text: very good experience on corals. charges are on higher side. One of the best snorkeling place. Start early morning to avoid rush. Take snacks along with you since nothing is available at Jolly Buoy

title: Excellent Beach... Must see place in Andaman
review_text: Excellent Beach... Must see place in Andaman... Clear water and lot of corals and fishes... must go snorkelling and glass bottom boat... pay extra for extra ride... amazing.. highligt of my trip....

title: Clear water beach with under water corals
review_text: It's a very lovely place..Away from main Port Blair ( South Andaman ) islands. Snorkeling is main attraction and underwater corals are really beautiful. It's paradise in sea..

title: "So nice"
review_text: It is so nice beach,very neat and clean,blue water,lots of water sports like snorkling,glass boat,jet ski etc.wonderful place.

title: Most beautifull underwater marin life
review_text:
Best place in Andaman. everybody should do snorkeling in jolly buoy island. rate 1000 rupees per person. 
we were 4 people, we paid 3600 for snorkeling.

title: Out of India view
review_text: Its one of the best island located remotely and too small island, but truly beautiful. Snorkeling is must over there with crystal clean blue water & very good Coral view. Its a must visit island.

title: ok beach but very bad snorkelling
review_text:
the beach and island is quite decent (well i did see a lot of plastic trash but it was cleaned up in 15 mins). one can spend about an hour in the water. 

the snorkeling is totally avoidable. the government rate of 15 min / Rs 300 is not followed by them. they go for 5 min / 300 Rs, 10 min / 500 Rs, 20 min / Rs 1000. 

and all cash payment, there is no receipt or anything of that sort. completely controlled by the ferry operator and park staff. 

avoid the snorkelling. 

fees to enter are steep to - rs 800 per person (adult or child) - includes ferry ride and being on the island from 9:45 am to 12:45pm. More

title: Must visit if you are at andamans.
review_text:
the island is reachable from the wandoor mahatma gandhi national park , 
you have to take private boat which will charges 300-600INR per person for round trip.

title: Magical island
review_text: The water here is so clean that you can see through the sea bed very clearly. Glass bottom boat gives you best experience of under water life

title: great
review_text:
great place to visit, must watch, easily approachable from government ferries and private boats. 
great place to visit, must watch, easily approachable from government ferries and private boats.

title: Pristine
review_text:
Loved the ferry ride to the island. the view on either side with so many islands and the marshy land, the varied colours of nature and not to forget the lone crocodile that we sighted was just spectacular. We also saw a large monitor at the island. The waters are just crystal clear and efforts have been taken to preserve and protect the natural beauty of the place. The three coral reefs and the variety of marine life that we saw from the glass boat was an experience that everyone should experience. 
The sad part is the state of the Public convenience. In fact its to do with the tourists coming to this island. More efforts and strictness needs to be put in here. Change rooms are too stinky and lack of amenities leads to ugly trash thrown around them. Actually didn't feel like getting into the waters after seeing the condition in and around the change rooms. More

title: Wonderful Place
review_text:
A must have if you are at Port Blair. TO reach from Port Blair you need to go by road for around 40 KM to reach to Wandoor and then take a Ferry to reach out to Jolly Bay. You would need to take a permit to reach out to Jolly bay. Talk to your hotel before reaching if they can assist in getting the permit for you. Else your Option is to go very early in the morning and get into the Queue for the permit. 
The place has clear water with lovely corals and sea life to see with options of snorkelling if you can learn to breathe through the kit and for the less adventurous ones there is a Glass bottom boat ride to see them from to which is a must do if not doing snorkelling. 
I have been to Elephant Beach and done snorkelling & Sea Walk there, but appreciated the snorkelling at Jolly bay much more than that. Of Course the top one was the Scuba diving at Havelock. 
In all a must place to visit if in Port Blair. You can do you planning correctly and ensure that you have time to visit Jolly Bay since you will have to anyway come to Port Blair by Air and than go to Havelock via ferry(ferries generally go in morning and your flight landing timings might not match with them) More

title: Unbelievable!
review_text: I visited jolly buoy on the first day and that killed it. the bar had been raised so high that the subsequent days didnt feel as good. jolly buoy was out of the world experience. the corals and the marine life is spectacular. i recommend to do the 3 boat rides which cost 500 rs and it will be worth it. if u r doing scuba diving then snorkling wont be fun.

title: On Top of World
review_text: World beater destination...run efficiently....and the Coral reef is just too beautiful to be described....the glass boat travel and snorkeling are experiences of life-time....worth every penny of spend in Jolly Buoy.....I felt a new world opening out while in the reef.....Murugan ,my friend , guide and philosopher on Snorkel mission ...hats off to you....this even more exciting than Phi-Phi islands( Phuket)

title: A must visit island
review_text: Best for snorkelling and viewing corals and marine life...compared to any other island. Its crystal clear water gives a perfect view of the underwater species. A vide variety of corals and fishes are found here.

title: Beautiful and Enjoyable
review_text:
I loved this island. Just running arround the island or swiming in the water is so much fun. 
We went for glass bottom boat ride. It costs Rs.600 per person. They go over 3 coral riffs. You will see many different types of colorful corals and a lot of marine animals. The boat man told us the names of each of the animals we watched like crump shell, parrot fish, pink star fish, blue star fish,sand fish, finger corals, builder corals and many more. 

I believe this island is less explored so marine life is less disturbed so far. 
This is good for snorkelling as well. Though we did not go for it since we had prebooked snorkelling in elephanta island. 

DO NOT take any plastic bags with you while going there. Plastic is banned. More

title: Must visit for Snorkling
review_text: Book your tickets before going. two ferry's only. and, huge Que. Better to go in the morning and enjoys the beauty of the area.

title: Avoid this if you are going to Havelock
review_text:
Excellent marine life. Nice clean sand and water. you can see the under water marine life through glass bottom boat rides or Snorkeling. My wife did snorkeling and found it to be great. Having said all this I was disappointed with the place because of the effort that it requires. And a visit requires almost a full day. The ticket and permit costs around 800 per person. I booked the ticket through my hotel in Port Blair. It is advised to book tickets a day in advance, otherwise it is possible that you may not get tickets on the day of travel. Another negative point - Plastic bottles are not allowed. You will have to stand in a long queue under sun and heat waves to take milton bottles on rent on depositing security money. While coming back you can return the bottles and take the security deposit. No doubt it is important to preserve such beautiful natural pristine places from plastic and other waste, authorities should device better mechanism to avoid inconvenience to tourists. You will not get anything to eat or drink on the Island...you will have to carry food and drinking water with you... Third drawback - the place requires a full day for visit and a tourist do not get more than 3-4 hours to enjoy the beauty of islands as ships start returning by 1:30. The island is no doubt very beautiful with abundant marine... Excellent marine life. Nice clean sand and water. you can see the under water marine life through glass bottom boat rides or Snorkeling. My wife did snorkeling and found it to be great. 

Having said all this I was disappointed with the place because of the effort that it requires. And a visit requires almost a full day. The ticket and permit costs around 800 per person. I booked the ticket through my hotel in Port Blair. It is advised to book tickets a day in advance, otherwise it is possible that you may not get tickets on the day of travel. 

Another negative point - Plastic bottles are not allowed. You will have to stand in a long queue under sun and heat waves to take milton bottles on rent on depositing security money. While coming back you can return the bottles and take the security deposit. No doubt it is important to preserve such beautiful natural pristine places from plastic and other waste, authorities should device better mechanism to avoid inconvenience to tourists. 

You will not get anything to eat or drink on the Island...you will have to carry food and drinking water with you... 

Third drawback - the place requires a full day for visit and a tourist do not get more than 3-4 hours to enjoy the beauty of islands as ships start returning by 1:30. 

The island is no doubt very beautiful with abundant marine life but the effort and time that it demands makes it a bad choice. 

You can get better beaches and all attractions like scuba, snorkeling and glass bottom ride in Havelock. More

title: Clean blue ocean
review_text: Very clean and clear water. Best corals and varieties of fishes can be seen here.Snoklring is famous here. It is the only place near andaman where you can view good corals.In this island pladtic is not allowed where as you can take food. Donot forget to take changing cloth,umbrella .The beach is inclined so always follow instructor or batman 's instruction. Donot wear good shoe better if you consider slipper.

title: Best beach
review_text:
Jolly Buoy has crystal clear water. Snorkelling is best with lot of corals, fish visible..guides let u do sea walk also. Very close to port blair and very very clean. 

Must go for every one.

title: amazing
review_text: the beach is very beautiful and clean. A little more peaceful than other beaches. great for swimming and snorkeling.

title: Never knew water can have so many colors!!
review_text: The journey can be a bit tiresome but this place is a must visit for all. Blue, green, turquoise...you will see all the shades of water clearly. The glass bottom boat ride is okayish, nothing great. You can bring your own snorkelling kits. Scuba options are not available.

title: Calm, peaceful and pure island in India
review_text: the clearest blue water I have ever seen in any Indian beach. the coral reef is good. the only issue is reaching there will be very hectic if you dont have a travel agent.

title: Most beautiful place around Port Blair
review_text:
Snorkellig was the best part in Jolly Buoy Island. 
Should not miss and go for Rs.1000/- per PP,where they show you differerent types of Corals.

title: must must must
review_text: MUST visit this serene island , the best ever place i have ever visited in life . Take forest permit a day befor you want to travel . You will love it

title: Paradise
review_text:
We glimpsed the marine convervation park from our flight. Jolly Buoy is an excellent well conserved coral site. The snorkelling is highly reccomended. They way the make you do it, just about anyone can snorkel. 

Avoid the glass bottom boat ride other than the 10 minute complimentary one. Instead spend your time on the pristine beach.

title: Its Famous For Different types of Corals.
review_text: Jolly Bouy just an awesome place.Requesting every one its a must visit place but please do carry sun screen as there are high chances that you will get Tan because the same thing happened with us.

title: Nothing but a ferry ride
review_text: Most people visit the Jolly Buoy on the promise of snorkeling and glass bottom boat ride to see corals. First the glass bottom boat. It is a farce. First the boat is not covered. Hence with sunlight from top, the view gets blocked by reflection. The glass is barely 8" inches wide. Water is constantly thrown over it to keep the dust away. With no cover, sun on top, one sees suns reflection. Further at the depth of not more than 1 to 2 meters, what one sees are mostly dead corals. Hardly any color. A few fish. That's all. We paid for 45 minutes ride additionally. It is sheer waste of money. If a healthy person wants to really see the corals, go for scuba dive. You need not know swimming. More

title: Awesome
review_text: I liked this because the water is very clear. There are no much waves coming towards which is good for snorkelling to do in this island. This is very good place for kids also to play in water/sea. Very less waves..

title: Must Visit!
review_text:
Trip to the andamans is incomplete without this and that is where I will rest my case! 

Brilliantly managed by the government with waters seemingly pumped in from the Maldives. The sea bed is awesomely soft and swimming in these waters is blissful. Abundant sea life but can avoid the glass bottom boat if you are about to snorkel or dive. However all said and done you will knock off your battery by shooting your camera to nuts! Happy tripping!

title: Poorly managed
review_text: We went for a snorkelling trip to this place.If your a first time snorkeller you may like this place.But if you have already snorkelled in Havelock you don't like this place.The boat trip to this place is horrible .The sun is very hot here no shades to hide.Kids suffered a lot.Strong water current are there in the snorkelling site but no safety measures are available.Snorkelling mask and tubes are horrible.

title: Amazing marine life
review_text: The only problem was that it was tourist-y and crowded. If you find a way to avoid that - it is amazing. The clearest blue water you can imagine and an insane variety of coral and marine life.At andamans - I went snorkeling here, at havelock, at neil and at ross. I found this to be the best for sure.

title: good Place
review_text: Coral Island view in a Glass Bottom Boat is a must at this Island.Sitting facilities need to be enhanced.

title: Cleanest, environment friendly beach
review_text: A worthwhile amazing experience, happy the way the beach is being protected to maintain the marine life, one of the best corals can be seen here

title: Snorkelling at Jolly Buoy
review_text:
This beach can be visited while staying at Port Blair. One needs to obtain the Forest department pass for a trip to Jolly Buoy island the next morning. The boat to this island leaves Wandoor at around 9 am. The boats usually get crowded with tourists. But the one-hour boat cruise over the beautiful blue waters makes it easier 

The Island is amazingly beautiful with turquoise pristine waters surrounding it. Check out the pictures to see how the waters change colors. This is another place for snorkelling. Best thing about this place is that Jolly Buoy is plastic-free and junk-free, thanks to sensible and simple restrictions well enforced by the government More

title: Nice island, disappointing excursion!
review_text:
Nobody could say that Jolly Buoy isn’t a tropical island paradise, it is truly and undoubtedly beautiful. The problem is the way the excursion is organized. In our opinion the trip is basically catering to mainland Indians who have never seen a coral in their life and not experienced divers/snorkelers who want to explore independently. Everybody from the many excursion boats was herded to the crowded main beach next to the boat landing in the Northeast corner. We decided to seek some solitude on the long deserted beach along the Southeast coast, where we were repeatedly bothered by lifeguards trying to get us to move without being able to give us any reason. We pretended being on our honeymoon, needing privacy and refused. We also had trouble to go snorkelling quietly, insistently being offered the services of so called ‘snorkelling guides’. The nicer part of the reef didn’t seem safe anyway, as there is a constant risk to be run over by one of the glass bottom boats. The trip also was an hour shorter than promised when we booked it at the Port Blair tourist office. Us and the 2 other foreigners on the boat were frankly disappointed, as the excursion wasn’t exactly cheap. If you have time to kill in Port Blair by all means go, but don’t expect too much. If you have time I would definitely prefer Ross and Smith Island in the North, where you... Nobody could say that Jolly Buoy isn’t a tropical island paradise, it is truly and undoubtedly beautiful. The problem is the way the excursion is organized. In our opinion the trip is basically catering to mainland Indians who have never seen a coral in their life and not experienced divers/snorkelers who want to explore independently. Everybody from the many excursion boats was herded to the crowded main beach next to the boat landing in the Northeast corner. We decided to seek some solitude on the long deserted beach along the Southeast coast, where we were repeatedly bothered by lifeguards trying to get us to move without being able to give us any reason. We pretended being on our honeymoon, needing privacy and refused. We also had trouble to go snorkelling quietly, insistently being offered the services of so called ‘snorkelling guides’. The nicer part of the reef didn’t seem safe anyway, as there is a constant risk to be run over by one of the glass bottom boats. The trip also was an hour shorter than promised when we booked it at the Port Blair tourist office. Us and the 2 other foreigners on the boat were frankly disappointed, as the excursion wasn’t exactly cheap. 
If you have time to kill in Port Blair by all means go, but don’t expect too much. If you have time I would definitely prefer Ross and Smith Island in the North, where you can enjoy an island paradise in freedom without surveillance. More

title: Great Snorkeling Spot !
review_text:
Was really fun to be there. 
Could clear see the Marine Life and swim with it. 
The timings are a bit tight but worth for !

title: Best destination for Snorkeling
review_text: when i reached the island the boat guy said.. yaha snorkling pakka kar lijiye... yeh scuba se bhi accha hoga.. trusting the guys judgement and confidence i tried snorkling here... the best experience i would say...yes... better than scuba i mus say.. snorkelling at jolly buoy is a must try for people who want to explore corals and sea life. it was dreamlike... pls try... happy Snorkeling

title: Dont Miss it, the best of Andamans
review_text:
Amazing place for Snorkelling and Glass bottom ride, its the best among all usual places of Andaman. 
Its a conservation area, Marine National park hence requires permit. 
Cost 800 = 750 ferry fare + 50 permit, agents charge about 50 to 100 for getting them arranged. 
Glass bottom for 400 per head for 45 mins. 
Go for the Rs 800/1000 snorkelling, you can touch the Clownfish. 
Go by the first boat and then you dont have to wait and can spend more time doing snorkelling/glass bottom ride. 
Get some food/snacks beforehand for eating there,

title: Clear water for snorkeling
review_text: I did scuba at Havelock,snorkeling at North Bay & Jolly buoy Islands. Comparing these three places ,Jolly Buoy Island has the most clear water .so you can have a good visibility and its also rich in marine life .. you can see a lot of varieties of corals and fishes in short stretch.So don't waste your money in snorkeling and glass bottomed boat ride at North Bay.You will ahve a better experience here,

title: The best beach in India
review_text: Jolly Bouy, was by far, the best beach in entire Andaman tour... Its serenity, cleanliness, blue water, rich corals were breath taking...simply amazing..i wish i could stay here for ever. Best place for snorkeling or glassbottom boat ride..my suggestion to all travellers to andaman, jolly bouy is must watch, cant skip it at any cost. Elephant beach, north bay all will seem worthless if u visit jolly bouy once..most rich place in andamans in terms of corals n marine life...can give it 10/5...

title: Must Visit | Should not be missed at Any Cost
review_text:
This was the best place in my Andaman trip. 
Scenic view and water looks like what I had only seen in movies. 
Simply superb! 

Note: Place has no Stalls so you should carry food/water yourself.

title: simply heaven !!!! No words to describe!!
review_text: Jolly buoy is a virgin island need government permit, Easilly available but need to hire agent for it specially in pick season,we hired an agent for a day for 7100 rs for 6 people incluin megapode camping hotl pick up drop plus chidiya tapu on the same day, must visit Munda parvat a garden on chidiya tapu, which is included in this package, tickets 750 + 50 for jollybouy boat ride from wanoor jetty, don't rely on bus transportation, very poor bus services, odd timings..samudrika marine musium is must visit place befor jolly bouy boat ride,which is situated on wandoor jetty only, need to reach by 8 in morning so one can see the beauty of nature, awsome place, better than elephanta island, crystal clear water, just amazing fish world, must say "Jolly bouy nahi dekha to kya dekha" lovely place, no plastic zone, need to carry odomos cream, glairs, clothes, camera (ofcourse), best outfit of your worrobe, sunscreen lotion,snorkelling & glass bottom ride both are different, glass bottom ride 400, snorkelling charges 300,500,1000,2000,please donot carry plastic, because of plastics corals may not survive, it's 4 hour journey but need to pack food for this island, because no shops or stalls available there for water or foo, milton water bottle is available for 5 rs and 100 rs deposite on ticket counter only.keep it clean,people spoiling it very repidly :( More

title: A virgin island
review_text: Small boats carries passengers to this island which is totally uninhabited and remains somewhat virgin. The corals under the sea bed here is worth seeing.

title: must visit
review_text:
snorkelling and 400 rupees extra for glass bottom boat is totally worth it......!!!!!!! 
It was the best beach in my whole holiday in andaman

title: JOLLY BOUY : A NATURAL AQUARIM
review_text: Morning 0730 we left room for Jolly bouy by car.First We had to go to Wandoor which is appx 40km away for Port Blair.Car charge Rs 1200. Mr Raju the tour operator already taken permit to Jolly bouy for Rs 50 p/p , ferry ticket Rs 750 p/p and commission Rs100 p/p. From wandoor the ferry took appx 45 min to reach Jolly Bouy. Original Id proof required to be carried. 45 min boat journey is also wonderful. From jollybouy snokerling/ glass bottom boat ride being carried out to facilitate the coral/ colour full sea fish view. Through the glass at the bottom of boat it looks like a natural aquarium. For these activities they charge extra money. Otherwise you can have sea bath. The water there is amazingly crystal clear over the white sand. No polybag/ plastic bottles are allowed. One can take water bottle for RS 5 on rent and Rs 200 security deposit. Changing room facility is there. More

title: Perfect place to try Snorkelling...
review_text:
The journey to this island and the island in itself is nature at its best. The marine life around this island is fabulous and the water is clear. This is the place to do snorkeling but do carry an action camera. The glass boat ride is a gamble as it depends on the condition of glass on the boat. Better to spend more time in snorkeling and take a walk away from the crowd, take a dip n njoi. 
This island is closed for public in the monsoon months.

title: Heavon on earth!!!
review_text:
Words can't do justice to the beauty of this place. Its great for swimming, very clean and developed island. It has great sea-life around and great for snorkeling. 
It is a must visit place of Andamans, only then a person can understand the meaning of its true beauty.

title: Very nice beach - but not easy to reach!
review_text: The beach itself is nice - has a combination of activity and leisure options. However, there are too many restrictions. You need to hire water bottles (at a nominal fees) so that you don't carry plastic bottles on to the beach - but when you get to the beach, you realize that people easily flout those norms. There should be another way to ensure that people do not litter the beach. Also, there a queue for the boats and there are limited number of boats going each morning. You will have to fill up the form and then wait in the queue to board the boat. The marine museum is interesting, so you may want to visit it while waiting for your boat. The water is crystal clear and you can enjoy your time at leisure on the beach. There are standard water activities here - and you can enjoy them a little better as the beach is bigger than Elephant Beach at Havelock - giving you more area to enjoy the activities. The beach is not very commercial - and has very limited amenities. More

title: best beach of port blair but too many restrictions
review_text: yes this place is as good as radhanagar beach of havelock.here water has really beautiful marine life and it can be witnessed in a comfortable glass-bottom boat.If you like snorkeling, then don't miss this place.Plastic bottles not allowed. Govt. rent bottles for 10rs.water is clear blue and shallow enough to enjoy snorkeling. It is indeed one of the best place to experience the lovely corals and marine life of Andaman.Jolly Buoy is one of the must visit place in port Blair.i strongly recommend this place.MUST VISIT PLACE IN PORT BLAIR.

title: Good Place for scuba
review_text: This place is famous for water sports , I suggest don't take glass boat ride you will not able to enjoy corals,instead go for scuba or snorkeling.As far as price is concern you have to negotiate for better deal because Scuba rate 1200 per person to 4500 per person. Corals are beautiful and scuba experience is once in a life time.

title: Great Place to Visit
review_text: Jolly Buoy Island is one of the best islands in Port Blair. Out of the 15 islands in Wandoor village 2 are operational for tourists Red Skin & Jolly Buoy. Water is crystal clear.It is recommended to do snorkeling & Glass boat ride here rather than Elephant beach which has become commercial.

title: The Best Place in Andaman- Snorkeling, Glass bottom boat ride
review_text:
It has the best corals reefs and more sea lives compared to other places in Andaman. This best place for Glass bottom boat ride and Snorkeling. Unfortunately there are no scuba diving and sea walk activities present at my time of visit. 
Tips to fellow travelers: 
All passenger boats departs to Jolly Buoy Island by 9:00AM,10:00AM and 11:00AM which I think is the last boat. 
I would suggest to get tickets before hand as only 25 person can board the boat at a time. 
Cost- 800rs for boat ride to jolly buoy. 
Glass Bottom ride- 500rs per person They will show you 3 different reefs which are nearby. 
Rent a Milton bottle--200rs refundable 
Note- Please carry valid ID proof , Pack the food before as you won't can any food on the island. More

title: Well worth the time and money
review_text:
The trip to Jolly Boys (now distorted to Jolly Buoy) Islands is a 45-min boat trip from Wandoor. The boat-trip, through the narrow straights between islands in the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park (past Alexandra, Holiday and Rutland) is breathtaking in itself. 

The last-bit after the larger boat can go no more is done in small motor-boats, upto 8 passengers at a time. These conveniently have glass-bottoms, so one has a clear view (sun-rays permitting) of coral below the water-surface. 

The beach at Jolly Boys is coarse coral-dust (it hurts). The water is pristine, from emerald to turquoise as it deepens. The sea is not reliable. Being placed towards the open sea on the west-end of the archipelago, only the inner portions of the sea are swimmable. On the outer side, the currents can be dangerous. 

One can stay behind for a second boat to pick you up, but is not advisable - the boat may be cancelled for want of passengers. 

There is no organised retail - carry your own water and food. 

Do be gracious enough not to litter - there are no janitors to clean up after you. 

Trips to this group is alternated with the visit to Red-Skin island on different dates. You cant always expect to visit Jolly Boys - that day might be the RedSkin ferry! Check before you leave for Wandoor. More

title: The highlight of the trip-an out of the world experience!
review_text:
This is a must visit place for anyone travelling to andamans and the best beach for coral viewing and snorkeling . Jolly buoy can be reached from the wandoor jetty, which is approximately 25 kms from Port blair. You can rent a two wheeler which is an economical mode of travelling and the road is very uncomplicated alternatively you can hire a taxi. There are 2 ferries which go to jolly buoy every day and you need a forest permit worth 50/- and tickets which cost you 750/- per person , the forest permit can be obtained in advance or you can also get it from the jetty itself though it is a little dicey. This is a highly preserved area by the forest dept and the coral views are just mesmerising-the snorkeling experience there will leave you speechless. You will get to witness various kinds of beautiful coloured fish-tiger fish, nemo fish, butterfly fish, starfish, you get to touch and feel pretty corals, and various other marine fauna and flora like the sea cucumber the star ball etc and all in under Rs. 500/- This is something that no one should miss. We tried snorkeling at elephant beach in havelock as well at a similar price and the experience there was no where compared to jolly buoy. In fact even the under sea walk which costed us a bomb wasnt comparable. Jolly buoy undoubtedly was the highlight of our... This is a must visit place for anyone travelling to andamans and the best beach for coral viewing and snorkeling . 

Jolly buoy can be reached from the wandoor jetty, which is approximately 25 kms from Port blair. You can rent a two wheeler which is an economical mode of travelling and the road is very uncomplicated alternatively you can hire a taxi. There are 2 ferries which go to jolly buoy every day and you need a forest permit worth 50/- and tickets which cost you 750/- per person , the forest permit can be obtained in advance or you can also get it from the jetty itself though it is a little dicey. 

This is a highly preserved area by the forest dept and the coral views are just mesmerising-the snorkeling experience there will leave you speechless. You will get to witness various kinds of beautiful coloured fish-tiger fish, nemo fish, butterfly fish, starfish, you get to touch and feel pretty corals, and various other marine fauna and flora like the sea cucumber the star ball etc and all in under Rs. 500/- This is something that no one should miss. 

We tried snorkeling at elephant beach in havelock as well at a similar price and the experience there was no where compared to jolly buoy. In fact even the under sea walk which costed us a bomb wasnt comparable. 

Jolly buoy undoubtedly was the highlight of our trip to Andamans!! 

Tips for fellow travelers 

1) carry your own food since there is no food available there 
2) Plastic bottles are not allowed, you can get milton water bottles by paying a deposit 
3) Try to arrange for a forest invite in advance 
4) Carry an under water camera if you have one-it is completely worth it!! More

title: Pristine and clear
review_text: what a lovely place. please don't carry plastics as they have to be discarded before one steps on the transfer boat to go to the island. As we were also confused about what is allowed and had our child with us, let me elaborate, packs of chips, biscuits etc are ok. u r supposed to eat and discard the plastic wrappers in dustbins on the jolly buoy island. plastic water bottles and polythene bags are not allowed. so before you board the ferry, u can give a deposit of 200/- and are given Milton bottles, which can be filled with bisleri water by you and these Milton bottles can be carries across and given back on return. ur deposit will be refunded and only 5/- charged per bottle to you. Jolly buoy is beautiful, clean and worth the visit More

title: “The Best Place in Andaman- Snorkeling, Glass bottom boat ride , Sea Walk”
review_text:
This place is heaven for Glass bottom boat ride and under water activities like Snorkeling, Sea Walking. I would recommend this place over Neil and other islands in Andaman for under water corals and marine life. All passenger boats departs to Jolly Buoy Island between 9.00am to 9.30am and the same boat returns between 1.00pm to 1.30 pm. 750/- per person charged which includes passenger boat trip from Wandoor to Jolly Buoy Island (approx 30 minutes ride) and 10 minutes complimentary glass bottom boat ride. Additional 30 minutes of glass bottom boat ride charged 400/- per person. Its worth to take additional ride , you will see many species of fishes in the water like Blue Starfish, Sea honeymoon, Sea cucumber etc. & scenic under water corals during this glass bottom boat journey.Thousands of blue fishes on the surface of sea creates a lovely view. Snorkeling trip would be charged extra between 300-500. You can skip snorkeling if you are going for additional glass bottom boat ride. Since this place is no plastic zone you can't carry plastic items except packed food,Chips, Cold drinks. Solid plastic water bottles are available on rent of 5/- each bottle.A refundable security amount 100/- deposited for each water bottle. It is recommended to get your food packed from Port Blair only. Cons. You need a forest permit handy in advance to visit Jolly Buoy Island. Limited number of forest permits are issued everyday (~250... This place is heaven for Glass bottom boat ride and under water activities like Snorkeling, Sea Walking. I would recommend this place over Neil and other islands in Andaman for under water corals and marine life.
