It is recommended to get your food packed from Port Blair only. 

Cons. 

You need a forest permit handy in advance to visit Jolly Buoy Island. Limited number of forest permits are issued everyday (~250 every day). More

title: coral island water sport activity
review_text: clean and blue sea water, silver shining sand ,corals, colorful and wonderful sea creature seeing through glass boat

title: The best of Andaman
review_text:
Don't miss this Place. 
I feel this is the best place in Andaman, as good as Radhanagar beach. 
It has the best corals. Glass bottom ride and snorkeling was just out of the world. We did Scuba diving in Havelock, but they were not as good as Jolly Buoy. I wish I could just stay there for a few days :) 

Tips to fellow travelers: 
1) During peak season get the ticket and permit in advance. We paid an agent to get it for us. 
2) Carry food and water as there is nothing available on the island. Take food in some container or paper, as plastic is not allowed. Also, rent a milton bottle and carry lots of water. 
3) Take snorkeling gear or Swimming Goggles along. Its beautiful down there. 
4) Reach Wandoor beach a bit early and don't miss the museum. You get to know the name of many of the corals and then see them live at Jolly Buoy. More

title: Wish this is preserved till eternity
review_text: The best place for coral sightings at Andamans. We were informed that this is the world's second best place for coral sightings. Really beautiful marine life can be witnessed in a comfortable glass-bottom boat, perfect for people scared of taking a dive in ocean. I am proud of the efforts taken by local bodies to preserve this area and I hope it is preserved till eternity...

title: Snorkeling and Glass bottom boat ride
review_text: Jolly buoy(oct-march) and red skin island(apr-sep) are alternatively open for 6 months to allow coral reefs to grow. 5-6 hours in which 2 hours are for travelling from ferry which costs about 1000 Rs. and then additionally charges for glass bottom boat ride(rs 400) or snorkeling( don't remember).

title: Best place for snorkeling in Andamans
review_text:
If you like snorkeling, then don't miss this place. Forest permit can be taken one day in advance for 50/- from Port Blair or directly at Wandoor Jetty (this may be risky as the limited number of seats may be pre-occupied). Ferry to and fro charge is 750/- with complimentary 10 min glass boat ride. 

Snorkeling should be done with a guide as they know the best places to see. Charges 300/-, 500/- and 1000/-. 

Govt. buses leave for Wandoor at 6:10 am, 6:30 am and 7:30 am and charge 20/-. 

Plastic bottles not allowed. Govt. rent bottles for 5/- (and 200/- refundable deposit). Take your pre-packed food as nothing is available there. 

Open November to May. More

title: Must Visit place in Port Blair
review_text: Very few people actually visit there because you have to arrange permits well in advance. I was lucky enough to get in touch with a cab driver who arranged my permits on the spot even when agents have denied them to me and that too at no extra cost. The mode of travel is bad but what you experience is pretty good. I would recommend you to visit this place before visiting Havelock because only then you would be able to cherish this place. Glass boat rides are also recommended because this place has the best corals, even better than what we found in Havelock. I missed snorkelling at this place and would recommend you to go for it rather trying the same in Elephanta beach. More

title: very nice
review_text: we dint spend more time here..but its nice island...night time so beautiful when moon fell in water...

title: Nice, must visit!
review_text: Great Beach, amazing eco-diversity. Disliked the exaggerated marketing tactics used to promote the glass bottom boat ride and snorkeling. You may do either one of them even though they seem overpriced it's worth a dekho

title: Clean and Nice
review_text: Though Jolly Buoy is a small island, it is one of the cleanest and truly natural island, well located sufficiently away from Port Blair with barely an hour of travel into the sea but enough to give a great isolated feeling that you expect from such a place (not yet commercialized fortunately). Moreover the water is clear blue and shallow enough to enjoy snorkeling. It is indeed one of the best place to experience the lovely corals and marine life of Andaman.

title: Not a great place to visit
review_text: Jolly Buoy Island is located about 35-40 kms from port blair. We started the day about 7 am in the morning and went to see the islands, however disappointed started when we were told that the permits are full and would be issued for next trip only. All the earlier permits are taken by touts and people are left at the mercy of arrogant govt employees. The second trip started at 12 pm and we reached at 1 pm. We asked the people over there to get our snorkelling done, the guides supposedly called so refused till our own boat guides came back. We requested to send us back they said they cannot do so as they have limited capacity on the boat. We spent 3 hrs doing nothing . Do not venture into this island in the second trip as you return by 5 pm and all the places are closed by then More

title: One of the beautiful island in Port Blair
review_text: Jolly Buoy is one of the must visit place in port Blair. The corral life is most beautiful than other beaches. Recommend for snorkelling. The water is Cristal clear and any one can enjoy there. We went from port Blair to jolly buoy by a boat called ML Tanveer and the staff was very friendly and guided us on each and every thing till we return. We can enjoy glass boat ride, snorkelling. Photographs can get a chance to capture wooow moments n very beautiful nature. Recommend to visit this place if ur in port Blair.

title: Best marine flora and fauna, best place to snorkel
review_text:
You can reach jolly buoy via a 20-30 mins boat ride from wandoor beach. There is a special permit required to visit the island, not sure how it is done as for us it was taken care of by the tour operator. 

It was undoubtedly one of the best place we visited in Andaman. The boat operator who take you to the island organizes glass bottom boat ride and snorkeling. We had done snorkeling in north bay as well as elephanta beach in Havelock, but both of them were nothing compared to our snorkeling experience at jolly buoy. The place has a very rich flora and fauna, you can see many varieties of fishes and corals at an arms length. Only disturbing thing about the place was that the tour operators touch the fishes and corals and encourage tourists to do the same! I hope atleast people practice some self restraint. We went for both snorkeling as well as glass bottom boat and it was one of the best experience, especially the snorkeling. There are different packages for snorkeling I would recommend the highest one. The remaining time in the island we just spent swimming in the crystal clear water. More

title: Must see Place to see Corals and Sea Creatures
review_text: Jolly Buoy is a must visit place for all tourist travelling to Andaman Islands. From Port Blair, you need to drive about 45 minutes in the morning (30Km) to reach there by 9.00AM. You need to carry water flasks (plastic bottles are banned in the boat) or you can hire them by paying a charge of 5 per bottle (though you have to give a deposit of 200 per bottle which is returnable). Carry sufficient amount of food and water as nothing is available in the island. The boat ride is about 1 hour and you will proceed in terms of the line you stand. Typically there are 4 boats which travel to Jolly Buoy on daily basis (one after another) taking about 50 tourists in each one. Life Jackets area available and must be put on. Once you reach the place, the guys take you in a glass bottom boat for a complimentary 10 minutes trip to showcase the marine life but they move so fast that you can not see much. However, they will tell you that if you want to see the marine life properly, you need to go to three zones for a 30 minutes ride and each zone costs 200 per person but if you decide to take all three zones, they will charge 400 per person instead of 600. But the money is worth as you see good variety of Corals, fishes, conch, sea... Jolly Buoy is a must visit place for all tourist travelling to Andaman Islands. From Port Blair, you need to drive about 45 minutes in the morning (30Km) to reach there by 9.00AM. You need to carry water flasks (plastic bottles are banned in the boat) or you can hire them by paying a charge of 5 per bottle (though you have to give a deposit of 200 per bottle which is returnable). Carry sufficient amount of food and water as nothing is available in the island. The boat ride is about 1 hour and you will proceed in terms of the line you stand. Typically there are 4 boats which travel to Jolly Buoy on daily basis (one after another) taking about 50 tourists in each one. Life Jackets area available and must be put on. Once you reach the place, the guys take you in a glass bottom boat for a complimentary 10 minutes trip to showcase the marine life but they move so fast that you can not see much. However, they will tell you that if you want to see the marine life properly, you need to go to three zones for a 30 minutes ride and each zone costs 200 per person but if you decide to take all three zones, they will charge 400 per person instead of 600. But the money is worth as you see good variety of Corals, fishes, conch, sea cucumber, Anemones, etc. Carry a good camera that can double up for a video photography. After the coral trip, you can choose to do snorkeling (300 per a small trip and then 500 for little more and 1000 for a full trip per person) but the same is worth. After doing all these activities, you can simply swim for some time in the pleasant emerald water slowly splashing your body. You need to carry extra cloth and preferably put on a floater kind of shoe which can be easily taken out as you need to get into water to come out of the boats. Typically you return by 3.00PM to Wandoor Jetty from where you left. More

title: Its nature in its most beautiful form!
review_text: Recommended for scuba divers and snorkellers as well as those who simply enjoy being amidst nature. Corals are amazing. Cruse to the island from Wandoor beach offers spectacular views!

title: one of the best location
review_text: one of the best place to visit in Andaman , initially we were not very keen to visit as our hotel travel desk were insisting that we should only visit mandoor beach but good sense prevails and we opt to visit it and really it was amazing. It took around one hour in ferry to reach and there you can do snorkeling and it was the best snorkeling we had in Andaman. Water was very clean and we also did summing and it was great. But no shop and nothing you get there so one should carry own food stuff.

title: Wow
review_text: If you have been to port blair you must go to jolly buoy island really too good.Coral life in jolly buoy is better than elephanta beach havelock.Beautiful Island no words to express my feeling.

title: Pristine and well preserved
review_text: I will highly recommend this Island as it’s a marine reserve which is beautifully preserved and has a pristine beach. Try to get an agent to get you the permit and ferry tickets to the Island before your arrival to Port Blair. There are limited ferries which go to the Island. They leave around 8:30AM and get you back around 4:00PM. Try to take a picnic lunch with no plastic bags as they are not allowed on the Island. Plastic bottles are not allowed either but you can rent Milton water bottles. The ferry ticket includes a 15 minute glass bottom boat ride which is ok. The water is gorgeous and quite calm. Snorkeling is highly recommended. Though the reefs are not very extensive you can see many different types of corals and other sea life. More

title: Sooo Beautiful!!!!No Words!!!
review_text:
We had travelled to andaman in Feb 2014, just 1 month after a boat was collapsed leaving 50 people dead.So the ferry conditions were very tough at that time. 
In a day only 60 tickets for Jolly Buoy island were issued, that means only 60 people can go this island in 1 day. 
We had to go this wonderful island from quite a long time. 
Somehow we managed to get ferry tickets for Jolly Bouy island. 
Once we reached jolly buoy we were just Awestruck!!! 
The water there was very very very blue and clean. 
No plastic bags and no plastic bottles are allowed to be bought here.

title: Exceptionally Clear Water
review_text: Part of our package tour, found it to be one of the best beaches. Clean clear water, cud see 10 ft below. Swim /dip for hours. Went for snorkeling and glass-bottom boat to see corals..

title: awesome place
review_text: one of the untouched island, open only during daytime for tourist and localities. Amazing Corals and best place for snorkelling.

title: serene and awesome
review_text:
Corals and flora-fauna are best here. The journey from wandoor to this island is amazing. 
Few plastic bottles were scattered in the island which I feel should be taken care of by the authority. 
Visitors are also requested to be bit more aware of this as it takes few days to kill a coral with plastic which took millions of years to grow.

title: Good
review_text:
to take the permit you have to stand in the line at 6am, 
By boat this will take an hours ride, snorkeling is very expensive there. If you can carry your snorkeling gear, it will be best...snorkeling gear is avalable in the markets and is not very expensive..suns cream lotion is very imp as it will be very sunny

title: Average island with options for viewing corals
review_text:
This is probably best island for coral viewing around Port Blair. But if you are planning for snorkeling in Havelock, then you can skip this spot. There is nothing else to do other than snorkeling and glass bottom coral viewing (you can always enjoy a bath on the beach also). We had to contact our car driver to arrange for a pass to Jolly Buoy. You can get the pass on the day before the travel itself, but there is always rush during season and there are limited number of travelers permitted to visit Jolly Buoy each day. So better to get that before hand. We had to spend Rs. 750/- per head (Rs. 700 for the to and fro boat ride) and Rs 50/- for the actual pass. It was nice 45 min boat ride from Wandoor. Wandoor itself is around 35 km drive from port blair city center. In the boat, the representative will brief you about the charges of different activities that you can do there in island. Costs are like this: Rs. 400/- per head for shared glass bottom boat coral viewing Rs. 400/-, 800/-, 1000/- per head for snorkeling for different duration You can also reserve a full boat for glass bottom coral viewing. The charge may vary from Rs.1000/- 2000/- and is negotiable. There are very basic changing rooms and toilet in the island. Other than that, there is no facility for any thing... This is probably best island for coral viewing around Port Blair. But if you are planning for snorkeling in Havelock, then you can skip this spot. There is nothing else to do other than snorkeling and glass bottom coral viewing (you can always enjoy a bath on the beach also). 

We had to contact our car driver to arrange for a pass to Jolly Buoy. You can get the pass on the day before the travel itself, but there is always rush during season and there are limited number of travelers permitted to visit Jolly Buoy each day. So better to get that before hand. We had to spend Rs. 750/- per head (Rs. 700 for the to and fro boat ride) and Rs 50/- for the actual pass. 

It was nice 45 min boat ride from Wandoor. Wandoor itself is around 35 km drive from port blair city center. In the boat, the representative will brief you about the charges of different activities that you can do there in island. Costs are like this: 

Rs. 400/- per head for shared glass bottom boat coral viewing 
Rs. 400/-, 800/-, 1000/- per head for snorkeling for different duration 

You can also reserve a full boat for glass bottom coral viewing. The charge may vary from Rs.1000/- 2000/- and is negotiable. 

There are very basic changing rooms and toilet in the island. Other than that, there is no facility for any thing else - no food, no drinking water, no locker. 

You have to wait for the boats to start for returning. They normally start off at around 1:00 - 1:30 pm from the island. You can have lunch after returning to Wandoor. You normally should return by 2:30 - 3:00 pm. There are some restaurants serving good thalis there. 

The island is very well maintained as govt has put several restrictions there. But one thing I noticed and did not like is that fact that the guides (don't know if they are certified snorkelers) will touch the marine like (corals, start fish etc) with their hands and will show it to you. You can also touch them. This is definitely not good for the marine life. More

title: Just like the island of dreams
review_text:
We can't even think that some place having pure fascination of heart is still does exists!!! 
This is the place to be if u are nature lover. They have well maintained it still intact beautiful. I request all the readers if u ever visit please do support the management 
Forest dept to keep it clean. So that you can go back the same place in future.

title: a piece of paradise
review_text: this is one of the best places to visit in the andaman. its a 45 min rode from the Wondoor beach. it offers snorkeling, scuba and glass bottom. even if u have done this activities in the north bay island, visit this place for its scenic beauty, clear waters and peaceful atmosphere. take everything with you that you might need in the time period of 3-4 hours like water bottles, eatables as nothing is available here for purchase.

title: Heaven
review_text: Brilliantly maintained. I travelled after a gap of 13 years and it is ever beautiful. Words cannot express the awe that will grip you once you lay your eyes on this piece of creation

title: enchanting
review_text: The island appears as if it has been picked straight out of a story book. Beautiful beach and crystal clear water. Good place for snorkelling. But beware of the boat operators who will first compel you to ride in glass bottom boats and extort money by saying that snorkelling not permitted and then later offer snorkelling at exorbitant prices.

title: A little piece of heaven
review_text:
If you like a quiet relaxed day out on the beach, this is highly recommended. It is a tiny island 45mins boat ride away from Wandoor jetty with the clearest aqua blue water, a very clean beach and relatively less crowd. There isn't a lot of water activities to do though apart from snorkeling and glass-bottom boat rides. 

Things to note: 
1) The no-plastic policy is strictly implemented, go prepared. 
2) Get the required permits etc ahead of time.

title: Jolly good place
review_text: First things first - anything that you might need over a period of three to four hours SHOULD BE CARRIED WITH YOU. Not even water is available there. The ferry for Jolly Buoy leaves from Wandoor which is about 45 minutes from Port Blair. Reach Wandoor on time as the boats leave on first come first serve basis. Advisable to obtain the forest department permission and the ticket one day prior. No plastics are permitted on Jolly Buoy, the guys are generally particular about the water bottles and disposable plastic bags. The forest dept will provide you with a milton water bottle against a deposit of Rs 200 and this bottle can be returned when you are back. This facility is available at the ticket counter at Wandoor. The boat trip takes about 45 minutes to an hour. If you are the snorkelling kind, might as well carry your snorkelling kit from home, else you will have to pay rent at all these places. Jolly Buoy is fantastic for snorkelling and they also have glass bottom boat rides (400 per passenger for about 30-45 minutes) worth it. Advisable to go for the glass bottom boat ride first so that the guy on the boat can tell you all about the corals and the fish before you go snorkelling. Great coral formations and fishes and beach is also great. Nice and cosy places to sit in the shade and enjoy the... First things first - anything that you might need over a period of three to four hours SHOULD BE CARRIED WITH YOU. Not even water is available there. The ferry for Jolly Buoy leaves from Wandoor which is about 45 minutes from Port Blair. Reach Wandoor on time as the boats leave on first come first serve basis. Advisable to obtain the forest department permission and the ticket one day prior. No plastics are permitted on Jolly Buoy, the guys are generally particular about the water bottles and disposable plastic bags. The forest dept will provide you with a milton water bottle against a deposit of Rs 200 and this bottle can be returned when you are back. This facility is available at the ticket counter at Wandoor. The boat trip takes about 45 minutes to an hour. If you are the snorkelling kind, might as well carry your snorkelling kit from home, else you will have to pay rent at all these places. Jolly Buoy is fantastic for snorkelling and they also have glass bottom boat rides (400 per passenger for about 30-45 minutes) worth it. Advisable to go for the glass bottom boat ride first so that the guy on the boat can tell you all about the corals and the fish before you go snorkelling. Great coral formations and fishes and beach is also great. Nice and cosy places to sit in the shade and enjoy the beach can be found to the left and right of the place where the boat drops you. Take a walk along the beach and admire the myriad shades of blue and green !! ONCE AGAIN - take all your food and drink along - best bet is to get a packed lunch thali from Port Blair and at least one litre water per person. More

title: Not so Jolly Buoy island
review_text: We are a family of four, travelled to the Caribbean a few times and like snorkeling. We read reviews here and expecting so much about this island. We purchased 4 permits and 4 boat tickets adding up to a hefty sum of Rs. 5,000. Plastic water bottles are not allowed on the island to eliminate trash on the island. The boat ride to get to the island is slow and the life jackets that we were required to wear were moldy and stank. I think they were never rinsed off with clean water. When we got to the island, we were only allowed to swim in a very small area where 200 other people were swimming. And this was for "safety" we were assured. However, the boat organizers drove their boats right past the rope where small children were swimming and almost ran over them. Snorkeling anywhere is not allowed unless you purchase a tour or a glass bottom boar rides. We were also not allowed to walk on the beach past the red flags which are roughly 1/4 mile apart. Overall, this is a rip off and I would highly recommend to avoid this island. To top it, the island is full of trash. More

title: Beautiful Island, clear water and beautilful Scenery
review_text:
This island near to Port Blair. It is almost a full day trip to Jolly Buoy. The beach has clear water. Normally complimentary glass bottom boat rides is given with trip but that is very limited . we have to pay extra for viewing coral reefs and colorful fishes. 
while visiting , one should see backside of the beach where very beautiful scenery can be seen .I am also attaching some pic taken during the trip.

title: jolly buoy
review_text: snorkelling is superb, We can see all kinds of corals, fish, star fish etc. Out of all Islands, corals are more seen in Jolly Buoy just with snorkelling, because they are available within 4 to 5 feet depth

title: Awesome !
review_text: This is a must visit beach, near Port Blair. It is almost a full day trip to Jolly Buoy. The beach has clear water and one can go snorkelling and glass bottom rides to view the coral reefs and colourful fishes. The beach boosts of live corals and abundant fish population. Not to be missed !!

title: One of the best attraction of Andaman and Nicobar
review_text: It's one day trip...enjoy the under water coral view through snorkeling, Scuba diving or from the glass bottom boat..no proper place for changing the dress, especially for ladies and kids. Take care of your belongings..carrying plastic bags is totally no no..if authority find these from anyone means they will fine(penalty) a heavy amount..

title: colorful corals
review_text:
Corals are very beautiful and there are vast variety of them. Nice Island when compared to any other Island. 

Water bottles (need to transfer to a flask near booking counter) and plastic is not allowed.

title: Awesome Beach
review_text: Clear water with underwater marine life. One of the best beach for bathing, glass bottom boating and snorkeling.

title: Must Visit in Port Blair
review_text:
This is one of the main attractions in Port Blair. 
The Ticket + Permit Cost is Rs 800 per person which includes complimentary glass boat ride for 10 min. ( This is easily available from Tourist information center in Port Blair. You will need Photo copy of ID proof of each person). 
There are multiple options to reach there by Bus, Taxi, Auto. 
We went by Bus as it was cheapest ( Rs 20 per person/ one way). Bus is easily available from Mohanpura Bus Stand. Try to catch bus at 6:30 AM to reach before Time. The breakfast an be done at the restaurants near Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park (Wandoor). 
No plastic water bottle or polythene bags are permitted on the island. Drinking water must be carried in rented water bottles (rent INR 5/- only, plus INR 200/- deposit). More

title: Mesmerising Corals and Marine Life
review_text:
Jolly Buoy is one of the fifteen islands belonging to Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. The island is known for beautiful corals, marine life, and pristine clear waters. Visit to this Island takes 40 minute boat ride from Wandoor Beach. Wandoor is 30 kms by road from Port Blair. The bus from Port Blair to Wandoor Beach takes one and a half hours. The boat leaves between 9:00 Am to 9:30 AM from Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. Only 258 passengers are permitted to visit each day. The cost for a return boat ride and the permit is INR 800/-. Island is uninhabited and there is not a single shop to buy water and food. No plastic water bottle or polythene bags are permitted on the island. Drinking water must be carried in rented water bottles (rent INR 5/- only, plus INR 200/- deposit). The food, if carried must be packed in Tiffin boxes and not in a newspaper or polythene. Littering on the island is punishable by heavy fine. The boat halts for three hours giving plenty of time to explore the island, snorkel and take a glass bottom boat ride. The snorkelling area is well demarcated along the beach. Snorkels are available on hire for INR 300/- for fifteen minutes. The glass bottom boat offers a fifteen minute ride over one coral reef for INR 200/- per person and a thirty minute ride over three coral reefs for... Jolly Buoy is one of the fifteen islands belonging to Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. The island is known for beautiful corals, marine life, and pristine clear waters. Visit to this Island takes 40 minute boat ride from Wandoor Beach. Wandoor is 30 kms by road from Port Blair. 

The bus from Port Blair to Wandoor Beach takes one and a half hours. The boat leaves between 9:00 Am to 9:30 AM from Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. Only 258 passengers are permitted to visit each day. The cost for a return boat ride and the permit is INR 800/-. 

Island is uninhabited and there is not a single shop to buy water and food. No plastic water bottle or polythene bags are permitted on the island. Drinking water must be carried in rented water bottles (rent INR 5/- only, plus INR 200/- deposit). The food, if carried must be packed in Tiffin boxes and not in a newspaper or polythene. Littering on the island is punishable by heavy fine. 

The boat halts for three hours giving plenty of time to explore the island, snorkel and take a glass bottom boat ride. The snorkelling area is well demarcated along the beach. Snorkels are available on hire for INR 300/- for fifteen minutes. The glass bottom boat offers a fifteen minute ride over one coral reef for INR 200/- per person and a thirty minute ride over three coral reefs for INR 400/- per person. The visibility through the glass bottom boat is perfect and crystal clear. The boatman doubles up as a guide to educate tourists about rich marine life. 

The island shuts by 2 PM and boats return to Wandoor by 2:30 PM. It is advised to see the sun set before returning to Port Blair. More

title: magnificient, magnanimous and mesamerising- FORT HOLIDAYS HOSPITALITY
review_text: jolly buoy island, though its closed sometimes in a year as due to A & N Administration norms, any one out of jolly buoy or red skin will be open in a year for tourists. Jolly Buoy island is also a place of good interests as seen amongst tourists and all fellow travelers. one can have a very easy access to this place through boats or ships that operate from Wandoor Jetty in South Andaman, approx. 26 kms. from Port Blair airport, though permission for transit must be taken one day in advance from the administration regarding the forest area permit and boat fares and all. This place is full of aquatic wealth including diverse species of flora and fauna nests here in its most magnificent behavior. one can easily have a look around for all this including a sight of a dolphin or can also perform activities like glass bottom boat ride, snorkeling, scuba diving, boat chatting, game fishing etc. etc.very few lucky ones only get a chance to visit this place due to closure due to administrative reasons or people have to cope up with the visit to Red Skin islands. More

title: Worth visiting
review_text: It is a small island about one hour boat journey from Wandoor beach. You can see underwater corals through glass bottomed boats. You can also do snorkeling and scuba diving here. The beach is very small and there is nothing available here. Even drinking water has to be carried from Wandoor beach. No plastic bags or bottles are allowed on the island since it is a no plastic zone.

title: Don't miss to visit. Full day plan.
review_text:
This is a picturesque beautiful island of south andaman marine nationalpark- water forest. Forest department manages trip here. 4 boats of 30 people goes there. Good under water corals can be seen here. 
Large trip in glass bottom boat costs 500 to 1000 per person. Can do snorkelling with guide also at 500rs. 
Crystal clear water calls you. 
Need to leave this place by 1.30pm is only one drawback. 
Wandoor jetty has facility of water bottles. As one cannot take any plastic here.

title: best one in port blair
review_text:
Nice beach in mahatma Gandhi Marin national park ,wandoor. 
Wandoor located at 20 km away from city from there by boat u can reach jolly bouy island 750 rs /person and it includes complimentary glass bottam boat to see corals . 
Best place for snorkeling I found

title: Brilliant
review_text: Must Visit Place.. and Snorkeling atleast must be done if possible. The view is awesome. The boat ride is quite long but the island is beautiful. Do carry food items and water with you as there are no shops there.

title: must see attraction
review_text: If you go to Andamans , this must be your first priority. Radhanagar beach is beautiful. Neil island sunset point is attractive. Scuba diving in Havelock is not be missed, but jolly buoy is something which every nature lover must visit to see the marine life in its full bloom. it opens six months a year so better check with the tourism department about its timings. We visited this place on 29th November 2014. One must reach there at 8.15 am to buy the permit and tickets. You will have to wait for your turn to board the jetty . I was told that there are 6 jettys so a total of 300 people a day can visit the place. If you can arrange the tickets and permits in advance, it would be better. We purchased it on the site and it was not problematic. The ferry takes 1 hour fifteen minutes to reach the place, so total of 2.5 hours are spent in travel. You get around 3 hours at the island. A complimentary Glass bottom boat ride is provided to all the visitors so that they may get attracted to try more. Charges are fixed. 15 minutes snorkelling session costs Rs. 300 pp. Better try Rs.500 for 30 minutes snorkelling. For those who are not comfortable in snorkelling, should try Glass bottom boat ride . It costs Rs.200 per person. No food is available and even your plastic... If you go to Andamans , this must be your first priority. Radhanagar beach is beautiful. Neil island sunset point is attractive. Scuba diving in Havelock is not be missed, but jolly buoy is something which every nature lover must visit to see the marine life in its full bloom. it opens six months a year so better check with the tourism department about its timings. We visited this place on 29th November 2014. One must reach there at 8.15 am to buy the permit and tickets. You will have to wait for your turn to board the jetty . I was told that there are 6 jettys so a total of 300 people a day can visit the place. If you can arrange the tickets and permits in advance, it would be better. We purchased it on the site and it was not problematic. The ferry takes 1 hour fifteen minutes to reach the place, so total of 2.5 hours are spent in travel. You get around 3 hours at the island. A complimentary Glass bottom boat ride is provided to all the visitors so that they may get attracted to try more. Charges are fixed. 15 minutes snorkelling session costs Rs. 300 pp. Better try Rs.500 for 30 minutes snorkelling. For those who are not comfortable in snorkelling, should try Glass bottom boat ride . It costs Rs.200 per person. No food is available and even your plastic bottles would be confiscated at the entry of jetty. Instead you would be given Milton water bottles against nominal security amount, refundable on your return. Please.... don't throw any waste here and don't touch corals so that this place remains beautiful as it is now. More

title: A place to remember
review_text:
This one of the most beautiful beaches in Andaman and India.White sands, clear blue water which changes its color midway to merge with the skies and a serene atmosphere- this place is absolutely amazing. 
It is also one of the cleanest places in Andaman as you are not allowed to carry any plastic bags or bottle or throw anything into the waters.There are guards watching your activities.But they are very polite and well behaved. Also you can't pick up shells or any other sea life forms (corals or star fishes) that can be found there. 
Its a great spot for taking pictures and you can look cool leaning against a single branch of a tree that has been washed into the shore. 
For the divers also the place is really good,and for the non divers there are glass bottomed boats or snorkelling equipments. 
But please remember to take water and packed lunch with you as won't find any shops there.also, there isn't any changing place after your swimming. 
All in all, the place is a must see. More

title: Good Beach
review_text: Good beach, filled with corals. ensure to take a boat ride in a transparent boat. Beach is clean and well maintained.

title: Stunning
review_text: Absolutely stunning !!!! This is one place not to be missed in Port Blair. The beach is pristine and the coral life is mind-blowing. Snorkeling is a MUST DO

title: A beautiful island
review_text: Jolly Buoy is a beautiful island with coral beaches. The water is extremely clear and the beach is pristine and clean. The visibility for the water is upto a depth of 40 feet. There are activities such as glass bottom boat rides and snorkeling. Please note that there are no plastics allowed on Jolly Buoy. So please carry jute bags or back packs. For water, you can rent a water bottle from the jetty. Else, this is a must do for anyone travelling to Port Blair. Given the choice between Ross Island and Jolly Buoy, we would strongly suggest Jolly Buoy. We would also suggest that one should take up the glass bottom boat ride to view the beautiful corals and the variety of marine life. More

title: Great
review_text: A Heaven is Port Blair. This is the only maintained Sea Beaches in India with Blue and Green Sea. Very Very Clean

title: Crystal clear water
review_text: Amazing place. If there is only one place you want to visit in Andaman , it must be Jolly Bouy. You need to get a permit in advance that's a hassle. Its a no plastic zone . It has got best corals . Go for glass bottom boat ride.

title: Great place for suba diving
review_text:
I was here with my wife and really enjoyed being on the island. The corals and the ocean life that i got to see was superb. I did the suba dive after a long time and was not sure whether is should try it in the open ocean. Believe me you should. There will be someone who will hold you and make sure that you are not swept off to the open ocean. 
The island itself is nothing short of beautiful white sand and a lot of natural beauty to look around. probably one of the only two places in India where you get to see corals up close. Must go. More

title: life time experience
review_text: I have never been to such a wonderfull place,what a beautiful island. This is surely the paradise on Andaman. The beach , the snorkeling ,the boat journey ,the privacy. Where one will get all these things blended in one place.

title: Paradise
review_text: I was there on may 2014.I am a travel freak.I will rate this place at least second or third among my travel.this sexy blue water tied our eyes.zero pollution place.I did not want to get out of this place.my tour agent only pulled me to come out of that place.surely I will be here at least once in my life.

title: Lovely island
review_text:
Been there at least 4 of times since 2010. To reach there you have to travel upto wandoor from port blair by road and then take a boat to jolly buoy. 
Throught the year either of red skin island or jolly buoy island is open for tourists. Both the islands are nearby and almost the same. You see the best coral reefs here. Please carry swimming gear, drinking water and sunscreen with you. There is jo regular habitation here and boats bring tourists in day time and leave before evening. 
There are many travel operators at port blair who conduct the tour. Tickets for the boat ride is also available at wandoor jetty. 
While going in the morning book a meal as per your choice in wandoor itself so that by the time you come back from jolly buoy to wandoor, your hot and tasty meal is ready and waiting More

title: JOLLY GOOD TIME AT JOLLY BUOY
review_text: Jolly Buoy is the Snorkeling hub of India. The best corals and sea life I have seen till date in crystal clear water at its shallowest. The place is a paradise on earth. The small island is out of a story book which you reach after an adventure voyage and wish to spend a lifetime upon. It is so pretty that I wish i could buy it. You have to see it to believe me, its just amaaaaaaaaazing.

title: Best island in Andamans....
review_text: This is very small Island less People should book tickets for this island very advance else no chance to visit this island. Crystal clear water among all Andaman beaches and very less tides so even kids can enjoy in water without any fear. Beautiful scenic place and water sports like snorkeling and glass boat riding are major attractions. Very limited trips to this islands and some times trips may cancel.

title: Wonderful Jolly Buoy
review_text: A wonderful island name Jolly Buoy , having with nice see and with various corrals and also all sea riding .

title: Water color
review_text: Jolly buoy supposed to be the best island for tourist to enjoy the undrwater life. Say it snorkeling, scuba diving or sea walking just heaven for tourist . A must see at port blair. A must for watching marine life with picturesque and breath taking view of wonderfully coloured lagoon.

title: Undoubtedly the Best of Andaman!!!
review_text: This island should always be the 1st in ur list of things to do in andaman. The journey from the mainland to jolly buoy may not be an out of the world experience but the you will definitely be amazed by the hues of blue around the island.

title: Feels like heaven
review_text:
way back in 2007 i went there and had longed never to come back to the mainland. 
just pure peace and soothing atmosphere.

title: Awesome place - Feels like haven
review_text: This is one of the most beautiful beach at Andaman. You should watch this place without fail. The scenic beauty is just awesome. But please remember, that you are not supposed to carry and plastic items to this place. There will be a checking before you board the boat which will take you to the destination. Jolly Buoy does not have any hotels to stay. You need to carry your clothes in case you are planning to take bath. There are separate thatched roofed changing rooms for boys and girls. You can also plan for scuba diving which is also a wonderful experience.

title: Nice diving sport
review_text: A nice diving spot, one of only a few left on the islands. Just take enough water and food along. It can be very crowded at times.

title: The Best Place for Snorkeling
review_text: the amazing sea life of Jolly Buoy Island makes it unique from any other island. Water is very clear and full of life where you can see the sea life. its just amazing.... a must visit place and better than "North Bay Island"...!!

title: Amazing beach in india
review_text: One of the beat beaches in port blair. Green water with no road connectvity, yes you need to visit this beach only by ferry. But once you are there, believe me, you will wonder that in india also, we have such a beautiful beach. A must to visit in andaman.

title: A Perfect mix of Leisure and Activity
review_text:
Jolly Buoy is a small inhabitant island which is a must visit place, the reason being you can enjoy this island in both ways i.e. by spending leisure hours by the sea watching its spectacular view or by indulging yourself in water sport activities like snorkeling or watching marine life through glass bottom boat. In order to visit Jolly Buoy, you have to take ticket from Wandoor National park or from Port Blair at least a day before. Wandoor is the place from where Ferries for Jolly Buoy depart and it's a 2hr journey from Port Blair. On the other hand, just beside the anthropological museum of Port Blair, there is a ticket counter which will give you confirm booking for Jolly Buoy. Now, please note that there are two similar types of island in Andaman i.e. Jolly Buoy and Red skin and ferries for both depart from Wandoor. But only one island remains open for 6 months and the other for the other six. What we were told is that from December to May, Jolly Buoy remains open and for the other six, it's Red skin. I am no absolutely sure if it's true or not. Based on three visits in Andaman, I observed Jolly Buoy was open for Feb and March and Red Skin at November so probably the info is true but there is nothing authenticated information on it. Comparing the two, I can conclude jolly buoy... Jolly Buoy is a small inhabitant island which is a must visit place, the reason being you can enjoy this island in both ways i.e. by spending leisure hours by the sea watching its spectacular view or by indulging yourself in water sport activities like snorkeling or watching marine life through glass bottom boat. 
In order to visit Jolly Buoy, you have to take ticket from Wandoor National park or from Port Blair at least a day before. Wandoor is the place from where Ferries for Jolly Buoy depart and it's a 2hr journey from Port Blair. On the other hand, just beside the anthropological museum of Port Blair, there is a ticket counter which will give you confirm booking for Jolly Buoy. Now, please note that there are two similar types of island in Andaman i.e. Jolly Buoy and Red skin and ferries for both depart from Wandoor. But only one island remains open for 6 months and the other for the other six. What we were told is that from December to May, Jolly Buoy remains open and for the other six, it's Red skin. I am no absolutely sure if it's true or not. Based on three visits in Andaman, I observed Jolly Buoy was open for Feb and March and Red Skin at November so probably the info is true but there is nothing authenticated information on it. Comparing the two, I can conclude jolly buoy is far better than red skin. 
Plastic is completely banned in Jolly Buoy. There is a housekeeper in the island who takes care of all these. If anybody pollutes the island, he will literally shout at them. If anyone did it avoiding his notice, then he is kind enough to collect those garbage and drop those in his sack. There is shifting duty of housekeepers who try at their level best to keep the island entirely pollution free and clean. You will not be allowed to carry water bottles if they are made up of plastic and at the counter you can get bottle for hire if you don't carry any plastic bottle. 
The journey to Jolly Buoy is though mangroves and it's truly a journey you will cherish forever. Upon reaching there you can go for snorkeling or glass bottom boat or both or you can just enjoy the sea by relaxing near the beach. On one of our visits, we spotted snake in the sea. The color combination of the sea is quite marvelous but the weather has to be clear. If it becomes cloudy then your visit is a ruin. There are literally three colors of the water and these are normal transparent water, emerald blue and deep blue(Please see my pics for better understanding and keep in mind they are not Photoshopped). The ferry will allow you 2 hour at the island and you can freely roam about. There is no provision for food and water on the island so better you carry it and have it on the journey itself. Upon arriving on the island, just enjoy its serene beauty. Collecting shell from the beach is strictly prohibited but yes, you can always collect unless get caught. 

The island is very tiny so you can easily roam about the whole island within half an hour so I would suggest go for a snorkeling here as I found this is the best snorkeling spot among all four i.e. North Bay(port Blair), Jolly Buoy, Bharatpur(Neil island) and Elephant Bay Beach(Havelock). The marine life is quite rich here and the stream current is quite strong here so it will be a good exercise. If you are afraid of snorkeling then go for glass bottom boat where also you can find a rich underwater flora and fauna. Ask for the boatman to take into a deeper sea for some extra cash, I guarantee you will not regret. More

title: Serene and beautiful
review_text:
The journey from the dock to the island is a beautiful one....and you dont even have to see through the glass boats, the water is so clear fishes swim around you and you can see some articulately engraved shells. 
it was one of the most beautiful beaches that we went to. highly recommended. just that please carry your food and water and do not throw anything on the beach or bring back any shells. you can be heavily fined.

title: Must see place
review_text: Best beach to hang around, with snookering option. However the change room was not too clean and place was insufficient. Advise travelers to take a change of cloth to enjoy your day!!

title: A must go but with planning
review_text:
A must must visit if you visit Andamans but with some planning 
1. Arrange your pass from counter at least a day or two before as limited no. of visitors allowed 
2. They dont allow plastic bottles but you can take bottles from a stall near ferry 
3. Take some biscuits or eatables etc along with you as nothing available there. 

About the place - its just awesome. Clean. Pristine. Snorkelling & glass boat ride a must do. 

Cons:Toilet facilities are rudimentary, No lockers/changing rooms.

title: Pristine!
review_text:
Best beach. Clean beach. Crystal Clear waters! 
Its good use of plastic is prohibited. But tourist bring lunches along with them from the trip conductors and then litter the place. This must be taken care. 
Amazing snorkeling experience. Must visit.

title: Paradise indeed
review_text:
You will wonder if you are really in India. The beach is awesome. So clean. You can soak in the water under the sun the whole day. A must visit i would say. 

Some important things to remember: 
1. Only limited no. of visitors permitted. So arrange for your pass from the counter at least a day before. 
2. If you want to take plastic water bottles, they take a security deposit and on return you can show the bottles and reclaim it. 
3. No shops etc in the beach. If you want you can take some biscuits etc. 
4. Don't litter on the beach. Heavy fine. 
5. May need sun protection. 
6. Snorkelling and boat ride are available. 
7. Toilet facilities are rudimentary. 
8. No lockers etc. 

I only wish scuba was also there. More

title: Awesomeness personified
review_text:
You will be thrilled by this visit, you can see that govt. is doing good work there and protecting the forest. 
You cannot find out by anything that Andaman was ever hit by Tsunami. They know how to stand again and built everything.

title: A must-do for every tourist at Port Blair.
review_text: Jolly Bouy was a super experience. The authorities are doing their utmost to keep the place litter free. No plastics allowed. Also every tourist needs a permit to go - easily attainable from the ticket counter. If you plan ahead the permit and ticket is available at the government office and can be got for a small fee. The boat fare includes a short ride in the Glass - bottom Boat and ofcourse some snorkeling. However, if you have not had enough you can always pay for more time among the underwater world. The guides are polite and helpful. TIP - there is no food or water facility on the Island and I suggest you carry some in Paper bags as plastic is NOT Allowed. The toilets and changing rooms are best avoided. More

title: You will be awestruck!
review_text: There are probably no beaches as beautiful and varied as those of the Andamans. Jolly buoy has got such beautiful corals and colourful fishes that you never get enough of seeing them. Most importantly you don't have to know swimming to enjoy all this; they give you a snorkelling kit and you get started. The visit to andamans is incomplete without visiting jolly buoy.

title: Best island, must visit!!
review_text:
Guys, this is a very clean, untouched, beautiful island, of which only the beach is accessible, as the entry to the island is prohibited. Even till the beach, a permit is required. (Do not forget to carry your ID). 
There is NO FACILITY in this island, so do not expect even drinking water there. But this is what makes it heaven like clean. 
You are not allowed to carry any kind of plastic. You have to get thermos bottles on rent or your own Tupperware bottles to carry your own water, before you board the boat that takes you to Jolly Bouy. It is a 20-30 minute ride. 
There is wide diversity of corals, fishes and other sea animals, which you get to see during the Snorkeling session. Bottom glass ride is not very good, since the boats are not covered and the glass reflection inhibits views inside water. 
All in all, a must go, if you visit Andamans. It is just a half day trip, altogether. More

title: Nature well kept
review_text:
Other than the beauty of this place, the way it's been kept by the forest department is worth praising. Commercial activities and selling any kind of food item is strictly prohibited at Jolly Buoy. Visitors are advised to take there own eatables and water bottles that can be rented from the Jetty at Wandoor. There is a wooden shack to get under for shade and a changing place for the visitors. 
Though snorkeling is popular here but it is advisable to take your own gears for hygiene reasons.

title: terrible
review_text: I wouuld like to tell every one out here on trip advisor that the islands are very nice and pristine. But if you are a youngster then my suggestion would be to chose something else and not andaman . I went to jolly buoy but i have seen so much of restrictions.

title: Should Go
review_text: For those of us who skip Havelock Island for some reason, this becomes a must go. Try snorkling here, its worth the effort and money.

title: Excellent place for snorkelling and coral views.
review_text: Nice place. Permit shows 7.30am time but starts boat at 8.15am from Wandoor. Take breakfast. Water bottles of plastic are not allowed. They give cool bottles for 1 lit on rent. Must visit this place.

title: Jolly Buoy, the lonely Island
review_text: We visited the lonely island by steamer from Wandoor beach. This is famous viewing coral in glass bottom boat or by snorkeling. Good beach for bathing with moderate arrangement for changing. The entire island is full of forest, only the front part is cleared for visitors. Carrying any plastic (including water bottles) is strictly prohibited, Milton water bottles are supplied at Wandoor beach for hire. Spend about 2 hours in the Island.

title: Beautiful island and great snorkelling experience
review_text:
A trip from Port Blair to Jolly Buoy and back will take approximately half day. One has to go to Wandoor (30min drive from Port Blair) and take a ferry from Wandoor to Jolly Buoy (Forest permit required to be arranged in advance- via tour operators) 

Applying sun screen is a must or else risk getting sun burnt. Carry sufficient drinking water and snacks with you as there is nothing available on the island. 

Jolly Buoy had a extremely clean beach and beautiful clear waters. The snorkelling included in the package is very basic, just for 5min, and you will not get to see much. However, if you pay extra (around Rs 500) you will be shown beautiful corals, fish, and even get to touch them, 

The changing rooms and rest rooms are very basic and not very clean. 

Lunch can be had at Wandoor after returning from Jolly Buoy. Delicious sea food available at local joints at low prices. More

title: nice place
review_text: The boots brougt a person to clean up the place, Plastik is forbidden. People are helpfull showing the fishes with googles.

title: Better than cellular jail
review_text:
The only thing I will cherish in the trip is snorkeling(300). 
I went with my family (2 kids) - prebooked with paradise andaman - its not easy to get tickets as there is limited entry - always always use tour operators, they might charge more for taxi (1800 instead of 1500) but they would get you the tickets. 

Govt allows only 50 pax per boat and max 4 boats were sailing that day. You are doomed of there is a tourist bus with 37 people on board before you, so be prepared. 

Once you are there, its a small beach but clean, no water no food. We bathed for 1 hour or so, we did the boat first (2 out of 3 reefs - not great but do it nevertheless). 

You are given a 4 hour window - more than enough to have a real good time. Do not miss. More

title: (PLEASE arrange permit in advance or forget) Beauty full and untouched island.....must visit.
review_text:
JOLLY BOUY ISLAND in other words a PARADISE..jolly bouy island is almost a 45 mnt. ferry ride from wondur jetty. a worth visiting place.best place for snorkeling.crystal clear blue water. u must have sun screen lotion wit you. must carry sufficient drinking water with you. a snorkeling kit is great addition to your day tour. 
u must have the permit before one day from the tourist information center @port blair. we took two permit before one day and two decided to take on spot to have experience. i must THANKS the local taxi driver( Mr.raju-09933264173) for arrange every thing in advance. with a payment of Rs. 200 (fees Rs.100 for 2 permit + Rs.100 for arranging in advance) we got 2 permit DAY BEFORE . 
The next day early morning(6 am) we left for jolly bouy. we reach there 6.45 am. what we saw a long Que of around 10 person having filled each form for 8 person for permit . every day permit is limited to 180 .if u r lucky enough then will get permit same day. we stood under sun for 3 hour in the row and finally got permit for 10.30 am ferry to jolly bouy. 
(PLEASE CARRY EVERY VISITORS IDENTITY CARD FOR PERMIT). REST ABOUT JOLLY BOUY LOTS OF REVIEWS ARE THERE. THANKS More

title: Colorful land of corals and buzzing marine life
review_text:
Best place for snorkeling and scuba diving. It's part of the marine reserve so, it's very clean and full of marine life. Snorkeling is a must here and you don't need to know how to swim for this. they use a tube to help you float and a guide is there with you always. 
The water is blue and clear. At places you will be able to see clearly till the depth of 2 to 30 ft. 
The sand is pure white. 

Only problem here is the water current, which will make you struggle to stay in one place, while swimming or, playing in the waters. 
The sun can be very very harsh on your skin, get all the sun screen, hats, caps, stoles, towels that you can. cover your entire body with some garment or, you may suffer from severe sun burns. 

One point to note is that plastic water bottles and polythene bags are not allowed on this island. They provide you with water bottles with a refundable security deposit of INR 400. Carry your own water which you can use to fill these bottles. 

Above all, have fun and click loads of pics. More

title: Great Experience
review_text:
One of the Must Visit Islands in Port Blair. We were there on 16 April 2014, enjoyed extended glass bottom and snorkelling. Crystal clear waters and rich and colourful marine life makes it a delightful experience. 

The corals and fishes variety is brilliant !!

title: Paradise...!
review_text: Awesome beach, Great crystal clear water , lovely corals and fishes. The blue colored fishes were moving near to our boat and the view was so great :) I missed my snorkeling kit to bring which was a great mistake :(

title: Must visit island!
review_text:
It had that crystal clear water. You can see different hues of blue. Mesmerizing! If you have done scuba or snorkeling in some other island then you can skip the glass bottom boat ride. It takes 40mins by car and 40mins by ferry from Port Blair. Ferry capacity is 27 so if you are in a group make sure you reach there at least 40 mins early. They don't allow any plastic stuff which has kept the island pollution free. I went with my friends, we were enthralled by its beauty. 
PS : The island doesn't have any shops no food no water. Make sure you eat before making a trip to this island. More

title: do advance booking of glass boatam boat one day befoe going to jollyboy
review_text: do advnce booking at tourism office for glass botam boat one day before, because they have only 3 such boats , limited permission, u have to stand in line for full day ,agents hire their man for same, so difficult for individual tourist,unless ur vip ,that is for jooly & red skin island,coral viewing acivity,corals,&marine life is best

title: Good! But no more Snorkeling or any activity there now.
review_text:
It would have been a best, but they have stopped the Snorkeling & other activities which used to be there before. 
But the glass boat is there & its worth a visit 
Clean & safe for a couple to enjoy the beach. Very very secure :)

title: very well maintained
review_text: i went there on 18th march. it was very crowded while buying tickets because of the agents.we had to wait a long time. but jolly buoy was definitely worth the wait. the waters were crystal clear. it had a lot of marine life. snorkeling was banned due to some incident so we sat in a glass bottom boat which was overpriced. the beach was also very clean.it was a plastc free zone so i suggest you carry your items in some other bag instead of plastic.and there is no food available there.

title: most beautiful Beach
review_text: Beach is a BEAUTY.Crystal clear water,colourful fishes.Beach is very clean here.One can enjoy bath and glass boat ride.A must visit place.Permit from forest dep. is required to visit this beach.Same can be obtaind same day from wandoor before riding the boat.

title: best time in portblair
review_text:
this island and the coral here are second to none as per my experience. the water is so soft on you, the stream on the shore is so quite and pleasant that one can lie here for hours. no garbage to be found anywhere and excellent corals through glass bottom boats (snorkelling was banned when we visited because of some incident in portblair a month before). 
definitely worth the money+ effort in getting the permit, the boats are a bit slow i'd say bit over all it was an excellent trip.

title: Do Not Miss it
review_text: The marine bio-diversity found in this area is the reason for being a marine national park. One coming to Andaman can not give it a miss. I dived at Havelock, snorkeling at Elephanta beach and glass bottom boat ride (extended for 35 mins) at Jolly Buoy. Although all 3 of the experiences were awesome, I could not find as colorful and diverse marine life as JB at any other place. Until you are diving at some premium sites, JB should not be missed.

title: A heaven on earth
review_text: This Island is to be reached after a drive of 30 kms from Port Blair (PB) & a 45 minutes ride in a ferry. The ferry ride with either side Island covered with thick forest offers you a great experience. Ferry ride is bit highly priced at Rs.750.00 per person + Rs.50.00 as forest permit charges. compared to the ride in a luxury AC ferry to Have Lock Island which takes about 1.45minutes at Rs.830.00 per person one way. Further you will be fleeced to take a glass bottom ride to watch corals & under water vegetation & fishes of 20-30 minutes at Rs.300.00 per px. You have to undertake this as there is no other activity & it is a small Island with a clear water good beach. More

title: Heaven on Earth
review_text:
If you dont see jolly buoy island then you have seen nothing. One of the best and cleanest island in India. You are not allowed to take any plastic things. Such an amazing view where you can do snorkeling and enjoy glass bottom ride. I would just people to do snorkeling here as the water is very clean. 

You don't need to go foreign country to see turquoise blue water . 
A must visit place

title: Very nice island
review_text:
Great island the ferry ride to the island was good and was giving a very great view of the nearby surroundings. the most liked thing was that they didn't allow people to take polybags and plastic bottles to the island which kept the island more clean and nice. the boat showed us very different fishes and different types of corals. 
overall great experience

title: Must see -
review_text: Check with you hotel/travel agent for permit and book in advance.Great beach like the ones you see in Andaman postcards. The glass bottom bot ride is a must do to see 100s of varieties of fishes, corals, clam shells for pearls, star fish, sea cucumber .. There is changing room available on the island for men and women ..

title: Just Awesome
review_text: Very Beautiful Small Island.. Must Visit... Though you have to break your neck to get tickets and stand in line... but in the end worth it...

title: Colorful live Coral
review_text: Jolly Buoy and Red-skin are 2 islands which are opened 6 months each for tourists. Jolly Buoy from Oct to March...and Red-skin for April-Sep.....So mostly you get to watch only one of them. But both of them are very beautiful in their own way. Jolly Buoy has less coral but they are more colorful.

title: Awesome Island
review_text: Small but best in tha A&N,All activities were awesome....this is the island where i feel the sea,sea creatures(star fish,corals,and many fishes including jelly fish...

title: Very Serene and beautiful landscape (Seascae to be specific :) )
review_text: The island is definitely one that has to be on your itinerary when visiting andaman. dodnot miss snorkelling and / or scuba diving here as the coral reef here is much more beautiful than any other island you would visit at andaman

title: One place that you can't miss in Andamans
review_text: If there was one place that I had to choose amongst all the places in Andamans, it would be Jolly Buoy Island. This is the best place to see corals and multi colored fishes. The water is crystal clear and the beach has fine white sand, feels like you are almost in heaven

title: One of the best places to see corals!
review_text: The water is crystal clear with amazing view of corals and marine life. One can spend whole day at the island enjoying the scenic view and the beach.

title: Best corals
review_text: Enjoyed thoroughly at the beach. This place has the best coral view. I did snorkeling, though its expensive, I had to pay 1000INR for it. Beautiful water. Changing rooms are available, so it gets more comfortable for everyone.

title: Great day out
review_text: This is a brilliant place to visit. The water is clear and we were amazed to see the corals and underwater life. What we felt is that the arrangements for food and water are very poor and something needs to be done for it. However, I have never seen water this clear and nature so beautiful as in Jolly Buoy

title: A excellent place in A.N.
review_text: very beautiful island buay situated in marine national park..water is crystal clear for snorkeling.. Try for deep snorkle for excellent corals view..three colours of waters..an ecofriendly place..plastics are not allowed here..thermal bottles r available for rent..reach wandoor before 9 am for tickets n permit..

title: Fantastic beach for Snorkelling
review_text: This island is reached from Wandoor Jetty by a ferry in 40 mins. The major attractions are Snorkelling and ride in glass bottom boat. Water is crystal clear here and highly attractive for bathing. Not much waves. So, all can enjoy. The beach is very clean as no one is allowed to take any plastic bag or plastic water bottle etc. The ferry ride from Wandoor Jetty is also exciting through the sea. Everyday a limited number of people can visit this island. So, reach Wandoor Jetty as early as possible to book your ticket and permit.

title: Amazingly beautiful Island in heavenly pristine waters
review_text:
Forest department at Port Blair issues limited permits per day which can be taken one day in advance before visiting this Island. Boats leave early in the morning starting at 8 AM, and tourists get to spend around 2-3 hours before coming back. 

The permits can be taken directly at the Wandoor jetty in low tourist seasons. But, it is advisable to take it in advance to avoid any last moment disappointment. 

The Island is opened for around 6 months per year starting from November. At other times in the year, tourists are taken to Red Skin Island. 

The Island is amazingly beautiful with turquoise pristine waters surrounding it. You can see colors of waters changing shade around the Island, and enhances the beauty of the place many folds. 

The beach has waist high water till a distance and one can enjoy swimming in these waters without much trouble. 

The ferry trip from the Wandoor jetty includes a glass bottom boat ride and a Snorkeling trip. You can pay little extra per head for an extended ride in the glass bottom boat or for snorkeling. The marine life and corals at this place are simply superb and should not be missed. You can pick either one of the two activities as per your needs and requirements and enjoy the marine life. 

A must visit place in Port Blair. More

title: Avoid at ALL costs
review_text:
The whole tour to Jolly Buoy Island from Port Blair should be avoided if one is anyway planning to visit Havelock. One comes to Andaman for the beaches and the snorkelling and diving not to be herded like cattle and packed on some touristy boat where the tour guides are only out to rip you off. The tours that are organized to Jolly Buoy are extremely crowded and having about 150 people on a small 100 metre stretch of beach completely mars the experience. I give credit to the government for trying to stop the use of plastic on the island but once again the tour guides take it one step further and had the cheek to tell us to deposit our snorkel equipment before boarding the boat as "plastic is not allowed on the island". This was utter rubbish as we knew he only wanted to make extra money by ensuring that we snorkel with him and it was not as if we would be leaving our snorkeling gear on the island before returning. The island is pretty no doubt, but if you are confined to a very crowded beach where you have to wait and fight for your turn to do pretty much any activity that is mentioned as part of the tour it is not a very nice experience. One might as well spend an extra day at Havelock and enjoy the secluded beaches there and snorkel... One comes to Andaman for the beaches and the snorkelling and diving not to be herded like cattle and packed on some touristy boat where the tour guides are only out to rip you off. The tours that are organized to Jolly Buoy are extremely crowded and having about 150 people on a small 100 metre stretch of beach completely mars the experience. I give credit to the government for trying to stop the use of plastic on the island but once again the tour guides take it one step further and had the cheek to tell us to deposit our snorkel equipment before boarding the boat as "plastic is not allowed on the island". This was utter rubbish as we knew he only wanted to make extra money by ensuring that we snorkel with him and it was not as if we would be leaving our snorkeling gear on the island before returning. 
The island is pretty no doubt, but if you are confined to a very crowded beach where you have to wait and fight for your turn to do pretty much any activity that is mentioned as part of the tour it is not a very nice experience. 
One might as well spend an extra day at Havelock and enjoy the secluded beaches there and snorkel at elephant beach. 
People should avoid this place until the government sorts out the tourist scene for this island. It is just not worth wasting your day as part of tour like this. More

title: beautiful coral life
review_text:
Joly Bouy island is a beautiful island maintained by A&N Government. 
there is a abundance of coral life to see here. 
snorkelling is worth it here for rs. 500/- 
in place of going north bay island & doing water activities, you should / must do snorkelling @ Jolly bouy island.

title: Well worth a trip
review_text:
The Andaman Tourism office is the place to obtain the Forest department pass for a trip to Jolly Buoy island the next morning. The boat for Jolly Bouy leaves Wandoor at 9 AM. The 7:30 AM bus from Port Blair's bus station will take you there in one hour, passing through long stretches of tsunami-affected areas. Bus fare: Rs 22. (In my bus, though, the conductor kept the change from passengers and charged local passengers round sums without issuing tickets). At the end of one of an hour-long cruise over blue waters surrounded by verdant forests, visitors are transferred to glass bottomed boats. En route the shore, one can see corals within touching distance and a variety of fish. Groups of visitors claim their space at the clusters of old benches and tree trunks, to keep their belongings. It is remarkable that even without any supervision, no loss is reported in this temporary community of strangers -- perhaps a case of mutual dependence. The fine, super white sands and the clear shallow waters are inviting and very few can resist the temptation to take a plunge. Here, the boat crew become snorkelling instructors and give a five-minute appetizer session. What one sees is so alluring that a majority wants more. For a half hour session, the instructor pockets Rupees 500. (Surely, that is booty to be shared -- with who all, we don't know). Floating with the help of a... The Andaman Tourism office is the place to obtain the Forest department pass for a trip to Jolly Buoy island the next morning. 

The boat for Jolly Bouy leaves Wandoor at 9 AM. The 7:30 AM bus from Port Blair's bus station will take you there in one hour, passing through long stretches of tsunami-affected areas. Bus fare: Rs 22. (In my bus, though, the conductor kept the change from passengers and charged local passengers round sums without issuing tickets). 

At the end of one of an hour-long cruise over blue waters surrounded by verdant forests, visitors are transferred to glass bottomed boats. En route the shore, one can see corals within touching distance and a variety of fish. Groups of visitors claim their space at the clusters of old benches and tree trunks, to keep their belongings. It is remarkable that even without any supervision, no loss is reported in this temporary community of strangers -- perhaps a case of mutual dependence. The fine, super white sands and the clear shallow waters are inviting and very few can resist the temptation to take a plunge. 

Here, the boat crew become snorkelling instructors and give a five-minute appetizer session. What one sees is so alluring that a majority wants more. For a half hour session, the instructor pockets Rupees 500. (Surely, that is booty to be shared -- with who all, we don't know). Floating with the help of a life buoy, you bite on the snorkel (each used by scores of people each day), breath through the mouth and dip your face in the water. Soon, the magic underwater world unfolds itself. It is a serene world where life goes on unhurried. It is a beautiful scene of a coral world lit by the sun rays that filter through crystal clear waters. The variety of fish seen, the dull to the brilliantly colored, some cute and slim, some intimidating, some in shimmering groups, some loners - no museum visit is a substitute for this experience, which is also an eye-opener to the amazing biodiversity hidden under the waters that cover 72% of earth’s surface. 

Jolly Buoy is plastic-free and junk-free, thanks to sensible and simple restrictions well enforced. Before boarding the boat at Wandoor, passengers have to declare the plastic bottles they carry, and have to pay a deposit, which can be claimed on showing the bottles while returning. There are no stalls in the island. In the last boat leaving Jolly Buoy will be the lone police woman and an old man who collects all the garbage of the day in a sack. 

Simple ways to keep the uninhabited island free from human pollution. No fuss or fretting. Fantastic! More

title: the best under water view
review_text:
please dont miss SNORKELLING here..the best in andamans..you can easily do it even if you dont know how to swim..i did that..even though i was so afraid of water..and i am soo glad now i did it 
CAUTION:the changing rooms are a mess! try not using them...be ready to use shady corners..there are plenty..still dont miss snorkelling here..once in lifetime experience..better than north bay/havelock/neil 
If you cannot do that,pls use glass bottomed boat ,like my senior citizen parents did!

title: Amazing Island, pristine blue waters
review_text: The water is crystal clear, the snorkeling experience is perhaps the best in Andaman. I'd highly recommend everybody to do snorkeling here.

title: Excellent
review_text: I liked snorkeling. Great feel to watch sea live. Jolly buoy still has a clean beach though the number of people visiting has increased many fold. A & N trip is not complete without this island. Don't have much words to capture beauty of this place.

title: Best for snorkelling
review_text:
We were advised that this is the best place for snorkeling in the South Andaman islands and we weren't disappointed. Although we tried snorkeling only in elephant island (Havelock) and Jolly buoy, so can't comment if there are better corals available for view at some other place. Limited permits are issued per day to control the no. of tourists (Rs 750 per permit), have to reach early to secure a permit. Permits are issued at Wandur beach from where ferries ship you to jolly buoy island (Red skin island during the monsoon season). There are many agents at the counter who spoil the atmosphere. The permit includes a glass bottom boat ride and a 'demo' snorkeling session. The boat operators offer to take you for a longer snorkeling session for Rs 500, Rs 1000 or a for a longer glass bottom boat ride for Rs 300 per head. Bargaining is possible so do try it. We were first time snorkelers, so the longer snorkeling session was worth it. As someone mentioned below, the guides do step on corals (wearing sandals) while taking you for the view and this might be damaging. But they do have basic knowledge of the corals, starfishes, fishes that are around in these waters. Some fishes, bleached corals, sea cucumbers can be seen very close to the beach as well. Take sufficient sunscreen lotion to avoid sun burn, true for most of Andaman. No food available...
