Some fishes, bleached corals, sea cucumbers can be seen very close to the beach as well. Take sufficient sunscreen lotion to avoid sun burn, true for most of Andaman. No food available on this island (so take your own but please don't litter) and no plastic water bottles are allowed, authorities allow you to deposit Rs 100 and take Milton bottles with you. Basic changing facilities are available at the island. More

title: beautiful island but sad state of affairs
review_text: Jolly buoy still has a clean beach though the number of people visiting has increased many fold. It is still a nice place to snorkel especially for first timers. Experienced eyes would see that the corals are now bleached and much damaged. while a large part is due to tsunami but the tour operators have a role in damaging the corals. We could see the staff who were helping non swimmers snorkel by putting them in tubes and then pulling them around. do do so they would keep stepping on various corals damaging them. This is a practice which needs to be checked if Jolly buoy has to remain a beauty it is.. More

title: MISS THIS PLACE AT YOUR RISK.
review_text: A & N trip is not complete without this island. Don't have much words to capture beauty of this place. Arrive by 9 AM otherwise you may miss this place. Limited permission is issued.

title: Worth to visit
review_text:
It's worth to visit, quite interesting 
We visited in January After drive to wondoor beach there was ferry take us to jolly bouy island. Just two hundred away from island they take us on glass boat. Five minutes drive to see corals and marine life and also snorkeling. It's amazing to see different types of fishes. If you want to do more snorkeling pay five hundred more and also three hundred for glass boat ride which is worth

title: Crystal Clear Beach......
review_text: the beach is really crystal clear...when u loo down the waters of the sea u will feel as if u r looking into an aquarium....the seabed here has huge growth of corals of various kinds and u can see them through the bottom of a glass-bottomed boat which is mainly included in the package of the park....else u can also try snorkeling under the guidance of experts and u need not be a very good swimmer for that.....the island has a beautiful beach for swimming and there are change rooms too...so don't forget to take ur swimsuits before u go there...as for ur belongings i m not very sure if there is a provision of keeping ur belongings in a locker....and visiting this beach and returning to the city can cost u a whole day......and please don't carry plastic bags there coz it is strictly banned in the island More

title: Truly magical
review_text: This island is like paradise floating on emerald blue waters. One of the best places to sight corals in Andaman. You can choose to snorkel or take a glass boat.

title: Beautiful , A must visit place for everyone going to Andaman
review_text:
Really a beautiful , peaceful & scenic place to visit after Havelock , Although visiting jolly bouy is not a easy task just needs to keep prepare urself 1 day in advance , all you need is forest department permit as JB Island is situated in reserve marine park Two ways of getting Permit 1. You can obtain the permit from Forest Deptt. located in the office of Directorate of Tourism in Port Blair. Its office is situated near Port Blair Secretariat which you easily notice while wandering in Port Blair . The Permit Charges are Rs. 50 per person and a form has to be submitted along with the proof of identity in original which is must 2. You cam also obtain the permit from marine park at wandoor beach the place from where ferry starts for JB Island but always keep in mind the number of permits for a day are always fixed so reach in advance like 8 a.m then only there is chances that u will going to get the permit easily After the permit the only thing need to get is the ferry ticket which is Rs850/- from Jan 2014 onwards Also the permits & ferry tickets can easily be arranged by any hotel or tour operator if informed in advance Reaching wandoor from port blair is not a big deal u can have taxi arranged for urself ,a plenty of them are available in... Really a beautiful , peaceful & scenic place to visit after Havelock , Although visiting jolly bouy is not a easy task just needs to keep prepare urself 1 day in advance , all you need is forest department permit as JB Island is situated in reserve marine park 
Two ways of getting Permit 
1. You can obtain the permit from Forest Deptt. located in the office of Directorate of Tourism in Port Blair. Its office is situated near Port Blair Secretariat which you easily notice while wandering in Port Blair . The Permit Charges are Rs. 50 per person and a form has to be submitted along with the proof of identity in original which is must 
2. You cam also obtain the permit from marine park at wandoor beach the place from where ferry starts for JB Island but always keep in mind the number of permits for a day are always fixed so reach in advance like 8 a.m then only there is chances that u will going to get the permit easily 

After the permit the only thing need to get is the ferry ticket which is Rs850/- from Jan 2014 onwards 

Also the permits & ferry tickets can easily be arranged by any hotel or tour operator if informed in advance 

Reaching wandoor from port blair is not a big deal u can have taxi arranged for urself ,a plenty of them are available in port blair charges could be from Rs1500 to rs2500 depending on your pocket , also there is government bus service from Aberdeen Bazar to Wandoor Beach but u had to enquire about in advance i dont have the details , there is also an another option which i had preferred is Auto , It charged me rs 1000/- for to & fro journey and also took me too the wondoor beach after returning from jolly bouy island , well for my whole sighjt seeing i had hired this auto means for 3 days I took the service of this auto and he charged me Rs 2500/- only for 3 days , I am providing his number if any body too is interested in availing its service , His name is 'PRABHATIN' and his contact no is 09933216629 , he is a nice guy.. 

From Wandoor, ferries start departing from 9 am onward and depart at 15 min. interval till 10.15 am. After that you will not get any ferry 

Return ferries will Depart at 2 pm. Once you reach back Wandoor, you can go to see the Wandoor Beach (5 min. walk) 

After reaching jolly bouy island what you find is crystal clear water white sand.. if you wants to have fun in water keep youself with a extra pair of clothes , there are changing room available over there.. while on the way to JB Island the the ferry operator will going to elobrate you what you will going to do at the island , In the every ferry tickets there is a inclusion of a short ride of glass bottom boat by you can watch the marine & coral life of sea, also there is Snorkeling charge included in the ticket, the tour operator will going to help u in doing snorkeling for a short period of 5-10 min , if u wants to do more and wants to go more deep they will going to make it do at a price of Rs 500/- per person 

DO NOT FORGET TO TAKE LUNCH/PACKED FOOD ALONG WITH YOU. You won't find anything on the island, u can also had packed food or order lunch in advance at the restaurant available @ marine park so that you can had your lunch with no wait after returning from the JB Island More

proper guidance not available even at port blair air port. 
Havelock beach and jolly boy island and ross island are beautiful. cellular reminds us our freedom fighters.

title: Good palce to see corals and see world.
review_text: I liked clear water and white sand, clear visibility of corals from glass boat and by snorkeling. It is good place and half day trip. Boat from Wandoor to Jolly Buoy goes at 9, 9:30 and 10, you must be back by 2:00 PM.

title: A Must Visit Destination
review_text:
Summary - 1. It is the one of the two best, must visit destinations (along with Havelock Island) for any tourist to the Andaman Islands. 2. Most tour operators don't include Jolly Buoy in their itinerary, so be careful and insist your tour operator beforehand to include it. 3. It is a day tour from Port Blair (night stay not required). 4. The "Water Quality of the Beach" here and the "Variety of Marine Life" found here is without doubt THE BEST among all tourist destinations in Andaman Islands and this point cannot be stressed enough. 5. THE BEST location for Snorkeling. (Do not do Snorkeling anywhere else like North Bay, Elephant Breach or any other place) 6. The Island closes or tourists at 2 pm. So, reach as early as possible. 7. DO NOT FORGET TO TAKE LUNCH/PACKED FOOD ALONG WITH YOU. You won't find anything on the island Understand - Jolly Buoy is one of the 15 islands comprising the Mahatama Gandhi Marine National Park. It is open 6 months a year. How to reach and get back - 1. From Port Blair, one has to first one has to reach Wandoor (29 km, 1 hour) by road. From Wandoor, you have to catch the Jetty/Ferry to reach Jolly Buoy Island which will take another hour. 2. Boat ticket from Wandoor to Jolly Buoy and permit to enter Jolly Buoy should be taken 1 day in advance from... Summary - 
1. It is the one of the two best, must visit destinations (along with Havelock Island) for any tourist to the Andaman Islands. 
2. Most tour operators don't include Jolly Buoy in their itinerary, so be careful and insist your tour operator beforehand to include it. 
3. It is a day tour from Port Blair (night stay not required). 
4. The "Water Quality of the Beach" here and the "Variety of Marine Life" found here is without doubt THE BEST among all tourist destinations in Andaman Islands and this point cannot be stressed enough. 
5. THE BEST location for Snorkeling. (Do not do Snorkeling anywhere else like North Bay, Elephant Breach or any other place) 
6. The Island closes or tourists at 2 pm. So, reach as early as possible. 
7. DO NOT FORGET TO TAKE LUNCH/PACKED FOOD ALONG WITH YOU. You won't find anything on the island 

Understand - 
Jolly Buoy is one of the 15 islands comprising the Mahatama Gandhi Marine National Park. It is open 6 months a year. 

How to reach and get back - 
1. From Port Blair, one has to first one has to reach Wandoor (29 km, 1 hour) by road. From Wandoor, you have to catch the Jetty/Ferry to reach Jolly Buoy Island which will take another hour. 
2. Boat ticket from Wandoor to Jolly Buoy and permit to enter Jolly Buoy should be taken 1 day in advance from Port Blair itself. As of 2014, the charges are Rs 900 (850 Rs. Ferry Ticket + 50 Rs. permit) per person. This can be arranged via any tour operators in Port Blair with no additional charges (i.e at Rs 900 itself) 
3. Port Blair to Wandoor - The best and cheapest way to reach Wandoor is by the government run STS bus from the Port Blair Bus Terminal (situated within the main market of the city, Aberdeen Bazar). It is a one hour ride. (Unlike other Indian cities, the government buses are clean, uncrowded, punctual-to-the minute and reliable). On the way, you can see Sippighat agricultural farm, which is a tourist destination in itself. Catch the 7.30 am Bus so you can reach Wandoor by 8.30 am. An alternate way to reach Wandoor is to book a private return taxi from Port Blair which will cost around 2400 Rs. 
4. From Wandoor, ferries start departing from 9 am onward and depart at 15 min. interval till 10.15 am. After that you will not get any ferry. The ferry ride is quite enjoyable because your are allowed to go on the upper deck. 
5. Return ferries will Depart at 2 pm. Once you reach back Wandoor, you can go to see the Wandoor Beach (5 min. walk) or catch the return bus for Port Blair. The last return bus departs at 5.15 pm. 

Do - 
1. As mentioned earlier, it is the best spot for Snorkeling. The Marine Life (corals as well as fishes) is simply amazing and the best in Andaman Islands. The guides are also fairly knowledgeable and helpful. The rates for Snorkeling are 500 Rs (for shorter duration) or 1000 Rs (for longer route, more duration, 25 min. approx). No knowledge of swimming is required for Snorkeling. 
2. Those afraid of water can opt for glass bottom ride (available in 300 Rs and 500 Rs). A demo ride will be provided for free (inclusive in ferry ticket) when you reach Jolly Buoy. For anyone who is going to do Snorkeling, the glass bottom ride is not worth doing. 
3. There are changing rooms and shades provided to tourists for relaxing. 
4. The Water quality (clarity, visibility) is the best I have seen in India. 
5. The beach is good, location is quite scenic and well maintained. Plastics are not allowed on the island. 
6. DO NOT FORGET TO TAKE LUNCH/PACKED FOOD ALONG WITH YOU. You won't find anything to eat on the Island as it is part of a National Park and any temporary or permanent construction is forbidden on the island. More

title: Beautiful location
review_text:
This island is a must visit as this is beautiful and marine department preserve this place as people won't carry plastic items. 
Sea water is so clear that you can see through it. One should try snorkeling here.

title: Good for Snorkelling
review_text: The place is great. Please approach the tourist department for getting the permit(Rs 50/-) . The permit is also available at the venue but like any other public place there is alonhg queue and elbowing....which is best avoided.

title: Best day of our trip
review_text: Jolly Buoy is a very well run and maintained island. Part of the marine park, it was nice to see the strictness of the officials with regards to cleanliness. The water is straight from the picture perfect postcards. The corals were much better than North Bay (abysmally dirty) and Neil. The changing rooms were clean. In fact the entire island is litter-free. Snorkelling was great fun. We did additional rounds of snorkelling which included touching the corals and the fishes. Undoubtedly this was a highlight of our trip. In a nutshell, this place is paradise

title: Tranquillity and peace at Jollybuoy
review_text: Jollybuoy Islands is beautiful with clean beaches and beautiful view of the marine life all around. The beautiful waters of the sea and a clear blue sky makes the place look as if it is straight out of a painting .

title: Paradise
review_text:
I don't understand why people visit Thailand, Malaysia, etc while India has it all. 

Awesome island with turquoise blue water will give you an awesome feeling. The water is so clear that you can see corals with naked eyes even at a 20 feet depth. The snorkelling in this island is a must have and will be a lifetime experience. It will cost you about 500, 1000 or 2000 bucks based on the distance covered. Go for it and you wont repent the live aquarium experience. 

But beware... this is a no plastic island. Carry water and food with you as there's nothing available in the island. Dont forget to dump your leftovers in the dustbins or to face fine. The authority is very very strict on this island. 

In one word it's a 'Paradise'. More

title: Crystal clear water!
review_text: The most clean and clear waters bodies that I have seen till date. The place is very serene and a must visit for nature lovers.

title: Must see place
review_text: Excellent Beach - Neat & Clean. Beautiful colors, lots of colorful fishes. one of best sites for snorkeling in Andaman. As this is reserve forest, do not except locker facilities, change rooms, fresh water to refresh and snack counters. Its best advised to pack our own stuffs and food for lunch. Good thing being reserve forest. the beach is totally unpopulated...

title: if u miss it then missed best of andaman
review_text: On my 14th day I visited it and I managed a permit luckily.I realized after snorkeling....if I missed the I missed the best thing of Andaman, it is simply awesome some snorkeling, I think if anyone do the snorkeling at here then he will no require scuba at anywhere at andaman. Swimming person shouldn't go with any guide for snorkeling, please bring a mask and do snorkeling by yourself, that is the best way to browse. it is totally safe place, you will find so many live coral here...and one more thing don't go for glass boat by extra pay, whatever you have in your package that is enough, if you are not swimmer then you can go for snorkeling by extra pay only. More

title: Awesome experience
review_text:
First thing you need to ensure is that you have got a permit. Ask your travel agent to arrange for the same. Do carry your original ID card as you will be required to show them. 
The journey through the park is awesome. It takes a little more than an hour to reach Jolly Buoy from Wandoor. The beach is a wonderful place to spend the day. The water is crystal clear and this is the best place to see corals. If you are interested in snorkeling, then do it here. Variety of fishes will play around you and there are different types of corals such as boulder coral, joker coral, etc. A trip you will remember for a long long time. More

title: Don't dare to miss.
review_text: Excellent beach, rich corals & colour full fish. Good place for bath, snorekill and glass bottom ride. Excellent background for pics. But keep in mind, you have to reach there by 9 am as very limited permit is issued by authority. Rs 750 charged for to and fro boat from mahatma Gandhi marine park, wandoor. Please take one set of cloths and go with sleeper. Polythene are not permitted there. Must go there.

title: Best for Snorkelling
review_text: The beach is clean and water transparent, corals can be seen even without getting under water. The island is best for Snorkeling amongst all the islands in Andaman.

title: Coral Marine Life Gold mine!
review_text: If you want to explore marine/coral life in Andaman, Jolly Bouy island is the place to visit. Jolly Bouy island comes under Mahatma Gandhi National Marine Park and is a plastic free area. There are boat leaving to this island. As no plastic is allowed, You cannot take plastic water bottles here. Instead, take water bottle provided by the Park authorities and carry them. There are no food stall at Jolly Bouy island. It's best to carry food! The attraction of this area are the Corals. We took an additional Snorkeling session. We were taken to deep and shallow part of the sea. It was amazing to see how colourful the under water world is! This is the best place for a day outing and it's worth while to enjoy the beauty of nature! More

title: Breathtaking....
review_text:
Among the different place where corals can be seen this is the best place in terms of variety of corals can be seen. There are reasons for it. being a part of Mahatma Gandhi Marine reserve park, limited number of tourists are allowed every day. You will not be allowed to carry plastics to this island and this helps to keep the island and water clean. Then scuba diving or sea-walking is not allowed so under water marine life is left mostly undisturbed. Only was to see corals is through the glass bottom boat or by snorkeling. Compare to North Bay one will get to see much more variety of corals and fishes here. This island remains open only for 6 months, This year it opened on 1-11-2013. The remaining 6 months people will visit Red-Skin island. Plan early as limited number of tickets are given along with the forest department permission. Per head forest department permission costs Rs50/- and the Boat charge is Rs750/-. This boat charge include free glass bottom boat ride of 4-5 minutes and snorkeling for 4-5 minutes. Additional glass bottom boat ride and snorkeling can be done at per head cost of Rs300/- and Rs500/- respectively. While taking permits from forest department also take water bottle and carry bag against refundable security deposit of Rs100/- for each. The boats starts around 09:30 hrs and returns around 14:30 Hrs. There are few basic hotels near the... Among the different place where corals can be seen this is the best place in terms of variety of corals can be seen. There are reasons for it. being a part of Mahatma Gandhi Marine reserve park, limited number of tourists are allowed every day. You will not be allowed to carry plastics to this island and this helps to keep the island and water clean. Then scuba diving or sea-walking is not allowed so under water marine life is left mostly undisturbed. Only was to see corals is through the glass bottom boat or by snorkeling. Compare to North Bay one will get to see much more variety of corals and fishes here. This island remains open only for 6 months, This year it opened on 1-11-2013. The remaining 6 months people will visit Red-Skin island. 

Plan early as limited number of tickets are given along with the forest department permission. 
Per head forest department permission costs Rs50/- and the Boat charge is Rs750/-. This boat charge include free glass bottom boat ride of 4-5 minutes and snorkeling for 4-5 minutes. Additional glass bottom boat ride and snorkeling can be done at per head cost of Rs300/- and Rs500/- respectively. 

While taking permits from forest department also take water bottle and carry bag against refundable security deposit of Rs100/- for each. The boats starts around 09:30 hrs and returns around 14:30 Hrs. There are few basic hotels near the Jetty for Lunch. Most of them are bengali hotels and serves good basic food like daal, roti, chawal, sabji, papad etc. Please remember no food is available in the island. 
the boats don't go upto the shore, they will anchor near shore and you will be shifted shore by small glass bottom boats. So sharee is difficult to manage while shifting to and from smaller boats. Some basic change rooms are available in the island itself. More

title: Isolated Island with amazing Corals
review_text: It is part of Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park so there is a strict policy to carry food packets and beverages containers there. Journey starts with amazing boat ride with tropical view on both sides. Once you reach the island you can do snorkeling to explore the Corals. Great place for excursion around Port Blair. Must visit.

title: Paradise on Earth
review_text: It is a reseved and protected forest area. Secondly, this island remains open only for six months and remaining six months Red Skin Island remains open. It was a great time.

title: Paradise
review_text: This place is truely mesmerising...and a heaven from people who love white sand beaches and life away from citi life.

title: Excellent beach for Snorkelling
review_text:
Firstly, note that this is reseved and protected forest area. Secondly, this island remains open only for six months and remaining six months Red Skin Island remains open for tourists. Please check with your tour operator before finalising the itenerary. If Jolly Buoy Island is not open during your visit then Red Skin Island should be avoided in your itenerary. 

Your govt run ferry package includes 1. Glass bottom boat ride for 5 minutes and 2. Snorkelling of 5 -7 minutes. 

DOs: 

Carry sun screen lotion; 
sun glasses 
extra pair of clothes or swimsuit etc 
packed lunch or snacks etc in a separate container as there is no plastic /polythene bags allowed in your baggage. There is no food available at Island. Not even drinking water. So make sure you carry enough food and water especially if your group consist of women and children. 

Dont's: 

Do not carry plastic bags or bottles (at the jetty, forest dept will give you water bottles after submitting refundable security deposit). 
Do not go too far in the sea. it is dangerous. 
If you want to do extensive Snorkelling by going in deep sea then they will charge Rs. 500 per person. I negotiated and done it for Rs. 400 per person. It is worth!!! 

Crystal clear water....!! 

JUST DO IT! More

In the closing ceremony witness a breathtaking sunset....

title: Snorkelling Paradise
review_text: Jolly Buoy is a small Island, with best view of under water Corals. One who visits Port Blair, should keep Jolly Buoy in itinerary. Only open for 6 Months December to May, Rest Six Months Red Skin Islands

title: Snogling

title: Worth a trip, but still overrated. Poorly conducted trips.
review_text:
The only reason I gave this a 2 star review of "Poor" instead of a 1 star review of "Terrible" is because I respect the fact that the authorities do not allow plastic and other inorganic products to be brought onto the island. For this reason, the place has remained clean. Otherwise you can rest assure, people would find a way to trash the place. Now, let me explain my issues with this place - 1. First off, the boats to get here from Wandoor are completely organized. Like everywhere else in India, it is complete chaos. There's no clear system of getting people on the boards and so it becomes a free for all pushing and shoving competition. Not cool, fix that up. I was ashamed to see the uncivilized behavior of dozens of people - from all age groups. 2. The people operating the boats and then the excursions on the island have zero knowledge of English. For me this was not an issue. There was one foreign couple on the boat and for them it was a problem. I did not have a chance to speak with them until our return, otherwise I would have been happy to help them out. As the Andamans popularity grows, more foreigners will come. There some at least be someone with some knowledge of English. It's the worldwide medium of communication. 3. You can go for both a glass-bottom boat ride... The only reason I gave this a 2 star review of "Poor" instead of a 1 star review of "Terrible" is because I respect the fact that the authorities do not allow plastic and other inorganic products to be brought onto the island. For this reason, the place has remained clean. Otherwise you can rest assure, people would find a way to trash the place. 

Now, let me explain my issues with this place - 

1. First off, the boats to get here from Wandoor are completely organized. Like everywhere else in India, it is complete chaos. There's no clear system of getting people on the boards and so it becomes a free for all pushing and shoving competition. Not cool, fix that up. I was ashamed to see the uncivilized behavior of dozens of people - from all age groups. 

2. The people operating the boats and then the excursions on the island have zero knowledge of English. For me this was not an issue. There was one foreign couple on the boat and for them it was a problem. I did not have a chance to speak with them until our return, otherwise I would have been happy to help them out. As the Andamans popularity grows, more foreigners will come. There some at least be someone with some knowledge of English. It's the worldwide medium of communication. 

3. You can go for both a glass-bottom boat ride and also snorkeling while on the island. Due to the crowds of people, each boat is filled to the brim and people are only given a 5 minute "preview" after which they can pay for a longer time. It's a rip-off. Get on the boat as soon as you reach the island to get your "free" trip in, otherwise you won't get a chance. 

4. The coral is mostly dead near shore. Why? Because people touch the coral and also step on it. It's a living organism, not a rock. The authorities should have educated people about this from the beginning. Such a good job of preventing trash, only to allow the marine life to get destroyed. 

5. Continuing on from #4, there are way too many people on the island at one time. They should cut the number by 50-75%. It will create a better experience for all, even though less profit will be earned. 

6. One of the island cleaners/care takers stopped me from making a circle around the island, saying I wouldn't hear them calling for us to board the boat to return. That is complete non-sense as a walk-around would only take 5 minutes at most, and I tried to do this at the start of the trip. You have 2-3 hours there from what I recall. The island is small, be persistent if they try to stop you. I'm an environmental protection freak, nothing will be damaged that already isn't. 

Overall it's worth the trip despite my negative review. I would actually rate it above Havelock Island. I just feel that the authorities who organize and allow for this trip could do a much better job. 

Lastly, plan on spending your entire day to complete this tour - from morning til evening. 

Wandoor village has food/refreshments. You can get free bottles for pouring your drink(s) in when purchasing your entry ticket. You must return them on arrival, and only those bottles provided by the authorities are allowed. More

title: Amazing
review_text: Lot of activities to do on this picturesque island ... glass bottom boat ride to see the reef, surfing, snorkeling, scuba diving, sailing, fishing, photographing, deep sea diving or relax on the white sand. Be careful, because one is not allowed to carry plastic bags.

title: good
review_text: this place is good..good sea lifeeeeeee good boatsss take u to this placeeeee........a bit of currentttttt in the water butttt still the boat ride is good and the snorkelling is reallllly gooodd ...u shud visittt this place

title: Get yourself transported to different world
review_text: You cannnot miss this island, if you are in Port Blair. To visit this island, one requires special permit as the isalnd is located inside Mahatma Gandhi National Reserve Park. The island can be approached from Wadoor, from where one needs to catch a boat. It almost takes 45 minutes to reach. It's a no man island and joy to have a swim in this island is divine. Let me also make a mention that the island boasts coral reef and a marine life, which kept me amazed.

title: Clearest water ever!!!
review_text:
Its as good as very one has described. We stayed at hotel Shreesh, and we hired a cab for a day's trip to Jolly Buoy Island. We hired a cab from a travel agent called Moid (09933280145), he not only arranged for the cab (Estillo/ AC) but also had the driver pick up our tickets/permission to the Island from Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park to Jolly Buoy ISland. We also visited Wandoor Beach few kilometers away after the trip to Jolly Buoy Island. All this for 4500Rs for 4 ppl. We left our hotel by 7am and reached Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park by 8:30am. While the driver picked up our tickets/permission to Jolly Buoy Island, we went to the museum and the auditorium and enjoyed the marine show. The tickets cost Rs. 650/head and Rs.200(for all 4 of us) for the marine park entry. This ticket of Rs.650 includes a glass boat ride and guided snorkeling(for 10mins) and in case u don't like snorkeling you will get an extra glass boat ride around the Island at jolly buoy Island. Only one boat offers both snorkeling and glass boat ride, others offer either snorkeling or glass boat ride. There is a limit to number of boat trips that can happen in a day from the ferry point at Marine park entrance to Jolly Buoy Island hence reach early and get your tickets. Its one hour boat ride from Mahatma Gandhi... Its as good as very one has described. 
We stayed at hotel Shreesh, and we hired a cab for a day's trip to Jolly Buoy Island. We hired a cab from a travel agent called Moid (09933280145), he not only arranged for the cab (Estillo/ AC) but also had the driver pick up our tickets/permission to the Island from Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park to Jolly Buoy ISland. We also visited Wandoor Beach few kilometers away after the trip to Jolly Buoy Island. All this for 4500Rs for 4 ppl. 
We left our hotel by 7am and reached Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park by 8:30am. 
While the driver picked up our tickets/permission to Jolly Buoy Island, we went to the museum and the auditorium and enjoyed the marine show. 
The tickets cost Rs. 650/head and Rs.200(for all 4 of us) for the marine park entry. 
This ticket of Rs.650 includes a glass boat ride and guided snorkeling(for 10mins) and in case u don't like snorkeling you will get an extra glass boat ride around the Island at jolly buoy Island. Only one boat offers both snorkeling and glass boat ride, others offer either snorkeling or glass boat ride. 
There is a limit to number of boat trips that can happen in a day from the ferry point at Marine park entrance to Jolly Buoy Island hence reach early and get your tickets. 
Its one hour boat ride from Mahatma Gandhi Marine park entrance to Jolly Buoy Island. You get around 2hrs to explore this Island before your boat heads back to Marine park entrance. 
Additionally you need to make a deposit of 100Rs to take plastic bottles inside the marine park. You can take max 3 bottles for Rs.100. Your bags are checked before you board the ferry. 

It was about 2pm when we got back to Marine park entrance and we left to Wandoor beach which is about 3Kms from here. The beach is very nice. Lot of peddlers on the beach here sell sweet mangoes. There are also a few restaurants but we had got our lunch packed from the hotel in the morning. More

title: Beautiful... shouldn't miss!!!
review_text: Beautiful soft sand island operational only for 6 months of a year (Nov to Mar) (rest, Red skin island). A good coral variety collection. Enjoyed snorkeling. There is no resort/ anything to stay overnight, just a wonderful day trip!! :)

title: Coral Reef
review_text: Great place for snorkeling experience. The corals here are different in comparison to the other islands. Worth an effort for this purpose alone

title: Heaven on earth!!!
review_text: My friend recommended me this place, so I gave Ross island a miss to go this place. You need to get permission to go to this place as this place is under Mahatma Gandhi Marine national park. You are not allowed to carry any plastic bags to the island and you need to show at the main entrance the number of water bottles you are carrying, which you need to bring it back and show at the entrance again. Carry food and water as you don’t have any shops in the island. You will be going to the island by a small ferry which will go at a snail speed, but you can enjoy the picturesque scenery throughout the journey. The ferry would stop few meters before the shore and then you will be transferred to a glass boat, which will allow you to see beautiful corals and fishes. They ferry people will also give you a demo for snorkelling for 5 minutes. If you like, then you can go more deep, which they will charge additional Rs.500. The ferry ticket cost is Rs 650. The Jolly bouy is an excellent experience. More

title: Picture Perfect
review_text:
As soon as you get near this island, you'll jump to joy after seeing its scenic beauty. 

Caution: Remains open from Oct-Apr 

Can do Glass Bottom Ride/ Deep Water Snorkeling. 

My wife did both & was excited about Deep Water Snorkeling. Can avoid Glass Bottom Ride Or carry something to cover yourself from the top in order to avoid Sun's reflection on the Glass. 

Safe for Sea Bath.

title: Beautiful green Shallow waters
review_text: This is one place which shouldnt be missedduring andaman visit. Beautiful place to do snorkeling anfd other water activities. It is a place blessed by nature. To reach here you have to take tickets and gert on the boats from wandoor which takes limited number of people everyday. Coral reefs here are very beautiful and varied. A place to to miss if you are going

title: wonders of the underworld
review_text:
If you want to enjoy white sand beach, clear water, unpolluted environment, and on top of that some beautiful experience of snorkelling then this is the place for you. 
The island was much more beautiful before the Tsunami, but what is left to it is not that bad for the first timers. 
You need to get permit letters from the tourism department, if you are with any of the travel agents then they will arrange it for you. As everyone else said its for 750 rs one free snorkelling included. 
The boat goes very slow but if you absorb into the picturesque surrounding then its less tiring. 
The main boat is stopped few mtrs away from the island then you are transferred into the small glass boats with a trailer ride of the corals. 
The island is a litter free area even you have to deposit the plastic water bottles or get permission by giving 100 rs deposit. 
The guides just take you for 5 min free snorkelling then you tempt for more, bargain with them according to the people in your group.just remember even giving 500rs is worth it. 
we saw many pools of different coloured fishes, fifferent corals, not that colourful though. 
after relaxing there for 3-4 hrs you can come back satisfied and tanned. More

title: Only if you have no plan of visiting Havelock
review_text:
Clear water with abundant fish life, however to get there you need to have permit and boat tickets (Rs 700). Obtaining the ticket and getting on to boat is a tiresome experience which involves standing in blazing sun for around 2 hours. Once your boat reaches Jolly Buoy island it will anchor around 100mts from beach and you are transported in a smaller glass bottom boat towards beach. You are allowed to roam in a small stretch of beach due to safety concerns (strong current and poisonous insects the forest guard said). Do take the glass bottom ride for sure since it helps in seeing the teeming sea life. However currents are strong and its not safe to snorkel here alone. Boatmen do take you for snorkelling however due to current they take you on a short round and that too with assistance of a rope tied to the shore to help them from not getting washed away in current. Somehow felt the place was not safe though immensely beautiful. Most trips to island start around 10 AM and return to main jetty by around 3PM. The Jetty for getting boat to Jolly Buoy is around 35KMs from Port Blair by road. If you have plan of snorkelling in Havelock I guess you can give Jolly Buoy a miss since for Jolly Buoy you are on a tight schedule dictated by the boatmen. Elephanta beach in Havelock gives you leisure... Clear water with abundant fish life, however to get there you need to have permit and boat tickets (Rs 700). Boatmen do take you for snorkelling however due to current they take you on a short round and that too with assistance of a rope tied to the shore to help them from not getting washed away in current. Somehow felt the place was not safe though immensely beautiful.

If you have plan of snorkelling in Havelock I guess you can give Jolly Buoy a miss since for Jolly Buoy you are on a tight schedule dictated by the boatmen. Elephanta beach in Havelock gives you leisure of taking things at your own pace since whole boat is rented by you. 

For changing there are separate rooms for men and women, however be advised that its very poorly maintained and not cleaned anytime late. More

title: awesome...
review_text: must go..and snorkel...its like a 45 min ride...i suggest go on the boat ml rubdeep...thats the fastest...conevniently.....3-4 mins from the sea princess beach resort....white sandy beaches and coral reefs to amaze your eyes si all you get!

title: Bad tour guides
review_text: Unless you are an expert diver, you need guides to see Jolly Buoy coral reef. Unfortunately, the guides are huge disappointment here. They are like temple pandas, only interested in making some quick buck rather than giving you a pleasant tour. Facilities around the park are very basic. You should carry your food and water. Better skip this place and spend a day in Havlock.

title: unexplored
review_text: it is an unexplored island...very beautiful...but the bad part is the guides and boatman misguide and overcharge for water sports

title: Awesome clean crystal waters
review_text: Brilliant!!!! the most clean water you may find and the peace & serenity in the island is just out of the world. Try Snorkeling out here- Highly recommended!

title: Lovely Jolly Buoy Island
review_text:
I will remember this island because of my first ever snorkeling experience. 

Actually this island is very beautiful. Excellent clear water. We just loved the color of the water. The corals and fishes are also excellent here. We explored the Corals and Fishes by doing Snorkeling here. 

You need to get permission one day advance to go to this island. It will cost Rs. 750.00 per head. (Rs. 650.00 for both-way ferry ticket and Rs. 100.00 for permit). This cost includes one free snorkeling. 

After finishing our free snorkeling we just love it to do it again. So we again do it in an additional cost of Rs. 500.00 per head. 

In overall, we loved the trip on this island. More

title: It took my entire day for very little in return
review_text:
45 minute drive to wandoor. 

1 hour boring ride on a ship to jolly buoy. 

Getting cheated by govt. person appointed to give me "snorkelling trailer" by his words included in my 650 Rs Package. 

Next thing he ignores this trailer for everybody and offers them Rs. 500 per person for snorkelling. Especially to those people without snorkels or goggles. 

So basically I did not get my snorkelling and I should sue them for this, but anyway. 

Cheats are running the show here. But in the end it was not a waste. I'll tell you how. 

My Brother and I had our own snorkels and mask plus the corals were very near to the beach. So we saw the corals and fishes on our own. The govt guy ( MANOJ { mr. cheat }) got stumped by us actually. 

So i advise: 

Take your Snorkels and Masks to Andamans. 

The current at Jolly Buoy is sometimes very strong. So be a good swimmer first. 

Talk rudely to idiots like Manoj who are supposed to give you in their words snorkelling ''trailers" but are more interested in selling their own trips. 

The fishes are amazing and they actually come till the beach and play with you. So atleast take swimming goggles along. 

Corals are nearby, so if you're a good swimmer take your snorkels. 

Overall a good experience. Second only to Radhanagar. More

title: Jolly Buoy
review_text: – Best place at Andaman, don’t miss it. It’s an hour drive from Port Blair and then 45 minute ferry. Beach is just awesome. This should be best beach in Asia. Clear water, shallow depth, around 1 KM beach, water current at heavy at times, corals starts at waist water depth itself. Carry water and eatable as nothing is available at beach. Plastic is not allowed and please keep the beach clean.

title: Day trip to Jolly Buoy Island
review_text:
It is a well maintained, clean and small Island. It can be done a day trip from Port Blair. It is a part of the Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park and to get there, one has to reach Wandoor and go by ferry from there. 

Plastics are not allowed on the Island. One can carry water bottles there with an initial deposit at the ticket counter. The deposit amount of Rs 100 is refundable once you bring back the empty water bottles. 
It has a nice small white sand beach and a ticket to visit the Island includes a glass bottom boat ride to see corals in the beach and also a small snorkelling trip. More

title: "Crystal clear water"
review_text:
Jolly buoy Island is a not to miss place if you are going to port blair. We stayed at Andman for 6 days and we all feel the day we spent on jolly buoy was best day out of all days. Reason being : 
1. Crystal clear water which is hard to find on Indian mainland's beaches. 
2. Our first snorkeling (10 minutes snorkeling was free with ticket). Mostly people pay extra to spend more time for snorkeling which is worth it. 
3. Boat ride to the island was also a great experience where we got to see some beautiful islands and the blowing wind was giving a close to nature feeling. More

title: Clean water and fun ride
review_text: Well this is an island about 30 km from port blair . First you have to travel by road to the place Wandoor and from there they take you in a ferry to Jolly Buoy island . The ferry is a bit slow , it takes about 45 min - 1 hour to reach the island . The island is simply phenomenal . Absolutely clean water and good corals . Though the island has started to get clumsy as people don't use bins to through the leftovers despite being instructed that fine would be imposed if somebody is find doing so . Snorkling and seeing corals through Glass bottom boat was fun . One can even enjoy swimming in crystal clear water at the island . More

title: Snorkeling Heaven....
review_text:
> Best for Snorkeling. 3-4 minute snorkeling is included in boat ticket to Jolly Buoy. A glass bottom boat ride too is included. But if you want to to do more, you have to pay extra. Although the star fish they take in the hand are definitely fake and planted. Nonetheless you will able to see much more sea life. 
> No food available there. Plastic bottles are only allowed on a security deposit. Not to litter there. 
>Open between Nov to March. In rainy season they take you red skin island.

title: Balas Jollybuoy island visit
review_text: It takes about two and a half hours from Portblair to Jolly buoy island by road plus boat. One can enjoy driving through roads with green forests on either side plus Mangroves on both sides during boat ride from Wandur Jetty to Jolly Buoy Island. It is an Island with shallow beach, clean water enabling the tourists to swim, play in water. We also did snorkelling and saw very beautiful corals, varieties of fish etc.

title: Jolly Boy Island - Snorkling and beach
review_text:
The sea is very rough in Jolly boy island. There is a lot of water current and not a safe beach. The 
snorkelling trip seems to be fake. Most of the items they show in the sea seems to be planted. 

one other factor to look at is no foreigner comes to this island. only Indian folk to this place. 

Surely not a safe place. 

We found Neil, North Bay and Havelock better for water sports.

title: Snorkeling Paradise
review_text:
As part of Mahatama Gandhi Marine Park, place is spotless and water too clean. 
Pack lunch and water, there is no place to eat drink or whatsoever. 

Permission and boat ride to Jolly Buoy costs 700 Rupees which includes short Glass Boat trip and snorkeling.

title: Good for begineers
review_text: 1hour boat ride and 3mins glass bottom boat ride is what it takes to reach jolly buoy..a small uninhabbited island. We did snorkelling and paid rs500 p p extra to go a little further. Held star fish and sea cucumber. Thats it. No corals/ oysters not even any school of fish. Found only a few variety of fish. Snorkelling is much better in elephanta beach. You can see heaven inside the sea of you pay half the price paid in jolly buoy. Way to jolly buoy is great with excellent view of mangrove trees..go left from the beach and you can a fallen tree on the sea. Good place to rest and enjoy solitude. Me and my wife spend some quality time there and were jonined by crabs. More

title: nature at its best
review_text: one doesnot need to go to mauritius to enjoy watersports and swim in aquamarine water. clean calm and beautiful offers everything that you would expect from a top beach destination.the glassbottom boat ride is awsome and so is the snorkelling and undersea walk experience.

title: Excellent place must visit
review_text: Its a great place to see corals around Portblair. Very colorful water with lot off colorful fishes and corals. Must go ahead with Snorkeling at this place.

title: The best snorkeling location
review_text: Jolly Buoy is a part of Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park. It boasts of the best corals and the widest variety of marine life in just a small area. Got to see clown fish, lion fish, ball star fish and many others which are normally not visible at other locations.

title: Snorkeling at its best
review_text: Snorkeling @ Rs 500 for 30 min. We nearly touched the corels, star fish, magic corels etc. The island does not have any attaraction as such but the activities were great @ value for money. Learnt floating here. Whole family enjoyed the trip.

title: The best place to visit in Andaman
review_text:
This is, by far, the best place in whole of Andaman. The ferry ride to the beach is a pleasant one with mangroves surrounding us the whole way. The snorkelling experience here is one of the best. There is no scuba diving in this island. There is option of a glass bottom boat ride too. The better option is the snorkelling. The guide who took us snorkelling was great. For a little extra money they will take you a little further where more corals and fishes are visible. We could touch a variety of corals and also come very close to a lot of fishes. Even if you have experienced in other islands, the experience in Jolly Buoy should not be missed. Caution - There is only a changing room and no washroom/toilet or provision for a shower. The government has made sure this island is highly protected from humans. Be sure to get spare clothes and also not to plan anything else after a trip to the island, so that you can head to the hotel for a shower (that's what we did, unlike most people), or else you will end up sticky and irritable the whole day. Also, ensure that your travel planner/agent has planned for the visit to the island. A permit is required to enter the island and also, no plastics are allowed - in any form be it a bottle or a polythene cover. No... This is, by far, the best place in whole of Andaman. There is option of a glass bottom boat ride too. The better option is the snorkelling. The guide who took us snorkelling was great. For a little extra money they will take you a little further where more corals and fishes are visible. We could touch a variety of corals and also come very close to a lot of fishes. Even if you have experienced in other islands, the experience in Jolly Buoy should not be missed. 
Caution - There is only a changing room and no washroom/toilet or provision for a shower. The government has made sure this island is highly protected from humans. Be sure to get spare clothes and also not to plan anything else after a trip to the island, so that you can head to the hotel for a shower (that's what we did, unlike most people), or else you will end up sticky and irritable the whole day. Also, ensure that your travel planner/agent has planned for the visit to the island. A permit is required to enter the island and also, no plastics are allowed - in any form be it a bottle or a polythene cover. No provision to eat anything here. You have to head back to Port Blair, alternatively you can ask your hotel to pack lunch for you. More

title: Excellent Beach Best for Snookering and Glass Bottom boat ride
review_text: This is cleanest beach. Plastic Bottles and Poly bags are banned here. This is protected area under Mahatma Gandhi National Park and a limited number of tourists are allowed here. You have to take permit from government to visit this place.There is no restaurant or Coconut seller in this island. You can enjoy here only upto 3PM. My glass bottom ride and snookering experience is best among all the islands at Andaman as water is clearest here and you can sea almost all the Coral reef species for example Fishes,Different corals like Fungia(Mushroom coral) Sea anemone, comb jellies. I have seen cuttle fish and Sea snake also here. Only a part of this island is open of public.Ladies changing room condition is very embarrassing here as the area in and outside the Ladies changing room is very untidy and giving foul smell due to ------so many bad things that i can't tell you all. More

title: Coral watching
review_text: Best coral watching in Port Blair. The guys there do a good job. Snorkeling is also good. The place is nice isolated. Do carry your lunch packs & water. It is important.

title: Fun Filled Snorkling
review_text:
Crystal clear water , amazing corals , snorkeling , sea bathing and fun , Everything here was amazing except for two things 

1. Area in the ticket counter can have better facilities like sitting area , rest room etc . The lines can be better manged 
2. People need to learn not to dump trash

title: Just loved it
review_text:
Right from boat ride to snorkeling everything is great about this Island. Though forest officials tried their best to avoid littering and use of plastic bottles etc. Few fellow travelers out of habit do not bother about maintaining the sanity of the place. Why on earth they do not understand that plastic creates havoc to coral reefs and completely ruined it. 

Urge to travelers: Please do not litter or leave behind any kind of plastic, food wrappers, gutka pouches etc.

title: Best Place to Visit in Port Blair
review_text:
This is the best and most clean Island I had ever visited. Water is very clear. 
You need to apply for the permit 2 days prior to your visit. Ticket cost is around INR 650 which includes 'Glass Bottom Boat Ride' and 'Snorkeling'. Pay them extra for Snorkeling and they will take you deeper into the sea and you will see more Corals and fishes. It's worth paying them extra for snorkeling. 
This is the must Visit place if you are visiting Andaman. 

Tip: Don't carry any Plastic Bags. Carry Jute Bags for bringing back Wet Cloths. You need to deposit Rs 50 for each water bottle you carry to Jolly Buoy Island and will get the deposit back on return by showing the bottles. More

title: Can visit depending on your overall Andaman itinerary
review_text:
I see there are broadly two types of visitors to the Andamans. One who want to visit every single "attraction" and have a check list of these to complete. The other who want to get a flavour of several activities and want peace, solitude and quality time. If you are of the latter category, then read on, else this review is irrelevant for you. You need to set up the visit to Mahatma Gandhi National Park a day in advance with the help of your travel agent. There is an entry permit which needs photo ID. The actual fee to enter the park, and visit either of the 2 islands (they open only one to tourists on a given day) is Rs 650 per head. Assuming you have done this bit of planning, from Port Blair, Wandoor is a 35-40 minute car ride away, on decent roads. Plastic is supposedly not allowed inside the park and since there is no drinking water or food available inside, there is a counter from where you can get a token for the plastic drinking water bottles you plan to carry in. You pay a deposit of Rs 100 per bottle and then when you return and hand over the bottles, you get it back. Never mind that you can actually game the system - since you can go and buy another bottle for 20, chuck the water and then "return" it as the... I see there are broadly two types of visitors to the Andamans. One who want to visit every single "attraction" and have a check list of these to complete. The other who want to get a flavour of several activities and want peace, solitude and quality time. If you are of the latter category, then read on, else this review is irrelevant for you. 

You need to set up the visit to Mahatma Gandhi National Park a day in advance with the help of your travel agent. There is an entry permit which needs photo ID. The actual fee to enter the park, and visit either of the 2 islands (they open only one to tourists on a given day) is Rs 650 per head. Assuming you have done this bit of planning, from Port Blair, Wandoor is a 35-40 minute car ride away, on decent roads. 

Plastic is supposedly not allowed inside the park and since there is no drinking water or food available inside, there is a counter from where you can get a token for the plastic drinking water bottles you plan to carry in. You pay a deposit of Rs 100 per bottle and then when you return and hand over the bottles, you get it back. Never mind that you can actually game the system - since you can go and buy another bottle for 20, chuck the water and then "return" it as the original bottle and claim your 100. 

You then get into what feels like a crowded boat with a capacity around 40 people and cruise into the park. Scenery is nice, but nothing extraordinary, though by time, about 10000 pictures would have been clicked by your fellow boat mates. 

After around an hour, you reach Jolly Buoy Island. It looks nice, with clear water around it. Your boat is likely to have a smaller glass-bottomed boat attached. You get out, about 14 at a time, into the glass-bottomed boat and view coral and fish as you slowly head to the beach. Pretty decent stuff. 

The "guides" from your boat will later take people, 2-3 at a time, into the sea for about 50 meters, about 15 minutes, for snorkelling. You are assumed to be a novice and use a tube float and a face mask, while the "guide" uses fins and pulls you along. 

The coral was okay, nothing extraordinary and most of the coral is bleached or dead here (as is most in the region due to the bleaching of coral due to warm temperatures, which peaked in May 2010). I found that the coral and fish at Inglis Island much much better. And I heard that those off South Button were also pretty good. 

Here, you're going to meet a lot of nice uncles and aunties. Many of the uncles will go swimming in their underwear. And roam around the island after they are wet. Especially the old men. Rather disgusting. 

So if you really want to complete your check list, go to Jolly Buoy. More

title: Awesome snorkelling site
review_text: Best site for snorkelling in Andamans with clear visibility. Instructors can be misleading in terms of distance covered for Rs.500 more but that is wrong. Area covered in both the price range is almost same. Best part is they will pick up star fishes, sea cucumbers for you to touch and see. Loved the overall experience.

title: Jolly Buoy
review_text: absolutely amazing. do not go snorkeling any where else in andamans. i did not visit the english islands so cant compare it to that. irrespective this is a 100% must on the list during andamans visit

title: A must visit
review_text: Don't plan on going snorkeling anywhere else. This is the place to go to. Pay the boatmen some extra to take you further out to the corals. Totally worth it.

title: IN THE LAP OF VIRGIN NATURE &WITHOUT FOREIGNERS
review_text:
It was an excellent experience starting from knowing that 'roudy' Foreigners that always have an attitude are NOT ALLOWED at all and to the fact that only 190 persons per day are allowed to visit Jolly buoy Island in the National Marine Park from wandoor jetty. 
The jolly buoy islandisworth visiting and I will recomend it more than Havelock Island which is filled with commercialism, romanticism and foreigners rather than nature. 
So Natue lovers tighten up for a visit to Andman that will include snorkeling at Jolly buoy island and Glassbottom ride also there. 
My personal view is that you must carry your own snorkeling gear that will be more helpful. 
And yes, while at Andaman DO NOT TAKE JET SKI it is more cheaper and better at GOA. However, do go for scuba or seawalk at Northbay Island [Haggle over the rpice a lot show indifference and you will be surprised that the price will reduce from 4000 to 2000 for scuba and 2700 to 1500 for seawalk!] More

title: Tips For Jolly Buoy
review_text:
First of all, dis is an awwsum place..As it is protected under Mahatma Gandhi National Park, its very clean & natural....there r no dwellings or shops!! A 7 min Glass Bottomed boat ride & Snorkelling is provided free on purchasing the Rs 650 ticket...so its ensured dat u dont miss da breath taking view of underwater corals!! However..here are sum imp info & tips: Plastics of any kind are not allowed...A max of 3 plastic water bottles can b taken inside after depositing Rs 100 which is refundable!! Also..and dis is where I felt very strongly.... The duration of da trip is from 9.30 to 2.30 So before going...da tour operators will advise u 2 give da order for lunch at da restaurants at da ferry...HOWEVER... most of the tour operators & their drivers(bcoz they get commission and free meals) will try 2 FORCE u 2 enter a small dirty restaurant,most probably da name is "Bangali restauurant"!!! DONT GO THERE!!! Though it wont appear very bad at first sight...when u return from JOLLY BUOY, tired & hungry...u will see da place OVERCROWDED & FILTHY..wid ppl pushing & shoving wid a long line of ppl still 2 find a place there!! SO MY ADVICE IS: instead of ordering lunch at da aforementioned restaurant...find sum other place( there r 3 or more restaurants side by side) which is both CLEANER & NICER!! We,in spite of ordering lunch & depositing Rs 200 at...
