PLZ BEAR THIS IN MIND-I felt it was my duty 2 warn U 
Have a Nice trip :D More

title: Amateur Snorklers Paradise, Veteran Snorklers will go Mad
review_text:
This is another attraction you must not miss from Port Blair 

Firstly DONT GO LATE! y? cause theres a Lovely "Marine Information Centre" which is open from early Morning till 2. This is a MUST GO cause its really World Class. the reason i said don't go late is cause once you go to the island, you end up coming back by 4 and by then this shuts. Strange but then better to adjust than wait for some tube light to go one. 

So first thing go and see the lovely Marine Centre and the movie also that they show in AC that will put PVR Cinema to shame. 

Carry food cause once you go to Jolly Bouy Island you'll know what Robinson Cruzo felt. There is a heavy fine for littering and theres also a guy spying on you. My dad tipped him for the excellent work he's doing catching people and cleaning the junk that washes up on the beach. he's Jolly Bouys true Hero More

title: Must visit!
review_text:
Jolly Buoy is one of the best islands in the Andamans and a visit to this place is a must. There are ferries from Wandoor jetty to Jolly Buoy at 9AM. The drive from Port Blair to Wandoor jetty is scenic and takes you through the villages of Andamans. The ride is beautiful with coconut and palm trees on both sides, giving you a feel of Kerala. The drive of 13kms takes about 40 minutes. The island is a part of Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park and hence you need a permit for visiting the same. Also it is a no plastic zone, though you can carry water bottles at a deposit of Rs100 each. Once you return back to the jetty, you can get the money back by showing the bottle, donot dispose it off at the island. The ferry is much more organised as compared to the ferries for Ross/North Bay islands. The 1hour ferry ride to the island is through beautiful mangroves. It gives you a feel of the amazon rain forests in hues of red and green. The colour of the water is equally beautiful in shades of green and blue. You can also clearly see the sea and backwaters meeting. The ferry stops at a distance from the island, as the coral reefs would be destroyed by the ferry. Hence, there are small glass bottom boats which would take you till the shore. The island... Jolly Buoy is one of the best islands in the Andamans and a visit to this place is a must. 
There are ferries from Wandoor jetty to Jolly Buoy at 9AM. The drive from Port Blair to Wandoor jetty is scenic and takes you through the villages of Andamans. The ride is beautiful with coconut and palm trees on both sides, giving you a feel of Kerala. The drive of 13kms takes about 40 minutes. 
The island is a part of Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park and hence you need a permit for visiting the same. Also it is a no plastic zone, though you can carry water bottles at a deposit of Rs100 each. Once you return back to the jetty, you can get the money back by showing the bottle, donot dispose it off at the island. 
The ferry is much more organised as compared to the ferries for Ross/North Bay islands. The 1hour ferry ride to the island is through beautiful mangroves. It gives you a feel of the amazon rain forests in hues of red and green. The colour of the water is equally beautiful in shades of green and blue. You can also clearly see the sea and backwaters meeting. 
The ferry stops at a distance from the island, as the coral reefs would be destroyed by the ferry. Hence, there are small glass bottom boats which would take you till the shore. The island has a virgin white sand beach with lot of greenery around. There are makeshift arrangement for changing rooms and toilets which are unfortunately not clean. There is also some place to sit under the shade. 
The best part of Jolly Buoy is its corals and sea life. Having tried glass bottom boat rides at Elephanta and Neil island, scuba diving at havelock, we concluded that Jolly Buoy is the best place for snorkeling/glass bottom boat ride. There is a complimentary snorkeling trip included in the ferry ride, but it is better if you pay extra and go as far as possible. We could see fishes of all possible colors like Finding Nemo, Tiger fish etc.... we touched a star fish, sea cucumber, saw all types of corals and it was sheer bliss. The water is crystal clear and the marine life is so vibrant, it is a must for everyone to experience this beauty. Snorkeling is mush easier than scuba as you donot have to go under water, also there will be a guide with you all the time identifying the fishes or corals for you. The only problem was with the snorkeling gears which were dirty and broken. So it is better to carry your own gear when you visit the Andamans, as you would get a chance to snorkel almost everywhere. Those who donot wish to snorkel can go for a glass bottom boat ride and clearly see the marine life. 
We paid Rs300 pp for snorkelling and Rs200 pp for glass bottom boat. 
Note: There is no food or water available in this island, hence carry the same. Also carry some mats/bedsheets to sit on the beach. This beach is not suitable for swimming as it has very strong currents. More

title: An awesome place for snorkelling
review_text: If you are visiting the andamans.. snorkelling and scuba are a must... snorkelling facility is available at many places .. but as per a few locals its best at Jolly Buoy. the corals, the exotic fishes.. large number n brilliant colors. go for the extended snorkelling. (i.e. by paying additional money) .they take u a bit far from shore.. its definitely worth it.. if possible try to carry an underwater camera (Canon, Olympus, Panasonic.... all have a special waterproof digital camera for underwater shooting). thats a cherry on top to have those beautiful moments carried back with you..

title: Great Experience
review_text: Wonderful place to snorkel. The corals and aquatic life is possibly best in the Andamans. A do-not-miss site for anyone holidaying in Andamans

title: Beautiful Sea life
review_text: Best place in Andaman to do Snorkeling. Water is crystal clear. Variety of fishes and coral life. Charges to visit are 650 rupees. However, this includes a session of snorkeling and Glass bottom boat ride.

title: Nice Beach
review_text: from Portblair we have reached there through a boat and enjoyed there .....Its a samll beach not spread long.... long deep is there just after 20-30 foot from the beach. Sand is also very nice there.

title: The most pristine coral reef in the world!
review_text:
If you are heading to Andaman, please don't miss this! 
A jolly ride off Wandoor beach leads you to these crystal clear waters and coral reef. If you haven't snorkeled before, then get rid of your fears in Coral island or Elephant Beach. The boatmen who take you snorkeling and glass boat rides will let you touch special starfishes and sea cucumbers. 
Relax and throw away all your fatigues in these waters!!! 

Any extra amount for glass boat rides, snorkeling extra distances are worth it!

title: The best Island with wonderful corals
review_text: The best place in Andaman. The corals are worth watching and the snorkeling here was the memorable one. The waves are not too strong and this lets us enjoy the clear water. The sea is shallow and this makes even the non-swimmers enjoy the day with relief. :) Don't miss this place. We came back from this island with a lot of memories from snorkeling

title: Glass Bottomed Boat
review_text: Liked the corals, wading in the sea, the gigantic shells, the courteous boatmen, and the vigilant watchman who ensured that no one took away the shells or anything else from the island.

title: Jolly Buoy is real joy
review_text: Trip to Andaman is incomplete with visiting Jolly Buoy Island..Cleanest Island around since it comes under Mahatma Gandhi Marine pary..Plastic free Zone..Milton water bottles can be hired from govt. office at minimal rent..fill it with either coconut water or plain water and head for the Island..Pretine white Sand beach, pool like water without waves wherein you can enjoy. 10 minutes snorkelling is included in the ticket and boat person issue token for the same, however tip the guide and he will take you to deeper places wherein Corals and Marine life can be seen. Similarly, we paid Rs. 100 for extra ride in glass bottom boat and they took us around the island. They picked sea cucumber, gold fish and star fish from sea bottom, let us clicked pics with them and then put them abck to the sea..it was real fun..It is a must visit place when you are visiting Andaman More

title: Pleasant
review_text: It was a nice ride to the Island in the ferry. However, they said it is a NO PLASTIC ZONE and we can not carry even water there. But we do not get water also there and you see lot of people bringing their own water in PLASTIC. No checking whatsoever is done. A very good place to play and enjoy the beach.

title: Poorly Maintained
review_text:
This place is not as good as it showcased. Resorts here are very old. However, the best we liked was a police who looked at our group and checked if we knew the timings to be on beach and why did the resort not send a guide. 

If you plan a trip to Anadamns, minimize your stat at Port Blair and go to Havelock. This sure is one of the best places to be at. It sure is heaven on earth

title: Jolly buoy---a coral paradise
review_text: U want to see live coral..come here..see the sea..u will feel like u r in a river which is having a good current and want to take with u..but..when u watch coral..u will forgot every thing..do snorkling here..it is must..u will see..nemo..star fish..sea cucumber..plate coral..and so may other coral..

title: Snorkel away to glory
review_text:
Lovely little island with a pristine white beach. 

Please make sure that you bargain hard and then Snorkel hard. If not, at least do take the glass-bottomed boat ride for viewing some live Corals and beautiful aquatic life.

title: Out of the world
review_text:
Simply loved it. You have to go there once. Very beautiful beach. Did snorkeling and glass bottom boat ride here. It was amazing. 
Its a plastic free zone and not inhabited. You need to carry your own food etc for the day trip. The boat leaves at 9 30 from the jetty and you are back by 3 30. And you need a permit to visit it. A xerox of your id proof too needs to be submitted.

title: Nature's Beauty
review_text:
Extremely Beautiful. Located in the Mahatma Gandhi Reserve, has beautiful Coral formations. Ideal Location to Snorkel or Deep Sea Diving. 
Caution: Plastic Packets and Plastic Bottles NOT allowed

title: An unforgettable experience
review_text: The highlight of our Andaman tour was a trip to Jolly Buoy Island. The boat journey from wandoor to Jolly Buoy through many mangrove islands was really enjoyable. Although the beach is small but is very beautiful and clean. Children enjoyed snorkelling. And above all, the breathtaking views of corals from glass boat were awesome.

title: Great Snorkling Place
review_text: It is the best place to do snorkeling. They either take you to Jolly Buoy or Red skin, both are same. But if you want to try your hand on snorkeling, don't go anywhere else. Come here. It is a half day trip. They show good range of corals, fishes and sea cucumber. Must visit.

title: Jolly Buoy -A must for snorkelling
review_text: Our last day in andamans saw us travel in a Hyundai car to Jolly buoy which is located at Wandoor ( 30 KM’s) from Port Blair( Rs 2100 ,including trip, ferry tickets and entry permit for two) .we left our hotel at 8 am ,the journey was picturesque and we saw many water bodies which our driver explained were not lakes but happened due to the Tsunami . From Wandoor we got in to the ferry taking us to Jolly buoy. It takes 45 min to reach from Wandoor jetty to Jolly Buoy. The ferry ride will make you see nature in full bloom .Tall trees on both sides of the sea ,clean water bodies till the eye can see.Jolly Buoy is one of 150 islands which comes under the Mahatama Gandhi marine national park. Plastics (bottles or bag) are not allowed here and you can get a thermos flask to fill water (deposit of Rs 100) at Wandoor jetty.It is very small island which has good coral life,clean water .ideal for a day picnic .note there are no shops here so you need to get your food and water .As a part of the package we get a free 10 min Snorkeling trip or glass bottom boat trip.But if you pay them more the swimmer will take you further where the sea life is really beautiful. I preferred to Snorkel while my wife decided to go on the glass... Our last day in andamans saw us travel in a Hyundai car to Jolly buoy which is located at Wandoor ( 30 KM’s) from Port Blair( Rs 2100 ,including trip, ferry tickets and entry permit for two) .we left our hotel at 8 am ,the journey was picturesque and we saw many water bodies which our driver explained were not lakes but happened due to the Tsunami . From Wandoor we got in to the ferry taking us to Jolly buoy. It takes 45 min to reach from Wandoor jetty to Jolly Buoy. The ferry ride will make you see nature in full bloom .Tall trees on both sides of the sea ,clean water bodies till the eye can see.Jolly Buoy is one of 150 islands which comes under the Mahatama Gandhi marine national park. Plastics (bottles or bag) are not allowed here and you can get a thermos flask to fill water (deposit of Rs 100) at Wandoor jetty.It is very small island which has good coral life,clean water .ideal for a day picnic .note there are no shops here so you need to get your food and water .As a part of the package we get a free 10 min Snorkeling trip or glass bottom boat trip.But if you pay them more the swimmer will take you further where the sea life is really beautiful. I preferred to Snorkel while my wife decided to go on the glass bottom boat.While snorkeling I made a stunt of diving under water to touch a live coral and a star fish and came out gasping for breath. We had our pre-packed lunch (simple Puri bhajji) by the sea shore and had a great time watching the scenery .Here you can see crystal clear water,sparking sand and also the turquoise blue water changing to emerald green at some distance. Ensure you wear some thing comfortable. carry towel,sunglasses,cap with you .Make sure you take plenty of water .Time spent at the island would be around three hours .On the way back our driver was kind enough to takes us to Wandoor beach ( 2km away from Wandoor jetty) .There we saw lots of hugh uprooted tree’s which were still kept as witness to the havoc that the Tsunami had caused. More

title: Great Experience for Snorkleing, Mangrove & Beach
review_text: The fishes are really colorful & large. Please carry lots of water. Take dry clothes with u. The changing rooms on the island is very basic. Wear easy to change clothes. Carry some light refreshments. Carry some sweet water, its imp to wash away the salty water before u change and come back 3 hrs to ur hotel.

title: Corol Retreat
review_text:
One can go for scorkeling here. Polethene bags are not allowed. What i find funny and also sad..the boat had safety jackets neatly piled up and not placed at arms reach... 
A must vist place

title: not so lesser known anymore
review_text:
if you can endure swarms of budget tourists jostling for space in the creaky boats, smell of kerosene for an hour and back (to and fro wandoor jetty), hunger from 9.00 am to 2.30 pm- a trip to Jolly Buoy is worth it. paltry discounts you need to make for a dekko at some of the most astonishing marine life you'll come across. snorkelling here is a must. 

a small tip, though your boat tickets from wandoor covers a free 5 minute snorkelling exercise and a glass boat ride to the shore, that's not the real thing. ask any of the locals on the boat for an additional snorkelling experience (ranging between 30 mins to an hour, 200 rs to 1000 rs) where they take you further to see the real thing. a half day trip from port blair that's really worth it. and you'll be back just in time to witness the light and sound show at the cellular jail More

title: wonderful experience
review_text: This is the must go place if you are in Port blair. We did snorkling here.The sea was very clear.You can also see sea creatures and reefs through glass boat.I'm sure that the blue-green water of the sea will mesmerize everyone.

title: Jolly Good Buoy
review_text:
Well my first experience of Snorkelling happened at Jolly Buoy, so it will always have a special place for me. But what I heard from people is that after the tsunami of 2004, it is now half as good as it was prior to that. But I felt, for a first timer, it was good enough. I had fun snorkeling and playing around in the water with my son. But if one has the scope and time and budget, as per the popular suggestion, they should go to elephant beach in havelock instead of Jolly Buoy. 

There are a couple of other factors going against Jolly Buoy: 
1. the distance from Port Blair Main city. 35 kms 
2. The slow ferry ride on the sea on outdated and exhausted ferries. 

One suggestion is that if you are not looking at snorkelling, then avoid Jolly Buoy, its not worth the effort going all the way there just to splash in the water on the beach. 

From what i saw , in a ferry that carried around 50 people only 3 - 4 people did snorkelling. Some go there pre-decided and some lose the nerve when it comes to actually doing it. But Jolly Buoy jaake snorkelling nahin kiya tho kya kiya. More

title: Pristine Beach
review_text: The best beach to do snorkelling and seeing the coral through glass bottom boat. The water is so clear and beach is very clean.

title: Jolly Buoy Island is a "Must Visit" destination in Andamans
review_text:
I recently visited Andaman Islands for a week. Jolly Buoy Island is a place which must not be missed at any cost. For a preview of Jolly Buoy island, you are welcome to visit my blog 
http://www. banjaran1949.blogspot.in/2012/04/jolly-buoy-island-andaman-nicobar.html

title: SUPERB BEACH!!!!!
review_text: You have to visit this beach from WANDOOR.It is 30km from port blair.To enter the park, you need entry permit.You have to buy tickets for visiting jolly buoy island from wandoor jetty.you can do snorkelling or glass bottom ride at jolly buoy island at a free cost as it is included in the ticket itself.remember the most important thing- Plastic bottles and bags are not permitted in the park and one need to deposit money for each bottle carried. The security deposit is Rs. 100 for up to 3 bottles. On completion of the trip, you are expected to show the required number of bottles to the forest official to claim your deposit.Jute bags are available in the forest office for hire.If you don't want to hire then better to carry water bottles and jute bags from hotel only.Take extra clothes while going to JOLLY BUOY as you can do swimming over there.A new attraction opened at WANDOOR i.e-MARINE INTERPRETATION CENTRE(a small museum of marine lifes).It will hardly take 10mnts to visit this museum.But you must visit this.In jolly buoy island there are separate changing rooms for boys and girls,but don't expect them to be very clean.Toilets are also there in this beach.Before going to this beach please carry eatables for your lunch and take sufficient drinking water as you will get nothing on that beach.Take hats or umbrella with you.While returning from jolly buoy or while going definately taste... The security deposit is Rs. 100 for up to 3 bottles. On completion of the trip, you are expected to show the required number of bottles to the forest official to claim your deposit.Jute bags are available in the forest office for hire.If you don't want to hire then better to carry water bottles and jute bags from hotel only.Take extra clothes while going to JOLLY BUOY as you can do swimming over there.A new attraction opened at WANDOOR i.e-MARINE INTERPRETATION CENTRE(a small museum of marine lifes).It will hardly take 10mnts to visit this museum.But you must visit this.In jolly buoy island there are separate changing rooms for boys and girls,but don't expect them to be very clean.Toilets are also there in this beach.Before going to this beach please carry eatables for your lunch and take sufficient drinking water as you will get nothing on that beach.Take hats or umbrella with you.While returning from jolly buoy or while going definately taste the coconut waters over there,it is very tasty specially known as king coconuts(rs 20).If you want to take videos of this island then please buy tickets for your handycams.With specs ON you can't do snorkelling. More

title: Love it
review_text: Snorkeling is awesome! the place is good, corals are excellent... love love love love.. my diver was stupid, he and the cluster of other divers were like.. oh look.. this is ablablablabla fiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiish! ... that was Hilarious

title: JOLLY BOY ISLAND
review_text:
located in the mahatma Gandhi marine nation park , jolly boy is one among the 15 islands located in the park .protected to conserve the rich marine bio diversity of the area and the moment is restricted without permission . 
One has to reach wandoor which is a village close to the park , by road 32 kms away from Port Blair .some of the other islands in the park are red skin island , tarmugli island , grab island etc....., 
tourist are allowed to visit two islands in the park red skin / jolly boy island . which is open for visit every 6 month alternatively .

title: excellent location
review_text: good for snorkelling,excellent view of marine life

title: Wow!
review_text:
I had no idea that in India we have such a well preserved marine national park. The corals and the under-water world is just spectacular. Please go to this place first before the tour operators con you into going to North Bay. This is an infinite times better spot. This is an un-inhabitated island open only for 5-6 hours a day for visitors. The number of visitors is limited by the number of boats that can go there in a day. You will be able to enjoy nature away from the busy (and dirty) beach scene that greets you at North Bay. 

I am secretly doubtful about the star fish they show here. These do not look real. However, you must go for snorkeling here. You will love it. I went for two rounds. More

title: Best Island to visit for marine life. Do not miss this
review_text:
I was surprise rather shocked that there are no reviews about this island. From where I start……ok This is a small island and you can take boat from Wandoor jetty. Charges for to and fro ride is INR 550/- per person (it includes 1 snorkeling OR bottom glass boat ride nearby Jolly Bouy Island). Do not keep plastic bags as this island is No plastic zone. To carry water, there provide you water bags on INR 5/- rent and 100/- deposit. Boat ride take around 40-45 min to reach there. Because of rich corals, they shift you in small glass bottom boats and then you entered on the most beautiful Island. Very IMP is, carry some snacks as Island is under national Marine Park so no food stalls. Island is very clean and water is crystal clear. They offer you free snorkeling OR bottom glass boat ride. If you like it then you can pay extra INR for longer ride. We did snorkeling and free snorkeling was just a trailer of marine life. We like it so we paid INR 400/-extra per person and he took us for 20-25 min ride. This experience was simply amazing. We saw a lot of corals, different types of fishes and 2 octopuses. We witness Breath taking underwater view of coral and marine life. We loved so much that we did snorkeling 3 times. Those who are scared of snorkeling then enjoy glass boat... I was surprise rather shocked that there are no reviews about this island. 
From where I start……ok 
This is a small island and you can take boat from Wandoor jetty. Charges for to and fro ride is INR 550/- per person (it includes 1 snorkeling OR bottom glass boat ride nearby Jolly Bouy Island). Do not keep plastic bags as this island is No plastic zone. To carry water, there provide you water bags on INR 5/- rent and 100/- deposit. Boat ride take around 40-45 min to reach there. 

Because of rich corals, they shift you in small glass bottom boats and then you entered on the most beautiful Island. Very IMP is, carry some snacks as Island is under national Marine Park so no food stalls. 

Island is very clean and water is crystal clear. They offer you free snorkeling OR bottom glass boat ride. If you like it then you can pay extra INR for longer ride. We did snorkeling and free snorkeling was just a trailer of marine life. We like it so we paid INR 400/-extra per person and he took us for 20-25 min ride. This experience was simply amazing. We saw a lot of corals, different types of fishes and 2 octopuses. We witness Breath taking underwater view of coral and marine life. We loved so much that we did snorkeling 3 times. 
Those who are scared of snorkeling then enjoy glass boat ride. By the way for snorkeling swimming is not at all required. 

Timings are: 
Boat sail from Wandoor at 9a.m. and same boat brings you back at around 2-2:30p.m.back to Wandoor. 
There are 2 – 3 boats sails at different timings. 

Tips: 
1. Do bargain rates for snorkeling if you wish to do twice. 
2. Don’t miss coconut water outside Wandoor jetty. Tasty and hug size coconut in just INR 20/- More
